reviews.text: Trying to figure out why this place is a 3 Michelin Star restaurant....  The service was amazing, but there are no words to describe the level of disappointment with how bland the food is. I kept hoping I would be WOWed, but ended the meal w a level of guilt for paying close to $450 for subpar, tiny, buttery food. I do not recommend. Entirely wayyyy toooo expensive.!!!!!!!!!!

I'll keep my review concisely focused on our experience, as the food is consistent and highlighted extensively in other reviews. For background, we had the discovery menu for two a few weeks prior to this review.

We've been lucky enough to eat here three times - once at the original location and twice at the new one. To be honest, we both really enjoyed the ambiance at the original location better. The food is still great, although it's not as surprising after the first experience. I wish they had changed things up as a lot of time had passed between the visits. This generally means that we will be unlikely to ever go back unless we hear of a shift in the menu or style, etc.. That said, the food and the inventiveness is impeccable. The staff are fun and friendly, giving Saison a lightness that offsets the seriousness of the very-visible kitchen. Watching the kitchen is still fascinating, and the whole team is (as I recall) wonderfully diverse, which we noticed.
good food. worth going back.
Factory Dining

From the viewpoint of two avid foodies who have dined in the best restaurants around the world, Saison is a destination unto itself. The discovery menu and the wine pairings blew us away! Impeccable, attentive, yet unintrusive service is definitely something to write home about. Ask for a table opposite the kitchen: watching these masters work was like listening to a perfectly orchestrated and executed symphony! Bottom line, from stem- and tableware selections to the restrooms smelling like a flower garden, no detail in this place is overlooked! Simply perfect!  If you can bear the prices, make a point to try this fantastic food temple! Bravo, Chef Josh and team! Congrats on the very well deserved 3 Michellin stars!

The service was amazing. I sat at the bar, which I believe made my experience even better, as I got to watch Samuel make all the cocktails and mocktails. He even creates his own drinks to cater to what taste he thinks you prefer. Definitely get one of those!
A different kind of degustation... flavors are clean and light that you will not feel bloated after the meal.
A serious focus on food.
For our 7th year anniversary we decided to splurge,

I had their tasting menu and my dining companion as well but with wine pairing. And we were seated at the bar. I could not even remember how many courses it was.  Food kept coming! Food was inventive and thoughtful as I would expect. And I appreciated that each course was presented by someone who actually cook in the kitchen.  When the bill was settled, they brought my car key with the receipt.  It was nice touch!  The bill was about $1000 including the tip! Ugh. Overall great food, great service, and nice ambiance.  So you know you have to factor the high price in my review... was it worth $1000? Personally I am not sure.  However I am positive that you will impress any dining companion if you treat her/him here.  :)

We are here celebrating my husband bday today. Everything is perfect, food, service and environment. However one thing is really disturbing. The cute chef keep licking the spoon after he placed food into the bowl. Everytime he lick it he will wipe it with the towel he has..... Is that really disgusting?!?!? It doesn't happen once it happens everytime he places good. Guess how many germs u get from this cute looking chef!!
This is by far the best restaurant I have been to in San Francisco.

Wonderful dining experience.....Saison is a very warm and inviting space, with all staff members working in concert to make sure we felt welcome, special, and completely invited to enter there culinary world. We went on a wine night, so there were less dishes and more wine tastings, but some food highlights included a smoked trout in a warm broth, their "fire in the sky" slow-roasted beet, and bites of fire-roasted lamb. Although extremely expensive, I would actually go again some time.

My second time eating there and was surprised that another table next to ours got a different version of a dish with a really NICE piece of UNI on it. I asked why, and was brushed off as something "Chef" decides. If "Chef" decides, you might want to inquire with the CHEF to put you on the good list so you get the better ingredients/dishes. Since the menu has only one option (no upgrades) just left us feeling confused why this other table got better ingredients then us.

Came here for my birthday and I was very delighted with the whole experience. I made reservations a few weeks in advance and even then the only dinner reservation they had available was 5.30 pm but since I wanted to go here on my birthday, I took it. The waitress told me that our table had a view, and I wondered what view she was talking about given the location. Once there, I found out what the view was; the kitchen! We were seated right across from the kitchen where the magic happens, I could look at those chefs meticulously cooking and plating all night long. We had a corner table and the pillows just make you feel at home!
This update is just for the bar.
I had to save my 2500th review because I wanted to make it something special.

Was it worth it? If you like metro men in suits coming out explaining every single dish. Haha. This was a bit entertaining. On a serious note, it was nice the chefs (sous, pastry, etc, but not Skenes himself) came out to present each dish. The bill was over $3k for a party of 5. I didn't even do the wine pairings due to my current condition.
The parade of spoons!!
Exceptional food and service. Have showned their placement in the world ranking. Food was very well prepared very detailed. Plating equipment was very delicate. Will hope to see them climb up more!
Mind blowing. The best Michelin star restaurant I have been to by far.

These people are doing some of the most meticulous and interesting food anywhere, and they seem to be able to charge for it.  It's kind of a weird combination of casual and exceptionally fancy, though.  Perhaps it's a conflict between customer expectations given the price and a desire for a more casual experience on the part of the restaurant.

We has the 21 course tasting menu and it was a great experience. We are world travelers and foodies and give it 9.5 yo. 9.8 out of 10   This is one of the top 10 places we dined at.  Most dishes were close to a wow with 2-3 wow dishes. The uni with avocado and the ribeye were clear wows. Only suggestion was they should give petty-fords at the end. To me anyone giving this a negative review is not a foodie and or does not have the money to fine at fine dining    This just a tad shy of French laundry and similar to places like Altiere-creme. I would go back
With Saison's new digs came an exorbitant new price tag: a $248/person menu with no booze. Pre-tax. Pre-tip. And, that's the cheapest menu.
Items Enjoyed:
Food - Epic
Food : 3.8 stars
Took the bf here for his birthday and this is the best restaurant in SF.  I dare you to find better :)   Saison for SF is like how EMP is for NYC.
Exorbitantly expensive for one of the most disappointing Michelin star meals I've ever had.
Be prepared to be a balla here just like at Benu.

Well...I've been here 4-5 times, the first of which was when they rented out the kitchen at their old location a couple of times a week and had a few seatings every week based on when they rented it out. I must say that I miss that experience (and price).

If you do not love fish, chances are you won't love Saison.  Luckily, we love fish.  On the regular tasting menu ($248.) out of 13 courses, 6 were fish (1 raw, 4 cooked, 1 caviar), 2 vegetables, 1 pigeon.  There was one I just can't remember other than it was a savory course with chocolate (very little) and foam on top.  It was some kind of whipped liver.  Very rich.  We really enjoyed it!  LOL
Oh how I wanted to love you, Saison. My date and I were really looking forward to the 20 course tasting menu and accompanying beverage pairings. Yet, here is where I struggle...
Splendid food and elegant presentations with a positive note on the service, too.  I've eaten, and actually enjoyed, certain edibles here that I had never had imagined trying.  It's that yummy.

Went here to celebrate a birthday.  They split the menu into two prices, one for $248 and another "discovery tasting" for $398.  We opted for the $248 meal.  We got a bottle of wine for the table.  After everything was said and done, the total came out to around $350 per person.
3-4 stars for the food, 2-3 stars for the service (I've been sitting on this review for over a year now, so things could have changed drastically by now..).

Speechless ...both the food and the service! Me and my mom went with the tasting menu, fantastic! the fish was fresh and tasty ...carefully prepared(eye witnessed, our table were facing the kitchen), the chef actually brought the food to us, extra points! and we were so lucky, the chef wrote down several restaurant recommendations in Chicago(special thanks to our awesome Maitre D'- Matthew who asked chef the favor) ...yes, we gonna try all of them! and cup of buckwheat tea and small treats before you checkout ...and a bag of small treats before you leave ...I mean, it was an awesome experience regardless of the price ...we felt very welcomed, cozy and comfortable from the beginning to the end ...Definitely coming back =D
Absolutely one of the best in SF!
Best meal of my life, go for the Discovery Menu! Expensive, but worth every penny. The cost for the most part is going straight into the ingredients/preparation.
Friendly people, great prices. I go there at least weekly.

What a great place to enjoy a cup of Java and an "And".  The bookstore and park like ambiance is really special - kind of like having your Barnes & Noble ALS San Fran Style!  The wholesome fixing are super - try the Carrot Juice and other health stuff.  Loving it....
Best spot to stop for a pre-game drink and sandwich!  The prices are better than anything in the neighborhood and so is the food!
Waaaaay overdue review.
Great place for lunch. Food is pretty good and everyone is friendly.
Good value and also has a nice selection of books and magazines (to buy). The little garden is very pretty and seems family/dog friendly.

My favourite coffee shop in San Francisco and possibly ever. The staff are the greatest, the food is freshly prepared or baked on site and the prices cannot be beaten. On top of all of that the Delancey St. Foundation is doing amazing things for what seems like amazing people. Ice cream scoops are massive, coffee refills are free, indoor and outdoor seating and even beer and wine.  We are lucky to live in the same neighbourhood.
Cheap eats. Love this place. Ambience is very relaxing. No Wifi BUT there are books/magazines around that you can read. It's a quiet place so you can get a lot of things done. Friendly service.

Apple tea slice is to die for.This place is a unique joint with books coffee desserts to dive in.I have also tried and loved the berry smoothie.This place is amazing for dessert and drink lovers.Desserts dont seem to rotate or change often though.

Atmosphere: Order at the front, bring a number to your table, food is delivered, and when you're done, plates can be left on the tables (or brought to a nearby basin next to the trash can). Great for studying or chatting with friends. Seating is  mismatched and haphazard which works for 1 person or as many as 6 (with 4 being ideal) as it includes benches, small/large tables and sofas with coffee tables.
Fantastic gem in SoMa. Delicious sandwiches. Great atmosphere and outdoor seating. This place is my little secret.

Favorite SF place, ever! Food is delicious, prices are amazingly reasonable - no where better in SF for that, for sure - staff is AWESOME, and to add to all that, they have both a lovely outside garden area that is big, full of trees and flowers, and peaceful. Oh, and my other favorite attribute is the bookstore and cool gift area. I usually have b'fast or lunch, tea, and buy books and gifts all in one fell swoop. Lastly, parking is usually available right outside. Can you think of any other place in SF that has all this?
Unforgettable pie.
Great cute spot with good atmosphere! Very friendly service and good food! I didn't give 5 stars because of 1 register, 2 persons on kitchen and huge line on Sunday morning!

Best damn tuna melt of my life. The tuna was fresh and the sandwich itself was perfectly grilled. Four stars because of the slow service. I waited a long time for my food and it was mostly empty in there.

So the menu on this page isnt correct with their actual menu so I was bit disappointed when I walked in and they didnt have some stuff. This place gets really busy at lunch but over all pretty good. Sometimes the service isnt that good and the people behind the counter are playing around and dont notice your waiting to be helped.
Had a bagel with lox and it was amazing! Great outdoor patio. Would definitely recommend!
Great hidden gem. Perfect lunch place, coffee, and desserts! Great prices with gorgeous garden seating!

The whole place is cool i would definitely be back here. It has a whole outside seating area thats very relaxing. You can eat and read at the same damn time. The inside is like a coffee shop/ library.
Very nice and affordable place, great for breakfast and lunch!
This place is on my way to work and I love it for a few reasons:

My go to place after appointments and city activities. Since I have had the pleasure of the delicious meals as a disabled individual the staff goes out of their way to be genuine and warm. Delicious salmon crapes, great grilled sandwiches, and interesting platters. My favorite is the chocolate cake made from scratch!
Very disappointed. Poor service, poor food, and 30 minute wait during off-peak hours.

Really nice little discovery.  Was introduced to this place by a friend who works near-by.  Plenty of metered parking right in front for a Friday lunch (on a non-game day!).  Got there early, so I spent some time browsing their small (but well stocked) bookstore.

I guess I'll have to come back here some day to try some more things on their menu, but I grabbed a small bite when I was here to meet someone and didn't think it was all that spectacular. I can see the appeal of it as a place to just sit, read, and sip on coffee or nimble on some food, though. It certainly has a large enough space for you to chill alone or with a group.
They have super cheap good coffee,
Great service, good food, and excellent prices, what more can I say? Oh location can't be beat either. Nice place to have lunch and support rehabilitation! Will definitely be back!
Wow, I was really pleasantly surprised at the great service and better yet great food here!
what a slice of heaven in busy San Francisco!
Nice place with good and affordable coffee and breakfast.
A surprising delight whilst walking down the street aimlessly for a decent joint to eat at on a Sunday afternoon, awesome!
I come here often for lunch, as my work is right next to Crossroads. I get two crepes, which is something I'm working on cutting down. But the spinach and cheese crepe is on point.

By far my favorite daily cafe and not just because it's nearby. Been coming here regularly for over 8 years now. Great setting (outdoor garden area, variety of seating options inside). Great service (most food is brought over to your table). Diverse menu (crepes, Mitchell's ice cream, wine & cheese, etc.). If asked there isn't much I'd ask them to improve on.
This is a great spot for a quick lunch or early dinner. The salads are fresh and filling. I find that the staff is friendly and helpful. The patio is really comfortable on a warm day.

I have to say, this place was one of my best experiences ever in San Francisco and given the circumstances of my day, it could have easily ended up being my worst.  After purchashing some used furniture nearby, my son and I decided to stop in here for a late lunch. We just happened upon it accidentally because we were looking for a place to park, assuming we would have to walk a ways to eat somewhere. There were plenty of open, pay parking spots right in front and a number of cute shops nearby.
Great food! Tasty drinks! Awesome service! Great location! Relaxing environment. This place is a rare gem in the SoMa, and you won't find anything like it around.
I adore this place so much. It is part bookstore, coffee shop, cafe, and garden. Love the tables all throughout - unlike most bookstores that make sure to keep dining area separate.

Wandered over with some coworkers to grab a healthy lunch.  Great selection of options to suit most people - healthy and not so healthy.  Sandwiches, paninis, salads, crepes (sweet and savory), small plates, etc.  Not to mention they've got beer, wine, ice cream and coffee.

A cozy place with beautiful patio and an interesting small store. Child-friendly. Fair prices and delicious ice creams and milkshakes. No free wi-fi and my mobile wi-fi didn't work well there, but sometimes it's not so bad to be internet free.

I know some people who go to crossroads constantly. I really don't understand it. The food is average at best. The venue is kind of nifty the first time you go, but wore on me very quickly. The service can be slow as well. This place is kind of a cross between like Starbucks and Panera bread, but it's kind of also the worst of both in my opinion.
I ordered the cheeseburger with egg and bought 4 bags of chicharrones.
4505 Meats is decent. If you love salt, you'll LOVE this place. They literally drop the salt bomb on everything!

I'm confused why this location of 4505 has such high reviews, and I hope the NoPa one is better and contributing to this hype. I've heard good things about the meat here, but it is honestly lackluster and the burgers are put together with the thought of a $3 burger, not a $9 one.
Very disappointed by the brisket sandwich. It was mostly a $13.50 cole slaw sandwich. It really put to shame the word brisket.
4505 Meats! They have a food stand on Thursdays at the Ferry Building for the farmer's market. It's one tiny stand but they serve up a lot of meat.

Apparently they don't allow you to choose 2 of the same meats in the combo plate (comes with 3 meats) but this was not posted anywhere. I do not eat pork for religious reasons, but they refused to accommodate even though there were only 2 non-pork options...wouldn't even double up on chicken even though it was the cheapest option on the menu. They will not be receiving my business again.

Beef brisket sandwich. Most disgusting beef / sandwich I ever had in my life. All tasted like the chewy slimey greasy blubbery animal fat u throw away. Horrific. Can't believe I paid $14 for this. So nasty. Never again. Never.
That burger was amazing. No need for further review or comment.
Another hunt for the best burger in the bay since Disco Volante died (RIP).
Stopped by to try the burger - it was really good! I'll try a few other things next week.

Had the Maple Bacon Breakfast Sausage there last weekend.  It definitely did not live up to the hype. Despite all the fixings on the sandwich, it was devoid of any taste.  You would think sausage would be naturally salty, but there was no hint of salt or seasoning (it was also surprisingly rubbery).  It's a shame the taste didn't match the presentation.  Seriously, a microwaveable Jimmy Dean sandwich would've been more satisfying.  I'm giving 1 star for presentation...would've been 2 stars if not for the $9 price tag.

The beef brisket sandwich is the bomb but at $ 13+ including tax where do you draw the line ?  I would give it five stars but the price is prohibitive.  The sandwich is definitely quality but on the smaller size.  Simply the most tasty around period.

the food here looks delicious but isn't that great. my boyfriend and I got the best damn cheeseburger, the hot dog, and the garlic fries. usually, I love extra sauce on all my foods but the fries were just way too overpowering. we only ate half of it and it got worse and worse throughout the bites so we ended up throwing it away. the hot dog was full of flavor but it would be even better if they had grilled onions and bell peppers on top. the cheeseburger isn't too bad as well but it wasn't amazing. worth the try though!

I just had their pulled pork sandwich yesterday, and it was more like a pickle sandwich with slaw, pepper and some pork.  My wife ordered the same since they were completely out of the brisket, and quickly regretted it. We both complained about the amount of pepper used and had to throw them away.
Love their cheeseburgers and hamburgers. Some of the best burgers in town.

I love 4505 meats for their sandwiches and their chicharrones. I like visiting them at the Ferry Building on Saturdays.  Their sandwiches are delicious and reasonably priced but their chircharrones are where it's at. I like chiccharones but after tasting a 4505 meat one, it was like ok this is what all chicharrones should be measured against, they are so tasty.  They are little pockets of light pork goodness. I have eaten them from both large and small bags and may be partial to the small size bags becaues I like the smaller sized chicharrones but that may just be me.  Glad to see they have a store in the Mission now.
This is a tasty burger!
I've never met a BBQ I didn't like. Except today.

Outstanding BBQ. I've eaten the brisket twice and I assure you it is inspired. Today's side was baked beans -- equally inspired. Worth the wait. Worth the cost (skip dinner or eat a crappy Banquet's frozen entree).
Best Brisket! Winning ribs... the sides are too rich for me but the Farmer's Market Organic salad is so fresh, beautiful, and satisfying to have with your brisket.

The maple sausage sandwich was delicious. I shared with my son, but he loved the sausage so much, he ate most of mine too.  The cheeseburger was very good. I could taste the quality of the meat. It has a sauce that's similar to In N Out sauce but better. Would I say it's the best burger ever? Not for me, but it's definitely up there.
WOW! WOW! The first wow was for the freaking line. I waited almost an hour for this. The whole time I was thinking it better be worth it!
The chicken fried steak was GOOD, but it was the messiest thing I've eaten in awhile.  Talk about a chunk of meat that my teeth just weren't sharp enough for.  Argh.

4505 Meats seems to be known for their cheeseburger, but unfortunately they didn't have it on the day that I was at the Ferry Building Farmer's Market. I settled on the pulled pork sandwich, which was packed with very flavorful and tender pulled pork, but was an overall average sandwich. The bun itself was buttery and had a good crunch on it, providing a good balance to the fall-apart meat and the crunchy slaw inside. I liked the addition of the pickles inside to add an extra brightness to the otherwise heavy, bold-flavored sandwich. The sandwich is definitely on the expensive side, weighing in at $11 for a decent size sandwich that will probably be snack-sized for big eaters.

If you find yourself at the farmer's market Saturday afternoon and are craving a little something, something to hold you over.  Keep your eyes peeled for 4505 meats (Not for vegans).  They offer very tempting bags of chicherrons (They will be mine. Next time they will be mine). I went for the classic cheeseburger. 1/3 pound patty with a slice of cheddar, lettuce, tomato and mayo. I chose to "level up" with one farm fresh egg (over easy). With a dollop of dijon mustard and ketchup on the side, my first bite couldn't have sold me faster.  The meat was tender and juicy, the yolk from the egg slowly integrated with each and every layer of the burger. Rich, juicy, well seasoned, and beautifully cooked. This burger met my expectations. However, it's slightly overpriced, and not worth making a trip down there due to the tremendously annoying hoard of people aimlessly wandering around.

My go to Saturday morning breakfast spot...nothing bad on the menu but my favorite is the burger...eat it as they serve it (nothing else is needed).  If more than water is required, their iced tea is simple and legitimate...finally, the staff is polite and friendly...I'll be there tomorrow.  JA
Kinda sad and disappointed. I came here for lunch and was soooooo ready for their juicy cheeseburger w/ an egg but no go. Apparently, they didn't have the burger today (only Saturdays...?), only BBQ.

I've been eating their food since 2011 and I'm noticing a downward slide. The meat on the burger isn't the same even though the sauce is still good. A few months ago I had one of the worst briskets here. Maybe there are too many butcher/burger/bbq places opening up in the city and everything is becoming stale but I use to enjoy this place. Now its getting pricey for something less memorable. I hope the tide turns for them and everything goes up again. And what's up with the tax? It's a farmers market just include it in the price or something easy. No one wants random change in their pocket.

Got a brisket sandwich just before closing; not super cheap at $12, but pretty good and quick. Perfect portion size; filling but reasonable enough for me to get back on the bike and across town without regrets.
Okay, I'm just to go and say, oh my goodness. I've had a fair share of burgers before, but I couldn't imagine eating the best cheeseburger at a farmers market.

Just finished a great brisket sandwich.  It looked small-ish from a distance, but it is loaded with meat.  In fact, the ratio of bread, meat, and coleslaw is pretty much perfect.  I will definitely be back to try the other sandwiches.
One small bag of chicharrones for $3.50 is outrageous.  They taste like normal pork rinds with not enough flavoring.
Yummy fried Mac and cheese ! The hot dog is delicious ! 2 x more hot dog then bread ! The burger is next on my list
Tried the 4505 Bacon stuffed dog Zilla style, although I'm not a fan of kimchi, it was very, very good.  Would definitely have again.
Simplicity and quality. period.
Although I am blinded by my infatuation with the Porchetta Sandwich at Roli Roti
the burger: it was not nearly as awesome as i thought it would be... just average.

It is more the hypes of food stands  and the small selection on farmers market.  The food was okay but not as great as all the rating out there.  I had the Lamb hotdog, please don't get that.  The taste of lamb is pretty authentic but the price for a hotdog is too much, I will need like 3 to get satisfied.  The chicharron were pretty good, but really a small bag is to share, except if you can take that much fat in.  It is really a guilty sensation each those chicharrones almost sinful for your own health.
Best damn cheeseburger ever? Not even close.
I've been to this food stand SO many times now that I can't count. Farmers markets, Outside Lands... no matter where they stand, I'm a regular.
Wow...lunch at Boulevard. Outstanding food and service. Great people. Really great food.
Good location if you are coming from the East Bay.  Great food.  Good service.  My only negative is the portions are relatively small for the money, but that is somewhat expected for the quality.

One of my go to restaurants in SF. Go here for the dinner menu, the lunch offerings aren't as good. I've gotten the filet mignon every single time, and it never disappoints. The quality of the beef is on point, and the flavor is amazing. Cocktails are especially good here, although they are quite pricey. It's hard to get reservations, so you either have to plan in advance or get bar seating.
One of the best restaurants in the city . Peter and his team are first rate .

Oh la la Ladies and Gents... Get pretty and dine on pretty things.  I am so lucky my husband decided to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary here.  We honeymooned in Paris so this was quite fitting for the taste and senses of a year ago...
Great place for special occasions.
We came here for a Team dinner and it was really good.

With so many top restaurants in SF, I haven't been to Boulevard in years.  My memories of it were:  very good food; service not bad but not stellar either.  My current review will say that the food is still very good, and our table staff service was also very good and sincerely personable.  Physical ambience lovely.
Had dinner here with my boyfriend and his family last night, and the food was exceptional!
Came here for work lunch (cellar room!) and had a great meal.

Had a celebratory work lunch here. Exceptional food and service. Intimate, old-school feel. I had the salmon and it was fantastic. Our team several desserts and they were all bomb. PS Had a bite of someone else's burger and it was divine!
i've been to Boulevard many times and they never disappoint...
I ate here on a Friday night with some girl friends and had a great time. It was filled with diners and seems like a great date night or family dinner venue.

My mother and I came here for dinner. It was highly recommended by friends who have excellent taste. We had an excellent experience. The ambiance was stylish. At the right table towards the rear of the restaurant, if you're lucky to be seated there, you will enjoy views of the bridge and the bay.  We were promptly seated on time for our 6 pm reservation.
Beautiful restaurant, and great view of the ferry building.

Husband took several business partners for dinner. Everything was very good, Problem...he ordered a very large steak (porterhouse or something) he was only able to eat a quarter of it and asked that it be boxed. Is that such a no no in this fancy restaurant? Well lo and behold when he got home he went to give our labrador a treat, unfortunately all the meat had been cut off the bone and he was sent home with just a bone. Pathetic.

Boulevard continues to be our goto place for a romantic dinner or where we take family members for a special dinner.  Their service is top notch and is unsurpassable as seen when the servers continually, without being annoying, asked us if we needed anything and even went so far as sticking something under our table leg when from afar they noticed that out table was a bit wobbly.  The food is memorable, savory, and the portions are appropriate.  The crab cakes were to die for and were the best we ever had, as they were cooked to perfection, made from quality meat (not just a bunch of claw meat or breading) and our main meals were beyond delicious.  As my husband and I work so hard we occasionally need a special night out and Boulevard continues to be the restaurant we visit for special occasions or when we feel we need to treat ourselves to the best food and service.

Came here to grab dinner with a few friends. Located in Embarcadero, it definitely fits into the neighborhood with its upscale ambiance. Food and service were both mostly solid, with only a few hiccups.

I think this restaurant just gets a lot of attention becasue of its location but it's nothing special given the myriad of exceptional restaurants in the city. I ordered their "seasonal chicken salad" for lunch and it was hands down the worst lunch salad I have ever had in a restaurant. No flavor, no thought went into it, no richness or complexity. Just a bunch of random ingredients that don't make sense together thrown on a plate.....second time eating here and I don't think I'll be back.
3 of us had dinner and each one of us raved. Great appetizers (lobster ravioli, ahi tuna tartar, artichoke salad) followed by great mains, finishing with awesome deserts.  Superb service. Yahtzee!

Though this has been on my list for years... we wound up here rather spontaneously, as their other restaurant, Prospect, was closed. We walked in without a reservation and the very friendly front of the house sent us to the bar and had us seated within 20 minutes or so.
Since its beginning Boulevard has stuck with its original concept and it works!

Overall its good, not outstanding or innovative. The steak was sub-par in quality. I was surprised it has a Michelin star. I probably should have ordered the pork chop, that looked good. The ambiance is excellent. Service impeccable.

Went here for my birthday dinner and exceptional food and service. The price tag was higher than comparable places in nyc but having tried other places in sf - it's on par with price. Notable wine list and knowledgeable servers with pairings.

I had dinner here last week with 2 other colleagues.  The restaurant has a warm ambiance and the food is good but not exceptional.  The service was professional.  I will definitely return for a business dinner, but probably won't for any special occasion or if I'm looking for an exceptional dining experience.
I was a little skeptical because just because a restaurant is popular doesn't  always means it measures up where it matters - the food.

Big disappointment... Not going back for sure! I actually didn't even finish my food it was so bad. My husband got the salmon and it was also really bad! To top it off our server was bizarre, totally inappropriate with his comments. So much hype for nothing.

Maybe I'm getting too old, or have been to too many great meals.  As lovely as this restaurant is, it did not show me anything new, and I found this disappointing.  Dined here for the first time last night, a birthday celebration.  Everything we ordered was fine, but nothing particularly impressed or dazzled us, which, for the price, we rather expected.  That's my first (limp) complaint.  My second complaint is more serious.  It reeked.  They have a very serious oven venting problem (or so said the very competent waiter when I asked, and who on his own initiative removed the cost of our desserts from the bill due to the 'atmosphere').  All of a sudden we would get an overwhelming stench of something like sterno, which would pass in 5 minutes.  Then another blast of something more carbon-like (like the smell of animal fat soaked briquets?) from the oven.  It seriously detracted from enjoyment of our meal and MANAGEMENT SHOULD SOLVE THIS PROBLEM.

The whole experience here was fantastic.  We got there super early for a 9pm res so we sat at the bar and had a couple drinks (the bees knees - whoa! and some good pinot).  We were seated near the back of the restaurant with a nice view of the lighted bay bridge.  Service was excellent the whole time - we didn't feel bothered, but never waited for anything we needed.  Now I can't remember what we had (squab, I think, and maybe lamb) and apps... whatever it was, it was delicious, all of it.  We'll definitely be back here!

Just had lunch here today while taking care some business in the Embarcadero. I was welcomed with warmth from everyone the moment I stepped into the door to being seated. Unfortunately, things went downhill from there.

We had a reservation for 6:30, arrived at 6:25 - we were seated as soon as we walking in the door. The tables for two are a little small - but the ambiance is really nice. Great food, great location. Valet was easy and quick.

Great service. 8:15 reservation. Place was packed, got seated immediately, at a table with a view of the Bay Bridge light show. Excellent service. Two salads ordered, heirloom tomato and Avocado/Hearts of Palm and Truffle... Both great. The four of us ordered quail, pork chop, lamb t-bone and sole. Every entree was full of amazing flavors, we sampled from each other! We brought one bottle of wine and purchased one bottle, so no corkage on the one we brought. Will definitely return. Highly recommend!
Came here for my birthday dinner!

We were 15 minutes late to our dinner reservation but we didn't have a problem at all, even though it was packed. Had an ahi tuna dish as an appetizer and it was delicious. Tried the berkshire pork and it equally as tasty. Portions are (arguably) small but I thought they were just right. The food is very high quality, as it should be for the price. Service was very professional. Well done, Boulevard, well done.

I gave this place 2 stars for the wine, as the food and place was average at best. We had the swordfish, and pork, but both meals were boring, unimaginative, and lacking accompaniments to make them stand out.  The place is loud, and crowded, when the waiter asked me how the meal was, and I explained the above, he advised that due to being so busy, they have to make the meals with Subtle  tastes.  Very disappointed in this place after reading the reviews on here.

I went to Boulevard with some friends and we had a wonderful time. We started off with a special pasta dish to share with white truffles, which was absolutely fabulous. I recommend not sharing it, and getting it as your starter. For main dishes I would highly recommend the Kurabuta Pork or the Filet of beef. Both were excellent dishes. We passed on the dessert and went with a cheese plate. The cheese plate is good, but not great. Nobody beats Garyo Danko for cheeses. The restaurant was packed like always, even 5 years ago during the recession. The service was pretty good, and I recommend getting the table in the back of the restaurant so you can enjoy the views of the Bay Bridge both for dinner and lunch. Overall, a great place to come enjoy a fine meal with friends or on date night. A little tweaks here and there and this place will be 5 stars on my list. Boulevard isn't going anywhere for years to come during good times and even the bad times of the economy. This place is here to stay and great location as well.
Good service, good food.

Wonderful experience at the Boulevard. My boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and wanted to try a place that fit our foodie needs/wants. The presentation of the food was spot on and the service complimented the experience perfectly. Our waitress was very knowledgable about the food including origin, how it was prepared and how she would suggest we remake the dishes at our own home. Very happy with the experience and my boyfriend and I look forward to visiting again with our friends.
Our go-to place in San Francisco. Love the food and decor. I miss their orange creme brulee though. Hope they bring it back soon.
Everything on the menu looked wonderful. I had the pork chop which was amazing. The best jewel of the night was the Moscow Mule. Perfection!! I have it a four for the price and wait.
For lunch it's pricy at $10-$12 per item but as son as the good came out realized the portions are huge.
Fantastic. Ordered them for our office lunch and everyone was very happy which never happens. Great flavors!

Located inside Rincon Center, this little food counter has great South African food.  I sampled the Bunny Chow with Chicken (a hearty stew of chicken and simple veggies over a hollowed out fresh loaf of bread), but also noticed about 10-15 other menu options that I want to try.  Don't skip the hot sauce!

Amawele's was my first try at South African food. I got the Vegetarian Frikka Roll and it was amazing. I loved the sauces and the flavors in it. They have small boxes of Hot Sauce, which are good as well. I'd go back here for lunch any day.
This was my first experience with South African food. I absolutely loved it! You get a ton of food for a very reasonable price. Definitely will return.

Well this was delicious.  I went on a whim and was happy I did so!  I had their slap chip and it was spicy and lovely.  My friend had the sweet potato curry thing, which was also delicious.  I will warn that they mean the spicy, but it's not just heat-actually had spices involved in the spicy!  The food court vibe is not my favorite, but this place is worth going to.

They recommended the Durban Chicken Wrap as a first-timer, which they said was one of their most popular items.   For $7.50, I received a hefty roll with lots of chicken, potatoes, curry, and pickled veggies.  The wrap was delicious and very filling...sweet roti wrapper, spicy curry (good heat, but not overly spicy), and tart pickled veggies.  It's a great balance of flavor.   It's definitely a must-order the next time I'm in the area.
Them ladies know how to make killer African food. I walked in there a boy and after I ate their food I walked out a man.
I tried their Peri Peri chicken on a bed of quinoa. I usually hate quinoa but topped with the kitchen and their special (actually spicy!) hot sauce, it was a good, protein filled pairing.

The first time I walked by, the lines seemed long and I heard someone looking at he display case say the portions looked small. Not true. I've never waited more than five minutes for my food, and the portions have always been filling.

Delicious! Got the beef and rice because everything else was sold out. It was the best surprise dish I've ever had. Didn't have a clue what it would be and it ended up just being all these new yet familiar blends of tastes and spices in my mouth. Definitely go here!!!!!! At the back left corner of the Rincon 2. Also, the workers are super nice!!
I'm South African and it's a little bit of home every time I go there. The owners always have a welcoming smile and keen for a quick SA chat.

They have nothing for you if you don't like spicy.  Just sayin.  Really wish they had options for the rest of us!  My friend liked her food though, so that was good.  This also happens to be in the Rincon center, so I was able to go get some other food elsewhere.  I was kind of disappointed that I couldn't really try it.

Decided to try a new spot for lunch and saw that Amawele had high reviews. Located in the west corner of the food court at One Rincon, Amawele didn't have a very long line when I went there for lunch. The staff was nice enough, but the guy behind the register seemed a little rushed and not very attentive.
Fantastic! Food from home!! Ten stars. To anyone who writes a bad review or can't handle spicy food. Stick to bland. Pan era and Starbucks will always be there for you.

Eyes red, tears streaming and nose dribbling-call me a p*$$y but I couldn't even finish an eighth of my bunny chow.  I had four of my colleagues try it and they weren't able to take more than a bite!  It definitely packs in some flavor in addition to the heat though; I'll give it that.
Seriously good flavors with cardamon, star anise and hot chilies!  My mouth was on fire for 20 minutes but it was all good.
this place is great, the owners really do their best to make the food and the experience first class.
This is the gem of Rincon Center. The food is fantastic and unique. I got the meatball sandwich with vinegar fries in it and I loved every bite (it's menu name evades me at the moment).
Really solid food for a great price!

Grubbed on the chicken wrap the other day. Chicken breast cubes, lettuce and potatoes in a nondescript yellow curry sauce. The whole deal was wrapped up in a roti- not as flaky as the Indian varietals unfortunately. Overall good value in the FiDi for a quick bite but flavors were nothing to bring me back.

I ordered the Cafe Malay Bobotie with organic quinoa topped with sour cream and was not disappointed! There were unique spices (including cinnamon and star anise), spicy ground beef, veggies, and raisins in my bowl. It was topped with sour cream. It was like a party in my mouth! Best of all, it was gluten free (and it taste good!!)! The portion was pretty big and I ended up only eating half. While you wait in line to get your food, they have a fruity punchy water that you can help yourself to. You can also get some chili sauce to add an extra kick to the bowl. I will come back again and try other dishes!
I also missed the Bunny Chow, since they were out. Wondered what rabbit tastes like. ;)
Great option if you are on the Paleo diet.  Also good sized portions.  Service is super-slow at lunch as it seems they are understaffed.

When I want to feel like I'm eating a home cooked meal for lunch I know where to go.  Amaweles. They truly serve home cooking from the South African kitchen.  My favorite is the lemon herb chicken. Fresh and flavorful every time. Portions fill you up and you'll have some leftover for an evening delight.
in a fairly inconspicuous Mail building- good food, though a bit on the spicy side if you are not careful. The pineapple water was a bonus, have to try more items of the menu

I was searching for a new place that serves paleo friendly dishes, and I found Amawele's on Yelp!  I was excited to try the peri-peri chicken being a lover of beets and spicy food, and it did not disappoint.  The chicken is very spicy, even by my standards, and I loved it!  Great flavor, although could be considered slightly tart due to all of the hot sauce.  The beet salad was refreshing and the veggies were a nice addition.  I gave it minus one star because the restaurant was a bit difficult to find, and the menu is not self explanatory (unless you look at the display case which does not have all of the items).  I'm also not sure if I received a 1, 1.5, or 2 sized dish...I think it must have been 2 since it is enough for 2 meals.  I would say, however, just choose anything and it is probably delicious.  I will be back soon for the sweet potato curry or the other paleo beef dish.  Looking forward to it.
The place is in the back corner. A little bit hard to find. The food was decent, but the portion may not be what you expect. I come here once a while just for a change.
It was just ok.. a lot more european than I expected. Meat was rather dry.

Favorite new lunch spot. If you like spicy food this is a place to check out. It's quickly becoming popular and the lines are getting longer but the food is worth the wait. Very filling with lots of vegetables the different dishes are all worth trying.

Good food, good portion sizes, long wait. It took a pretty long time to get out food; I came at 12:40 and it took over 30 minutes to order and get my food, but it's really flavorful food and you get a lot for what you pay for. The bowl of quinoa I got had to be over a pound. The dish was quinoa spiced with curry and had a good mix of vegetables, broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, and some starchy one that seemed like a potato, but I wasn't quite sure.. It's a little spicy, which I really liked, but if sriracha is too spicy for you, then this might not be good to order. It was also pretty heavy(not just physically) given that it was only quinoa and veggies, so if you're looking for a light, simple lunch, this might not be the best.
Yelpers :STOP COMPLAINING ABOUT THE LINE!

My friend recommended me to try this place last weekend so I headed over here for lunch smack dab in the middle of lunch hour. I get there and there's a long queue of people waiting for their food. I initially thought that was a good sign so I lined up immediately.

Totally unique - such a hidden surprise in Rincon.  I have had the Frikadella, the Cape Malay Rice, and the Bunny Chow.  All good, but the Cape Malay is my favorite - something about that beef, veggie, and rice combo that has so much flavor.  Reasonably priced and they don't skimp on portions either.  Owners are using serving when I have been there and they are super cool nice girls.

My experience with Amawele's South African Kitchen has been one of the best in SF. If you are the type of person who enjoys the experience of an explosion of flavors in your mouth, this is definitely the place for you! They use bold spices and ingredients that honor authentic South African food, so what you are getting is for sure the real deal! If you go crazy about spicy food this is the place to go. Bunny Chow would be the way to go for having an spicy experience. For those who are taking care of their diet, the paleo meals are a great option. I personally like the chicken curry wrap, it has the perfect combination of flavors, it is not spicy and it is filling. I really like the wrap, which is called roti, NOT tortilla. Me being Hispanic, means that I know what a tortilla is and they are both very different. Roti is a traditional flat bread that complements many dishes in South African cuisine. It is usually handmade, rolled and cut into perfect circles. Amawele's roti have a some sweetness that adds an extra special touch to the chicken curry wrap. So, please do yourself a favor and go to Amaweles's South African Kitchen and have a meal experience that you will never forget!

I always get the Veggie Roti Wrap. It has butter beans, potatoes, carrot slices, and curry. It's delicious and has a good spice kick to it. The meal is very filling! I like my foods spicy so I always ask for extra of their homemade hot sauce. The gentleman who works there is always so polite and does more than just take your order. He makes my visit feel personal, and special by getting to know me. They also have free complimentary juice that they make. It's very good. Reminds me of water infused with fruit, but with more flavor.

If you get here at 11:59 am, right before the 12 o'clock rush you will be fine. The food here is unique and I would definitely recommend the Frikadella as its the best sandwich to have. Its a little bit spicy but its manageable.
Amawele surely cooks up some great smelling South African, spiced-up foods from their kitchen!
It's hidden gem in Rincon.  At first glance, it may not look like much at all, but the food is great.  Service was super nice, and very helpful to me when I wasn't sure what to order.
A co-worker of mine first tipped me off to Amawele's. She was having their Sweet Potato Curry with Beet Salad, which is super colorful and would attract anyone's eyes.

Ed, the manager for Super Duper contacted me and gave me his assurance that the issues would be rectified and encouraged me to give them another chance. I have gone back a few times and other than a couple of long waits, the issues appear to be resolved. I decided to up their rating to three stars and I will re-evaluate again after a couple more visits.

For a burger joint in the city, Super Duper is relatively good. Decent prices and fresh ingredients. The fries are also really good. Cashiers and servers are always nice to customers. Hard to beat this place when you're craving a burger.
I dropped in to this place around 6 in the evening on a weekday because I was starving and came out quite satisfied! So much so that I had to come back again the next day. At this place, I've tried:
the first time at this Super Duper but enjoyed it just like the others..

As the workday was coming to an end, my coworker approached me with a distraught look on his face. He was starving and the only thing that would satisfy him was a juicy tender american cheeseburger. I laughed knowing that this is SF and a good burger would be a synch. I grab my phone and jump into yelp.  Epic Road house, Prospect, Wayfarer Tavern apparently all had some juicy tender delicious to die for burgers. I hadn't tried the burger at Wayfarer yet so we made our decision and I lead the way full of confidence and a growing appetite.
Good burger - well seasoned beef. Really delicious fries and Homemade pickles - Great prices.

This is not the first time I have had something wrong with my order.. I ordered a mini burger with everything on it w/ jalapeño, grilled onions, and an egg with a side of garlic fries to go. I got my order today in a timely matter as it wasn't as busy as a normal lunch day. I got my order and went back to my office. As I was eating my burger, I noticed that something was wrong as my burger tasted so plain. Then I realized that they gave me a PLAIN burger with cheese.. I didn't want to walk back and complain as my lunch period was almost over. I feel like the employees there don't pay enough attention to detail about each individual order . My burger was also undercooked..

Great burger. No need to go for the full burger as the mini is 4oz. While that doesn't seem like much to the average Joe, keep in mind that is still a quarter pounder. It had a nice sesame seed bun, great condiments, and a nice peppery patty that tasted like real meat. Great fries and a soda all for under $10! Fantastic burger and lunch spot. Be ready for a line if you get there after noon, but there's lots of room to sit and enjoy, and they even have the buzzers like the big restaurants to know when your food is ready while you sit and enjoy your drink.

Greasy but in a good way. :) The patties tastes like good quality meat and you get the impression all the ingredients are food quality. The garlic fries are an awesome side too. Service was fast and friendly plus I enjoyed the cheesy classic tunes that were playing (Stevie Wonder, Journey, the Eagles)! ;) I would definitely return myself and am happy recommend it to others.

Super duper doesn't disappoint. Burger, milkshake, comes, garlic fries. It's all pretty good. It definitely Daisies my cravings for a better fast food burger than McDonalds. Still can't quite decide if I like this better or in-n-out, but since there's no in-n-out in the city, this is good

I'd never eaten or been to Super Duper before, smelled other people's take out from there (and drooled; people ought to be a little more considerate by  NOT bringing deliciously aromatic food onto a bus or train unless they are going to share with everyone) so it was someplace I knew I needed to get to someday.  I'd only discovered this shop by accident while continuing on my #6 bus which has been detoured while they fix Spear St.  Saw it through the windows but never stopped in.  One excessively stressful and hectic Thurs, I fled out for a late lunch at 4-something and was walking around, decided to see what 1 Market Plaza had now since I hadn't been inside for years now, found you can't walk through the lobby from Market to Mission (at least not right now while they too do some construction stuff in there) so had to walk allthewayaroundthewholebuilding and since that ticked me off so much, I decided now was the time to stop for a burger.  First, there is way too much on the wall menu to be able to figure out what to eat, I don't even think I got beyond the milkshake list.  Oh, there was no line and only maybe 5 tables of people already eating so I'd probably avoid this place at the high noon lunch hours when most offices let their peons out to feed.  I was lucky that the guy taking orders guided me very nicely through.  I'd have loved to have breakfast (love breakfast) but figured since I still had to go back to work and put in another 5 hours of work and then it's a 1.5 hour ride home, I needed more sustenance so a mini bacon & cheese burger (which is actually a regular sized burger with 1 patty--normal for a lot of us but I suppose in these days of supersizing everything, it may be considered a "mini") with the works, side of fries.  Those alone cost over $10 when you add on tax.  And I got some of their pickles.  My review:  burger was delicious, had that nice flavorful greasy that makes all the difference (yea, I noticed this years ago when my doctor said I needed to stop using 85% ground beef and buy the 95% instead, might be less saturated fat but the flavor also diminished; my solution is to buy the 85% but just eat it far less frequently, I mean, why bother eating if the food doesn't taste like anything).  It was just the right size for me too (I have no idea how much "bigger" a super burger is there but I'll see next time I go, even if I can't eat it all; it's nice to have enough money to experiment like this and I shall miss it when I retire).  Fries were delicious too and they don't give you too many, just enough.  Pickles were awful, too sweet or they tried to combine kosher with garlic  with sweet pickles and it just didn't work, flavors were conflicting so after one bite, I dumped the rest.  Next time I go (which may be tomorrow), I'm getting the bigger burger, fries, and a strawberry shake (I just want a sip or two, can't handle much more before my gut begins to churn but I just need to taste it, I'll give the rest to one of the boy at work).  And someday I'll stop in for eggs--I wonder if they'll put a fried egg on a burger (one of my favor eats, burger, egg, bacon, cheese; it's like the perfect breakfast sandwich).  This place is smack in an area that is basically populated by businesses; after hours and weekends it's REAL dead (who wants to be downtown on a weekend working if you can possibly avoid it) so I'm a bit impressed they even open on weekends.  Most eateries down that way tend to open at about 10:30a and close by 3p on a workday, don't bother opening on weekends at all.  I've had burgers at Ziggy's and Bistro Burger and Buckhorn and at the Hyatts and at a few other places and although most of them are good, Super Duper out does them all (must be the grease, grease is the word).

Soo greasy but soo good. Easily gets my stamp of approval, which means a lot because I'm weirdly picky about burgers. I got a mini burger, which is one patty and much like a standard sized burger, with blue cheese added. I love that the beef patty had little bits on the edge that were grilled to a crisp. The fries were exactly how I like them too. Cool local chain. I would definitely come here for my next burger craving, and then walk around the city for the rest of the day, just to burn some of those ingested calories. The patio seating is really nice on a sunny day!
We usually had great service and good at Super Duper Burger. The food was good but actually getting that food was such an ordeal.

I've been here a few times. The last couple of times have been a little disappointing. Food was cold and lacked flavor and wanted to try it wrapped in lettuce as opposed to a bun and it was poorly put together, fell apart, soggy, lettuce was drenched. Disappointing
Today was the first time and was impressed. I got the mini combo and worth the price. The lines were long but went by five to eight minutes. It was worth the wait and the quality is good and hot.

Great breakfast sandwiches!  Great Burgers!  The Chicken Sandwich with bleu cheese is the bomb!  And Chris is one of the many greatest and friendliest employees who make the start of my hectic day a great one!  You too Wanda and Sean!  You Rock!!
Ok i know this is a chain but I had to give it a go.

I stop here many mornings for my coffee on the way to work. 1st of all they have Four Barrel coffee which almost makes mornings tolerable. But 2nd their staff is really nice. Christopher is particularly nice and cheerful. He actually brightens up my mornings and I'm NOT a morning person! One morning when I had to wait a bit at the counter, he comped my coffee. Now that's what I call customer service! Thanks Christopher!

Service is super friendly and they offered me water while waiting for my to-go. I usually order the mini combo meal with the burger that comes with fries and a drink - I would upgrade the fries to their garlic fries and the drink to the oreo milkshake. My mother was craving burgers too and I ordered this to bring home, and she loved it! The oreo milkshake is my favorite, so I highly recommend :)
Organic, fresh, local, and very delicious!  Grass fed cows and compostable packaging to boot!  Friendly fast service too.... The best of fast food and slow food in one!

I'd say the place might use a bit faster service, because when we came our table was dirty and until i asked no one cleaned it, but if not for this minor detail, everything was pretty good. If you're not too hungry I won't recommend getting the super combo, that's a mistake I made. You will most likely be fine with just a mini combo. Garlic fries are absolutely a must try and the burgers were really fresh and tasty.

So gross. I guess they only decide to wear gloves for 1 or 2 weeks then decide that wearing gloves is optional when serving people food. Just now and again last week, food handlers are not wearing gloves again.
Really like this place. Fast service, great quality, kind. Viva comfort food!!
Awesome burgers, awesome service! I've stopped at this location both during the week and on the weekends and it's always top notch.

For those East Coast crazos that rave about Shake Shack, come check out Super Duper and then tell me that the West Coast doesn't have anything as good. I've had Shake Shack a bunch of times this past year and I the Super Duper is very similar in my opinion. The burger is a bit on the smaller side, patty is a bit peppery, the bun softer than most and the veggies are simply and refreshing.
Disappointing. I looked on Yelp for a good burger place that would compete with So Cal since this is my first time here in san Fran because of work and I found Super Duper.
Damn good vanilla dipped cones. The chocolate is high quality and soft serve. Screw Dairy Queen this place is the real deal.

I have come here several times now and have settled into a nice routine.  I always get a super burger with everything, grilled onions, super sauce, a sunny-side egg.  Sometimes I'll get a milkshake.  Sometimes I'll get fries.  Sometimes I'll get pickles.  Sometimes I'll get a 2nd burger.  Whatever I choose, I always come away satiated.
Great burger....waaaaay to long to wait. Over 20 min til we got our "big order" of 3 burgers and 1 fry. Took soooo long manager refunded our $$.
Fast, good, clean, with beer, and smily people.
The best fast-food burger I have ever had.  I'm hoping they open one closer to home.  Next time I'm in SF, I am definitely stopping by.

First off, let me just say I'm usually not a fan of burgers.  I'm more of a veggie and light fares type of person and a burger just seems so heavy of a meal.  However, my BF is a burger fanatic so I decide to surprise him and take him here as part of our date night.  I've had Super Duper burgers before and thought they were one of the better burgers I've ever tried.  The ingredients are fresh and tasty and I've always had good service.
good quality products with reasonable prices. Plus they also open late ;) I was here when I was vegetarian and now when I eat meat I like it even more!
amazingly mediocre..
Solid burger in SF.

I like Super Duper, I do. I like that there's happy hour here too. BUT. The cashier didn't deduct for the happy hour special and when we asked, she insisted that it's already deducted. Sorry not sorry but you're wrong, lady. You deducted one HH special, not both. And I have the receipt to prove it.
That was one of the best burgers I've had a my life. The pickles are spicy and tasty. These guys are open later than anyone else nearby. Can't wait to return and try more.
Visited Super Duper off Mission and Spear after seeing it in Valley Fair mall in San Jose. I had only heard positive reviews from friends and thought my wife, few friends, and myself would try it.
Good for grabbing something for breakfast. (Egg sandwich)

Wow. Just wow. Have you ever dreamed about a burger just melting in your mouth? Have you dreamed about eating your burger and having an out of body experience? Super duper burger can help induce the feeling of a drug high upon the first bite, but without the illegal repercussions. The best burger I've had in a long while. I don't know what sauce they throw on there, it's pretty indescribable. You NEED to get a side of garlic fries, and stock up on their pickles at the condiment area. Line at this location gets long during lunch hour.. Actually I've been at all hours of the day and it's always consistently packed. People need their burger high!

Awesome stools - 5 stars.  No stout - zip, zero, zilch stars.   When I sat down I was greeted and told that they don't open for another 15 minutes.  It was 4:45pm.  I guess I am not in Sacto anymore where even the liquor stores have "happy hour".  So, he was kind enough to let me watch tv and use the restroom until they opened.  I asked for a stout and ended up with an Anchor IPA.  The menu looked good, but I can't share a review on that because I only came here for the beer.  I am sure this place is rockin' after a baseball game because of its location.  I am a cyclist and totally love the bar stools!
Fun bar. I've yet to hit up the old video games in the back corner, but just knowing it's an option makes me happy.
Chill spacious bar and drinks were decent. +1 star for the working SNES.
BAD SERVICE! Nothing impressive about the food.
Fun and chill bar!

My industry friends talked the place up but I found the service dismissive. The bartender can only walk by so many times before you realize it's something personal or extreme incompetence. The staff simply didn't want to work. I'd rather spend my money where they acknowledge I'm trying to spend my money. I suppose if you're the sort of douchebag that likes to yell at the bartender "Hey, Buddy!" You'll be fine. Enjoy.
Shots 'n' tots! That's what Woodbury is good for - whether it's a post-work happy hour or a special celebration. Or you just need to get messed up.

Alchemist was getting really stuffy (literally and figuratively), so we moved downstairs to Woodbury.  It's much better ventilated, more spacious, and much more chill downstairs.  They also had some pretty good tater tots and mushroom poutine fries, which are awesome right around midnight.

Yessss they really have old school video games like Street Fighter!  And Poutine?  Sort of.  Instead of cheese curds they serve it with Ricotta cheese.  OK.  But what really made it money was getting it "loaded" which added skirt steak (YUMMMM the seasoning!!) and some bacon (just OK).  They also had Black Butte on tap which is one of the best dark beers ever.  And a mini (7 oz!) Pacifico which is almost too cute for words.

I crave the POUTINE!!!  And beating everyone else here at Street Fighter 2.  I beat the owner and he had to walk out of the bar ashamed and sad.  I love this place - it's very comfortable and I will be here many more times.!  Kinson is baddass!!
My favorite new local spot. Not a sports bar, though they'll have the games on tv - no audio. Not a dive, but affordable and staffed with great people, with some tasty grub.
Highly NOT recommended!
service was good. was drunk and in need of some food, this was not the place. saw a bunch of great reviews but the food lack salt or any form of seasoning.
Casey U. muses on the formula to make a new bar in San Francisco sucessful:
Great new pub in the area with delicious bar bites. There's plenty of tables in a very spacious area so it's a great spot for happy hour. Their bar stools looks like unicycles!! So cool!

this place is... interesting.  i don't really think the people who made this bar know what they wanted to do judging from the deer/moose heads on the walls, to the beer and shot and tater tot menu, to the super nintendo and atari games in the corner. but hey i'm not complaining!  anywhere where can get a shot of whiskey, modelo, chili cheese tater tots while kicking ass in street fighter i'm down for. and it's right in soma so super close to work, i'm happy.  service is a little slow, but it's a hipster bar! it all makes sense!

Came here before going to the Bey-Z concert a few weeks back. Arrive around 6pm, just in time for happy hour, yay! Ordered two blue moons ($6 HH price) and the loaded tator tots ( [~$12] cheese, ground beef, green onions) and it was amazing paired with beer. After about an hour people getting off work and wanting to get a drink started coming in and by 7pm the place was jam-packed!

Let me start off by saying, when I first walked into this place last weekend, I loved it. The atmosphere is super nice - a bit dark, with dark wood everywhere - just looks really nice. One look at the menu and again, awesome - they have beer and shots in one drink, or pair them up based on what goes well together. And then, I saw the video games! Who doesn't love a place that has Mario Kart on Super NES at a bar? Sounds great, right?
What a cool place!

awesome place for a drink and some grub. They have the best grilled cheese, honest. Only thing they are City prices. :)  The beer come in small glasses but if your in for a drink watch a little tv and lounge, its a must stop by

Cool place, weird seating that isn't comfortable, and good wings. I asked for a whiskey neat and got 5-6 fingers which was surprising and excessive. So guess order for whiskey neat for two people? I'm not complaining. : ) I doubt it'll happen again anyway.

Super cool and chill space, with plenty of seating, large screen TVs, and even small area with a video game console (people were playing Street Fighter when I went haha!) The bartenders are friendly and accommodating.

This place is super close to home, we have been here a few times! Bar-tending and wait staff are awesome and super friendly. Always suggesting drinks and making creative new ones. Taste the watermelon pepper shooter it's amazing! Not sure what's it's called. But it's awesome!!
A great addition to the ballpark area. Wings were really great and enjoyed the drinks. Wish I could remember which ones. . .  Our server, Brie, was really top notch.

This will be the 4th place in 3 years at this location. Is it all the same owner, just trying to rebrand?? The food is never that good, and this place hasn't changed. The food is a 3.5 but the service was soo bad. Somehow it was packed and it took forever to get our food. And my girlfriends dish was cold. Lame.

Went there for the first time for happy hour with mom and sister.  My sister beat us there by almost an hour, and said the place was awesome when we arrived.  We were greeted by a nice enough bartender.  I saw Dogfish head 90 minute IPA and excitedly ordered.  Small mason jar, but hey, it's strong beer.  Mom didn't know what she wanted.
What do you do once 5:00 pm (4:30 for me, whoo) hits on a Friday?! Go to the nearest bar and beer yourself.

Fantastic bar with an even better bartender. We were in San Francisco for about 24 hours while on a road trip. After leaving the Giants game, we stumbled upon this place and hoped it would fulfill our wish for creative cocktails and a cool vibe. Woodbury was exactly what we hoped it would be.

Came here after a giants game, many others had the same idea.  Fun little bar with awkward metal stools and cool vintage video games.  I didn't drink but my boyfriend had an old fashion and seemed to enjoy it.  I didn't interact with much of the staff but they definitely looked like they were hustling to make drinks and keep everything clean.

Stopped in here on July 3rd right about happy hour- with a holiday - it's almost like a Friday night. The atmosphere was good, nice decor - I love bench seating across the back of the bar. It was full, but not too crowded and we were able to find a seat. Like most bars these days the design looks snazzy, but also makes for a loud venue if trying to talk - but I figure that's expected.  They were out of the mushroom burger which made me sad, but I got the salad with the savory almonds & poached egg - a poached egg makes everything more awesome.  My guy had the basic cheese burger and it was tasty - the fries - of which I stole TWO were good - crispy but not skinny. I was a fan.  Our friend had the spicy brat which she said was delicious too. We also had beer and cocktails - I love a Paloma (tequila and grapefruit) - Everything was good and fresh - some reviews say it's pricy, but it seems pretty normal for SF to me. The standout was our service. Jamie M (I think) was super nice and attentive -offering suggestions and keeping the water and the cocktails flowing.

This is a great new bar that just opened up in the soma. It has come great drink combinations for very reasonable prices. The bartenders are wonderful, and there is a good selection of liquor thats able to satisfy everybody. There is also a lot of space to sit or stand.
This is a new-ish bar, located where Root Thai used to be (very briefly, not sure what happened).  I've been here twice now for happy hour since we live nearby and have really liked it so far.
Definitely a cool place. The wings were a solid choice and the burrs are great. They have some awesome and personable people on staff too. 100% vibes

This is a cool neighborhood bar. Really good cocktails, you can also get a beer and a shot with top shelf alcohol for $10. They also have super Mario on big screens in the back. The bar stools also have peddles - my one complaint is that they don't move so I can't work out while I'm boozing.

I really wanted this place to be great because I live a block away. Cool location and decor (like the bike tile/pedals stools). But the margarita drink of the day was really sweet with no salt option. The food was all bland and dry(!), especially for what should be flavorful, indulgent bar food: jalapeño cornbread (with weird cheese whiz butter), poutine fully loaded (with stouffers-box tasting gravy) and trio of sliders (one of them is literally bacon and bun, not in a good way)...unfortunate.

Came her before giants game. They have nice set up of TVs which they were playing the World Cup games. Score! Super knowledgable mixologist who helped me choose a great cocktail the Passarinho. Will come back for this drink and the great service and oh did I mention they have Mario cart to play!?

Been meaning to check out the new kid on the block for a while, especially since I roll past them every day to and from work. Finally dropped in a few weeks ago for a friend's friend's birthday party, and got to check out the space.
Friendly, knowledgeable staff, great drinks, and delicious food! Stopped in here when in San Francisco on business and decided on a little pleasure mixed in. The Woodbury delivers on the experience.

I organize my company's happy hours and we LOVE this place. This place is so stunning. Great location, within walking distance to the Caltrain station and ATT park. Full bar with excellent beer menu. The bites are scrumptious: my favorites were the mini burgers, and the faux vegan sushi roll. Also, we got to compete against each other playing old-school video games for free! How awesome is that?!

This bar is dope! We left the bar upstairs and walked into Woodbury and felt like this is where we belonged all along! They were playing gangsta rap, had TVs with sports on, TVs with video games on, and the vibe was on point. Great drinks like the bar upstairs but a more lively surrounding. I'll definitely be back to try their food items and to kick it again and again.

Ironside was one if the first places I went after my decision to move to San Francisco was finalized. I came here with my then-soon-to-be-roommate and her friends for brunch, and loved it (the city overall was just amazing me). I went again after I moved to my second San Francisco apartment that happened to be much closer to Ironside than my first (hooray!) and since then, I've been here another couple of times (it's the first place I think of for brunch!).
I went for brunch,  nice open and airy,  good buffet style brunch and the bacon was quality,  a nice marker for any good buffet.  $18 for bottomless mimosas,  not a bad deal!

Brisket is the best out of the ribs, chicken we tried that night.  The biscuits were good, but maybe a bit on the dry side...I will come back to try more since it's close to my house. But before that, might need to head back to Cat's Head first.

I've heard some good things from my coworker about this place and wanted to try it out! It's super close to work and a block from AT&T Park, so convenient. Can you believe, I visited this place twice in 2 days!
Bison Burger - this was actually very good.  I'd been to Ironside for brunch many times, but never for dinner.  The burger tasted great and was seasoned very well.

I must say that I've become a much bigger fan of Ironside after they started serving BBQ! There really isn't anywhere around walking distance of the ballpark where you can get good BBQ, so I was quite excited when I saw that they were starting to offer this option. I always thought their sandwiches were just ok (except for the Cubano which is pretty good) but their flatbreads were pretty good. However, my favorite now is by far their BBQ. I've really only gotten the brisket sandwich because I really enjoy it. Maybe one day I'll venture out and try something new.
Meh.
Good food. Rude service.

Though the rib platter tempted me, I came in really wanting a burger.  The BBQ bacon burger came on a fresh challah roll with smoked cheddar, bacon and sautéed onions.  It was good but didn't have much BBQ sauce on it.  The fries were bigger than normal fries and smaller than wedges and didn't have any seasoning or salt on them, but they were crispy which was fine by me.  The community tables are a nice touch, they have small ones also, and so are the washcloths you get with your silverware, it lets you know that you will need it eventually.
Came here with a girlfriend yesterday to watch the game and grab a bite. Place was pretty packed, but we were seated and brought drinks fairly quickly.

got to go last night and granted it was the giants game so they were kinda busy but both orders were botched up/. I ordered a house salad and agot a Casears. The fiance got a one main and 2 sides and corn bread. No corn bread and the main ribs was like 3 pieces for $14. not sure if that is thenorm but it was kinda wack. he didn't like his sides of mac and cheese and slaw either. not impressed
We had two different types of pizza. Excellent! The location was perfect for a pre-game meal.

I had the "BBQ Rocky Chicken" sandwich with fries. The sandwich was just OK: it didn't taste particularly barbecue. The thick-cut fries were also very plain. There's better food to be had in the area (and for less money).
Went to dinner here based on recommendation. Everyone in our party liked their food and the service was good. Very casual place!
Good brunch, love the bloody Mary bar, nice set up. A little over priced but good food. Love the biscuits and gravy. Service is good too.

Food was great! Really enjoyed my meal and sangria. Horrible service. Took 15 minutes to be greeted at the table. When I tried to order he needed to get paper. Than he forgot to put our drink order in. We got our appetizer before our drinks. Loved the food despite all that.
Very close to the ballpark - great spot to grab food or a drink before the game. Atmosphere is very chill and service is great!
Delicious food. Friendly servers. Casual atmosphere. The tempura avocado is delicious.

The pulled pork was decadence!  It was full of  bbq smoked flavor and very juicy! The mac n cheese side dish left me wanting more!!  The pitcher of Cubra Libres was a great deal and didn't leave us waiting for the busy bar to make another drink. The pitcher came with a very generous pour of alcohol as well. Our waiter was great and attentive even with how busy he was!
I don't get it. Brunch fell way short of expectations and reviews.

Dried up Brisket! I've always been curious about this place since I pass by it a million times.  Now I know! Maybe it was bad timing, but first impressions will always stick in my mind.  I'm still hungry!
Delicious cubano and beef brisket delicious. Steak fries yum as were the sweet potato fries. Will be back.

One of my favorite brunch places in the city because of their bottomless mimosas!! You can pair your champagne with a medley of juices - guava (yum!), peach (sweet but still delicious!), orange (for the classic at heart), cranberry (who can say no to antioxidants?), and apple (an apple a day keeps the doctor away, even in juice/mimosa form right?).
HALLELUJAH!
