My boyfriend and I ate here once. I love BBQ and loved that it was a few blocks from where we live. It was decent BBQ and the service was decent so we would have been return patrons.

I have been here twice. First time at lunch they were out of Pulled Pork.  Yep, at Lunch.  Sounds like someone forgot to put it on the night before or something.  So I had a Brisket Sandwich instead.  It was ok, not exactly super tender, and not exactly very smoked.

This low rating has to do with their inconvenient sporadic schedule during peak business hours. They close by 2:00p, have a limited menu and have communal seating. I had the shrimp po-boy sandwich which was tasty and would love to have tried other things on their menu but they never seem to be open. It is also extremely loud and full of hipsters.

The food was really good as was the service. I was not a huge fan of the guava mimosas, but the other flavors were great. This place does get busy so a reservation is definitely a good idea. Definitely worth a try if you are looking for a place to get brunch in the mission Bay Area.

I ordered a chicken ceaser salad. Cost $16, and took over 15minutes to get. Mediocre, not worth the money and the wait. Cook was not wearing gloves, just plunging his hands into the chicken/ lettuce container.
Seriously, best oatmeal i've ever had. The rest of their food is amazing as well, but when you take something so mundane and turn it into something so amazing, I can't help but preach about it.

I enjoyed a lovely Sunday brunch on Father's Day and it was awesome. The food was great, I loved the variety. I made reservations and was seated immediately upon arrival, the people and the atmosphere was very friendly. It was my boyfriend and  I first time dining there. I can't wait to go back.

Came to Ironside on a Sunday morning with reservations for the brunch buffet. There was a Giants came that day so I'm glad I made reservations beforehand. The brunch buffet is $18 which I think is a fair price. In addition to the buffet they serve bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's which seemed very popular plus Four Barrel coffee drinks, juice, etc. Although the food selection looked small, I will say I was stuffed immediately! The quality of the food is very good for a buffet IMO. I'm not sure if the same food is offered every weekend, but when I was there the following items were served - scrambled eggs, bacon, mini sausage patties, mini pancakes, collard greens with hamhocks, cheddar grits, oatmeal, plantains, mini bread pudding, toast, ceviche (didn't look all that exciting though), green salad and potatoes. Overall, the food was great along with my vanilla latte. I was also very impressed with the service which was attentive and quick. I will absolutely go back to Ironside, especially to try the bottomless mimosas.
Wonderful healthy salad options.  The spiciness is perfect. Shrimp r great.
we went for brunch before a giants game. We did have to wait until our reservation time, but they got us started with drinks while we waited. The food was delish, the service was great.
It was 'good' bbq..
Breakfast buffets can be hit or miss. A few notes about theirs:

This is probably my single worst meal I've ever had in the bay area, if it can even be called a meal.  I got take out and got 5 nasty burnt shrimp (see picture).  Unfortunately I didn't check until I got home.  This place should be ashmed.  What a rip, even if it weren't burnt.  Beans were blah, grits come on.  The Smoked Onion Soup Gratinee tasted like sysco canned.  Man.  Avoid at all costs.

This place is awesome. I have been here three times and love it! The environment is great and the staff is super friendly. The brunch buffet does not dissapoint! Good for friends before going to a game or a nice outing with the family. Love this place!
I came here for lunch today with my coworkers and I have to say, I was sadly disappointed. The decor is hip, however the food was lacking.

This place is a good example of the over-priced mediocrity catering to the clueless tech crowds trend that plaguing the SOMA.  It also proves that people has no idea what good food is or really do not care about overpay for mediocre product.  Followed a friend here today...bad decision.  For $12, I got a sad excuse of a BBQ plate.  Go support a good mom n pop shops in the area and get more for your money.  These guys pretend to know BBQ. And no....Bottomless Mimosa BS doesn't qualify as BBQ.

Ambiance: Typical bar & grill set up. Casual but comfortable and welcoming. Dim lighting, a little warm inside. Pretty loud, some tables were having a good time. There is very limited outdoor seating along the front sidewalk.
Your burgers are thick, juicy, and has taste

When you go anywhere with good friends, you're assured a great time. And when the waiter comes by to grab your order right before the end of happy hour, it's even better. Wine, beer, and certain appetizers were each only $5.

We lucked up and found this restaurant near our hotel. What an incredibly fun and great experience!! Not only did we have the Best waitress and we do mean Fantastic person named Anna, but we had a Fantastic meal! From start to finish, the food, attention to service, and ambiance Rocked!! Thanks SF! for having a winner!!
Had brunch on a busy beautiful Sunday. Food was great, a little view of the water and bridge, and friendly staff made for a nice relaxing time.
The bar food is probably better than the actual dinner menu, which me and my wife had.  The service is just ok, nothing great.  It's nothing really special.
Dark, crowded, difficult to get served drinks. Perhaps I was there at the wrong time...
One of my friends took me here for lunch.   I don't know if it was the company, but the burger was great.   Also, I appreciated the service.   Will definitely be back soon.

I've walked by this place every day for the past 6 months on my way to the ferry, so we decided to watch the WS game Friday  night and I'm glad we did. We sat in the cozy bar area (Happy Hour is great) against the wall, the Mgr. was very accommodating by bringing us another chair for our 3rd guest who hadn't arrived, even though it was busy. He brought us water and bread sticks which is a nice treat. The burger and fries we ordered were delicious! Our server, I don't remember her name (she had the feather earrings) was very attentive and provided service with a smile.  We're looking forward to going back and trying more of the menu!!

If I could give this place a zero star rating I would.  Never experienced the rudest waiters there ever.  We went with a group of friends before the Giant vs Dodger game to get some drinks and some waiter had the nerve to tell us we couldn't sit at a specific table (when no one was ever sitting there and wasn't even reserved).  I have never experienced a waiter with that rude of a behavior before.  Best result was to just leave and find another place (thank goodness we did).  Beware of this place and waiter!  Would never want to give business to a company that would treat customers like this.
Decent (and rare) place for a sit down breakfast in the FiDi/Embarcadero. Big portions. Nothing special. Clean pub vibe.

I like this place. its a nice restaurant/sports bar. Their lamb shank entree for dinner is a must try. the meat is falling off the bone soft. They also have gluten free beer and a hefty selection of wine by the glass. The service is always great and I never have to wait for a table.

Ah Perry's....was in town for Dreamforce this week, stayed at the Hotel Griffin, and found this amazing bar attached!  Racer5 on tap....watching the Giants win the NLCS.....great food to snack and dine on.  Friendly owners and bartenders....Brian took good care of me this week.  Thanks for a wonderful week away from home, I'll be back next time I'm in town.

Solid spot for food and price! Considering the number of times we have stopped in, it's a bit disappointing that we are not regulars list ;) Tuesdays and Saturdays half off bottles of wine is great and their ahi tacos are incredible!

We walked in on a Friday night for dinner and were pleased to be seated on the patio facing the bridge. It was a lovely setting and as the sun set was very romantic. We had the calamari as an appetizer, good flavor and not overly battered. I had a glass of the house Pinot Noir, it was smooth and delicious and my husband had the Racer 5 IPA which he enjoyed. For dinner I had the mixed greens salad, honestly I didn't enjoy it. It said it came with a champagne dressing, but it tasted very bland, just not much flavor. Don't let that stop you from going here though because everything else was delicious! My husband had the filet mignon and bacon Mac n' cheese. The filet melted in your mouth and the Mac n' cheese was very rich.

My coworker wanted to check out their happy hour, as we had a stressful work week...and after those long hours we were hungry! It took awhile to get their attention and get seated, which was annoying since they were busy but not that busy.

First off, I can tell Perry's truly cares about it's customers and wants to make them happy. After my review management reached out to see how they could improve things. I have been back to Perry's for happy hour, and enjoyed their great drinks and atmosphere. I hope to return again soon for a meal and hope to update my review of the food!

With five guys we stopped here for drinks in the bar last weekend. It was a nice swanky kind of place, but not enough seating in the bar and not really my kind of place. I am a little more low key and laid back. More of a mixed drink bar than a beer bar. They did have some draft beers. This place is ok.
I was here for the first time for lunch.

While at the Griffon we ate at Perrys.  It was so so...ok.  The bartenders were pretty rude.  Trying to get Sean/John whatever his name is, attention was difficult as I had to interrupt him talking to his friends/girls.  The next day a lady with long hair was behind the bar.  Not sure she enjoys her job.  Food was ok when you're hungry. I suspect this is more of a snack/drink bar place.

We had brunch here Sunday morning with the food credit we got with our room at the Hotel Griffon. It's got good food and drinks. The ambiance of the patio seating made the experience for us though, with the water, the bridge, the ferry building and Giants fans streaming past on their way to the game.
The Tortilla Scaramble was sooo good!

I was here for a large get together and was seated in the private room in the back. I ordered the calamari as an appetizer, the mahi mahi as an entree and the chocolate mousse for dessert. I also had a couple of cocktails and a latte.
Maybe 3.75 stars, good happy hour, food is consistently good for mid level dining.

I went to Perry's twice: on a Monday afternoon and Tuesday night, both times with coworkers (it was right across from our hotel). The first visit was so-so: crowded, lively, but not the most inviting. There wasn't a lot of room at the bar, so me and others felt like we were always in the way. The tables at the end of the bar in the back of the restaurant were empty (only the bar was popular, since it was 4/5 pm and the dinner rush hadn't hit) but one of the waitresses made it a point to say we could not sit at (or take chairs from) those tables. It didn't leave the best impression, but I got over it.

Perry's is a decent, albeit overpriced restaurant. The decor seems to be striving to be a nice sit-down restaurant. However, the atmosphere and clientele scream (literally) sports bar. I came here a few weeks ago with some friends who were visiting for a conference. We were wearing suits, and we were clearly overdressed. The bar was noisy and crowded with plenty of Giants fans yelling at the TV. The table we ended up being seated at was quite nice though.

Made reservations a week in advance. When we arrived we were seated in the bar area at a tight little table for 4. We were told the dining room had been reserved for a private party. We were there for two hours and never saw anyone in the dining room. I think it should have been mentioned when I made the reservation. That being said, the food was fantastic. One other note, 1/2 price wine on Saturdays....ordered a $48 bottle of Chardonnay and it had a twist off top. Really?
I overall enjoyed my experience here.

I made a reservation and arrived at the nick of time.  The place was packed.  Giants fans stop in for a bite and a drink before the baseball game.  We were able to get a table inside with a view. A glass of long breadsticks arrived after our waters.  My friend ordered the Perry's Manhattan (aka Bulleit Manhattan) and I had a white wine referred to as Gl Kim Crawford.  I had a taste of the cocktail. It was sweet and hit your pallet with a tasty flavor. We also ordered the grilled artichokes. I'm not too familiar in how to eat them and wasn't too much of a fan. It tasted like eating hard leaves.  No worries my friend liked it and finished it off.  The entree was an appropriate portion. It wasn't a hungry man-type portion but it was ok to get you in your way. I had the special which was a seafood pasta. It had scallops, mussels, clams and a little shrimp.  Soupy but not like a gazpacho but ok.  My friend had the grilled halibut which was tender and very good. It had a lot of greens, I think spinach, which was ok for a few bites but he wasn't a spinach fan so they ate around it. All in all, it was a very nice meal in a noisy environment. Oh, I almost left out. The hostess asked us if we wanted a window view or a booth. Since it was warm, we figured a window view.  When she seated us, our view overlooked the bridge and water off the Embarcadero when we stood. The moment we sat down, our view were a bunch of people sitting next to us on the other side of the glass. The had outdoor seating and they were our view. It was funny but no different than being inside.
The food is good and our waitress was really nice, but it took forever for the food to actually get to us.

They have the best buffalo wings ever! Great customer service all around and the food comes out fast and hot! I ordered the Tomato Bisque soup and had tried a little bit of my friend's food as well. The tomato bisque was good that I finished it all! They give you a huge serving which was perfect for eating it as a meal. Two of my friends had split a burger and fries and the restaurant was so nice to already cut the burger and half and split the fries between two plates!! I couldn't stop eating their french fries because they were cooked perfectly! My other friend had the Chop Salad which she said is the best Chop Salad she has ever had (I believe her because she finished it all and she's been in the food business forever!).
Good drinks!

The view is great but the service and food was awful! Our waitress brought out our crab cakes which I ordered as my lunch waaaay later than the rest of our food. She still charged us for the crab cakes even after we complained that the food had come so late. I do not recommend coming here unless it is for drinks and appetizers and to enjoy the view.

Described to me as "the Marina version of a diner." Well put - only, take your standards and lower them. The food is sub par, as is the service. It's a struggle to get seated - you have to wind your way through the crush of tourists to the host stand in the very back of the restaurant... and then wait for the host to return from wherever she is... then wait for her to find you a table even though there's no wait and plenty of tables are open.
Came in here yesterday for brunch and had a great time with family!
A couple words: GREAT HAPPY HOUR
My guest told me "You should write them a Yelp review" so here I go

Nice decor and location. My steak was ordered medium and arrived bloody rare. They re-cooked it and didn't charge me for the food. The calamari was excellent. The service was slow, but they were packed. Not the best and not the worst for the price.
No constancy- we had a great time earlier the same day - came back to new 'management' later that evening only to be insulted - literally.

Very good experience at Perry's.  I didn't have high hopes because I don't love classic american food and it's in somewhat of a touristy location...but I have to say I was really impressed.  The food we got (clam chowder, artichokes, spinach salad and chicken tenders) were all very good.  And the service was spot on as well, despite being pretty busy.  I'm really at a 4.5 for this place.  We will be back.

This place has great quality food and the staff is very nice. However, they cannot get a sandwich order right. A couple of years ago they kept messing up my sandwich order. I spoke with the owner a few times, even suggesting they use order forms so they get orders right. He made no changes. I kept going there until the fifth time they messed up my sandwich. They kept putting on onions and peppers when I very specifically asked them not to. I stopped going there for more than a year. There are plenty of other places nearby. So today I decided to give them another chance. I ordered a hot pastrami with lettuce , pickles and tomatoes. I get back to my desk and find there are peppers on my sandwich! They are absolutely terrible at getting a sandwich order right and have made no attempt to recognize the problem or fix it

This place is legit. When you order a chicken sandwich you get actual pieces of chicken straight off the bone, not processed (though some of their sandwiches do use what looks like sliced deli meat -- so look carefully). I've also had the breakfast burritos which are some of the best in the area. If there's not a line when you go in, there will be shortly. While small, it stays pretty busy. No worries though because they are pretty fast at getting you your food. It's not the most ideal for a sit down breakfast, but for something quick or to-go this is your place. Highly recommend checking it out.
A so so deli shop located near the Embarcadero Bart stop. I got the eggs, bacon and toast plate for about $8. It came with a cup for coffee which was nice.

So nice to find another great sandwich shop near my office at Howard and Fremont. Sweet Joanna's is tucked at the corner of Howard and Spear, in the old (and beautiful) Folger Coffee Building. They have a sandwich counter with all of the fresh ingredients, and a great salad bar with hummus, artichoke hearts, and the like.

Popped in to try their Reuben which took a few minutes longer than I expected, however; very delicious and loaded up nicely. Clean environment; friendly staff; comfortable place to sit and relax for lunch. Overall good value, I'll be back!!!

I used to go here for the breakfast muffins when I worked nearby.  The muffins were huge - fresh and delicious, too.  I never tried the sandwiches or salads, but everything looked and smelled good to me.  Cute little place.
I have a mad hankering for Sweet Jo's roasted eggplant sandwich.  And I've never even tried the darn thing!!
Nice spot to grab a sammie or some salad.

Great little sandwich shop. It's hard to pick out one thing that a great because pretty much everything is. The one exception is their coffee. Go here do sandwiches, scones, etc. DON'T go here for coffee.
Just came here and paid with a $20, but received change as if I paid with a $10.

Good bang for your buck, $8 can get you a massive sandwich with fresh ingredients. I got the triple decker - three layers of turkey, avocado, sprouts and tomato and red onion on whatever bread you like. I had to remove some turkey in order to finish it and boy am I full. Nice people and high quality!

If you want a really gigundo sandwich, go here.  I got the California club.  There was so much turkey meat, I could barely finish half the sandwich.  I packed it up and took it back to my desk at work and ate the rest about 3 hours later.

Come here early if you want to get the popular roast turkey sandwich. I've never had it, but that's because I can't come here without getting the chicken salad sandwich with Dutch crunch. SO GOOD! The soup here is self-serve and pricey for just average soup. I'd say stick to the sandwiches instead of the self-serve deli stuff. Also, if you can, try their dessert pastries, which I think often get overlooked; they're located behind the pay counter.
I've been here about ten times at this point. I always get their hot sandwiches so I can't comment on their salads or baked goods.

Very solid sandwich! Great portions as they aren't stingy on the meat (at least on the 3 sandwiches I've had)...but it's not your cheapest sandwich. Make sure you get your sandwich toasted. It'll make it that much tastier.
Had the tuna melt, which was solid.
PHEW!  My bad, it looked really closed.
I work nearby and on certain days I want to have something comforting at lunch. And when I do, I come to Sweet Joanna's.
Just an update to Nick O's comment: Joanna's was closed for just 1 week but now they're open again.

Don't worry, people!  Sweet Joanna's is coming back next week.  I work just a block away, and I was told that they are closing just for ONE week, because of the BART strike.  The Owner uses BART to get to work.
This place is a solid 3 stars, 4 on a good day.

I came here to Sweet Joanna's because the Toaster Oven was closed.  It was 8am and their door was still locked...I was hungry and was in a hurry to get to work.  Whoever was supposed to open was behind schedule!

Sandwiches are amazing! The Hot Pastrami on marbled rye is the best i've ever had. The prices are very reasonable, typically under $8 for a sando. I would give 5 stars, but their salad bar is not always that fresh.
Best sandwich I have found in the area.  The California club is AMAZING!  And the prices are very reasonable.

I am on the hunt for a great breakfast burrito near my office downtown. Although the price is right and the ingredients fresh, the tortilla was awful. Chewy and stale. The salsa, watery and store bought. I believe there is never a reason to use store bought pico de gallo, fresh tomatoes, onions,  and jalapeno. So easy. I dont think I will be going back for a breakfast burrito but I may give them a second chance for lunch.

Have breakfast there every Friday morning.  Great breakfast burrito and Burn's Special.  Their CA turkey sandwich with real, roasted turkey is so good for lunch, too.  Friendly, fast ... they take GoPago so order ahead of time and avoid the line ... eat there or take it away.  Love this place!
The food is pretty good here and the prices are reasonable. If you're not a attractive female don't expect the owner/cashier to say one word to you.
Sweet Joanna's is a nice mom and pop shop

I never knew that Sweet Joanna's existed but on a walk through downtown yesterday I saw them and thought I'd check them out.  I ordered the meatball sandwich and it was really good.  A perfect amount of cheese in there too.  The only drawback was that it took a little while to actually prepare but it was worth it.

Usually decent but watch out for muffins. I asked if they were made fresh this morning.  Oh yes, she replied!  Get to my office and still cold from fridge. Not paying good money for a stale, cold muffin.

The salad bar area is nice and quick and you pay by the oz. When I went, there were two hot food items: potato and BBQ chicken and a good selection of salad items: salads, veggies, corn, falafel, boiled egg, sliced pepper, green beans, etc. The sandwich and counter area on the other hand was a cluster f-ck. It was my first time visiting so I had no clue where to go for what. In case you don't know, you go to the sandwich area at the back, order a sandwich, pay at the register at the front, then wait for your sandwich. I'm not sure how they know whose sandwich is whose since they don't take names or numbers.. but you can just stand there and hope that your item comes out and no one takes it or you don't take someone else's. Hot sandwiches are even slower to make, so if you're in a hurry, your best bet is a regular sandwich or straight to the salad bar.
I'm really picky when it comes to Financial District food. Everything here is usually grossly overpriced and mediocre at best. How happy was I to finally try this place out!
First I must ask myself...why have I not rated this place before?  I have been eating here for years, but I guess there's no time like the present!

I come here based on my coworkers' recommendations. I usually order breakfast here because my work location is so close by. Everyone is friendly and their breakfast items are delicious!! I suggest getting the breakfast burrito or the egg muffin. The only thing is they take their time making their food but it's totally worth it because the food tastes fresh! They also have a salad bar during lunch time--but stick with the sandwiches. Credit card minimum is $5. They also take Gopago credit.

YUM. This is by far the best sandwich spot in the neighborhood. The 'chefs' are super friendly and can remember amazing amounts of special orders on any sandwich -- it's always perfect, quick and affordable. Perfect combo for a quick work lunch -- and they cater.
Love this place!
Used my Gopago credit here today - Turkey, bacon, avocado and all the fixings on dutch crutch and warmed up. Filling. Happy. Stomach. yay!

Popped in here for coffee and a pastry this morning and the "manager" refused to take my credit card because the total was under $5. Hello, it's the 21st Century - who carries cash? And who wants to carry coins when you get change?

in the past week i been her 3 times. love this place. love the fresh roast turkey sandwich. best in town. and the girl that makes my sandwich makes it how i like it. i literally customize my sandwich every time i go there and its good every single time. if you are looking for a solid sandwich spot w/ decent pricing this is your spot.  thank you joanna.
Another messed up order today.  There's no numbering system when you order, so someone else will take your sandwich order when they shout what's ready.
Best breakfast burrito!! Had the veggie burrito wrap- egg, cheese, tomato, avocado, and potatoes. Totally delicious and very filling!
Time: 2:07pm/73° partly sunny

Really good food (have tried the veggie wrap, various sandwiches, salads, orange juice) but two stars off because of recent price increases and they will nickel and dime you on everything. Like on stuff that most other places wouldn't charge for. Extra tomatoes? Fifty cents extra. Extra lettuce? That's extra too. That seems penny wise and pound foolish, but I can deal with that. More disappointing is that they've had 3 price increases in the past 6 months on the veggie wrap. And it's cash only as well - but then they charge you tax on some items. Hmm, I don't get it. They've tested my patience as a customer with the constant price increases, but the food is good and the person who makes the food is really nice, so I'll probably still reluctantly come every now and then.

This is a busy lunch place and they rush so much they make many mistakes. They didn't listen to my order and made it wrong, and every other customer there was confused about their orders, a sandwich shop should pay attention to details and not just add random ingredients to people's orders, a few people also asked to have certain ingredients removed and their request wasn't honored.
What the hell?  You are not open even though your open table info says you are.  Boo.
The veggie breakfast burrito is delicious. It cost $5.50.
Best breakfast burritos in the area. This is family owned and they are super nice. Flor makes the best latte and hot salsa in town!

There food is good, but they never have there stuff together. There is always a mix up and there always rude about it. Would have been 5 stats but there customer service is that bad. Phone orders don't mean anything they say a few min and it's always longer then showing up.
The chicken fajita sandwich is simply amazing. $8 for a perfect sandwich which is tasty and filling. Very well done.
I've come here a few times per month, and service is hit or miss but today drove me over the edge.
The savior of my morning. Lunch sandwiches are not very good but the veggie wrap with bacon is solid for breakfast. Cash only is irritating tho, but typical for SF.

After reading the great reviews of the sandwiches here, I felt like I had to come here for lunch. I ordered the "Vegetarian" (avocado, mozzarella, spinach, tomato, basil on ciabatta) and it was just your average tomato mozzarella sandwich from any other place. Nothing spectacular by any means (the avocado doesn't really add that extra oomph). I'm not sure why its rated so highly but I would have lower expectations before coming here. Its not bad, just not as great as its made out to be. The price is pretty decent for San Francisco so that is pretty good. Service isn't friendly but not a big deal since you only interact with them for like a total of a minute (placing your order and picking up).
Breakfast Veggie Wrap for the win!
This place is a gem. Very affordable, super friendly staff, delicious, healthy food options. I find myself calling in breakfast burritos more and more regularly. #noshame
I've eaten here many times...food is very so-so but, what to be expected for the price I guess.  But today compelled me to write a review.

Hadn't been in a while.  Have to reiterate my rating because the fajita sandwich was awesome still and substituting jalapenos for green chilis improved it for me.  Price is up to $7.75 still, but is fair for the amount at quality.
GREAT
Dammit, there's nothing I hate more than being wrong. It's honestly taken me over a year to write this well-deserved review.

Salami & mortadella with avocado & roasted red bell peppers on dutch crunch pressed for under $7?  Hell yeah!  We waited for awhile for our sandwiches though on a rainy day around 12:30 though even though there were only a couple people ahead of us.  Other than that, their sandwiches are filling and cheap, just remember to bring cash to this grab & go eatery!
Four Stars
I was craving a breakfast burrito and of course turned to yelp.  I walked over to Rincon and walked the entire floor looking for this place and finally looked outside and there is was!

After spending the past two years of working/schooling elsewhere, I've returned and am still a very satisfied customer!  I used to rave about their sandwiches, but now that I've converted to salads, I can't shut up about their cactus salad.  Fear not fellow carnivores, I remain very skeptical about how mere veggies (and a protein source of course; I haven't completely abandoned my ways you silly reader, you) can satiate any human appetite, but their cactus salad really has a hold on me.  It's fresh, has lots of quality toppings that complement each other well, and it doesn't make you regret inhaling it.  Another great thing is, their portions are huuuge!  For $8 ($6.50 w/o tuna or chicken), you really cannot go wrong here.  I will undoubtedly continue to throw my money at Cicil's Cafe for their awesome menu items.
I've walked up to this tiny spot many a lunch forgetting that it was cash only. Who carries cash? Super unfortunate.
Great friendly and tasty little shop. Worth my time and money. There really isn't much to pick from but the quality once you get it is good.

I love this little hidden gem in the Rincon Center. As a person who hates salad (because I feel like I'm chewing on leaves of a tree), I LOVE Cicil's cactus salad! Prior to this, I didn't even know cacti are edible. But they are. And this is not like a salad at all, it's like a medley of non-coniferous veggies. You know, the best type of fiber! I love every component of their cactus salad, from the tortilla chips to the mango vinaigrette dressing, from the lettuce to the scrumptious avocados. This is absolutely my go-to salad spot.
Quality ingredients, sandwiches toasted to perfection. Cecil's is the only reason I constantly keep cash in my wallet..I eat here once if not twice a week!

I used to always come here to order a tuna sandwich. Love the bread and overall combination of flavors and textures that mesh well together. I stopped coming here because it is a bit pricey for a small dinky portion. Oh also this place is cash only. I ordered a different sandwich before but didnt care for it because it was only okay. So the next time I went there I got the tuna and I was hooked...
SERVICE IS AWEFUL!!!!!
Cecil's marked my very first lunch as a real-life working girl in San Francisco!
Disclaimer: this place is very likely to make it in my "Best sandwich lunch place in the FiDi". ;)

I was drawn here by the cactus salad. I rarely see nopales (that's cactus, in Spanish) used in Mexican restaurant fare. But it's a common food. My 93-year old grandpa makes a mean ensalada de nopales (cactus salad) with nopales (that he chops and peels from his backyard), tomato, cilantro, green onion, lemon juice, salt and pepper. So I was expecting something along those lines.
Breakfast burrito review only!

Great little hidden gem. I had their chicken sandwich with mozz cheese, avocado, mustard, banana peppers and jalapenos on dutch crunch and it was quite good. Good size and love that it is toasted. I still may pick Cafe Algiers over Cicis but its pretty close.

Cactus Salad: The salad is pretty good. Cheap, too. But, it's not THAT great. I was expected more stuff to be in it. I liked the spicy kick to it and the mango vinaigrette. However, I'd rather go to Pasta Paradiso to eat salad.
Yesterday I learned turkey works just as well in burritos as it does in sandwiches (

I just had their breakfast sandwich and it was really good. I walked in and I immediately smelled and saw them roasting red peppers. It seemed like everything in this place was made fresh. And it looked clean. My sandwich had an egg in it, and the egg was cooked on the grill not in the microwave like Lee's or Sweet Joannas, which will make me come back here often.
I've been eating here several times a week for years.
I heart their bagel breakfast sandwiches the bacon is real crispy!
Another uninspired sandwich shop in the financial district.
Delicious ham sandwich! It was around $5.50. It had ham,  cheese, avocado, tomatoes, lettuce, jalepenos on a soft ciabatta roll (?). Good price and good quality. Simple but so good!
Nova bar is a good semi-dive.  They have interesting beers on tap, and their prices are good for Soma.

The only reason to come here is the bottomless mimosas. This is a bar, not a restaurant, but I did like my corner beef with poached eggs (though my eggs were over cooked). But the mimosas made everything taste fantastic so ultimately a fantastic ladies night!

My guy and I love this place sooo much!   We have nothing but great memories here. Our second date, his first Superbowl, watching the Seahawks win their first Superbowl...and even though we've moved out of the area, we still go back for brunch and to watch the Seahawks play.    The food here is great, they mix it up every once and awhile and there have been a few misses but 9 out of 10, it's a winner.   My guy is a fiend for the tater tots and their corn beef hash.  Their huervo rancheros is my personal fave.   But hands downs, they have the spiciest most bad azz bloody mary in town.   Credit given to their special mix of jalepenos soaking in vodka you can see sitting in a giant jug behind the bar.   I love my bloody mary's super spicy and always have to ask for an extra shot of spice but DO NOT do that at Nova's or be prepared to have smoke come out of various orifices.

I was here this past weekend with my family to grab brunch on game day. Overall, we had a pretty bad experience. It was disappointing because my parents had been here before and felt differently. We were all just starving so we put up with it, but service was nothing special, orange juice was disgusting and the food was not good. My mom was served bacon that was completely cold and when she asked for warm bacon is was obvious they put some in the microwave for her. Most of us has luke-warm/cold tator tots with our breakfast too. The booth we were sitting in was covered in dead leaves from the window plant and the floors were dirty.

My sister and I had dinner at Nova's after a concert at At&t park. We ordered Spiced spare ribs , Mac&cheese and a Waldorf Ceasars salad. The food was great and so were the drinks. Good food, great location and awsome service.

not  a bad spot for brunch , tried the corned beef hash from a friend and it was really good, but my plate did not impress much , crab scramble with hollandaise , the hollandaise had too much lemon , will go give it another try , the service and vibe are great .
Kinda of disappointed, but we were all hungry and the other place we wanted to go was an hour wait.

Yum!  Ventured into this place after attending a Giants night game at the park and I'm so happy we did!  The kitchen was still open so we ordered lots of mac & cheese, salad and burgers.  We washed it all down with pints of beer and fancy cocktails.  Our server was pleasant, although I think she was a bit flustered with the post-game rowdy crowds that would drift in and out of the bar.

Despite the slow service we received, I actually really liked this place. We came for brunch before heading to a Giants game, and there was also the World Cup final on, so needless to say it was a really busy morning. We walked in and no hostess told us how long the wait would be or anything, so we assumed it would be long and left to find somewhere else to go. We ended up coming back because everywhere else was super packed, and had to go seek out someone who worked there and she had no idea how long it would be (but that was actually understandable since a lot of people stay long after they eat to watch the game).

This place is bomb! Went here before a giants game and had brunch with bottomless mimosas. The eggs Benedict is amazing. And not badly priced either. I recommend the black stone Benedict. Bacon & eggs what could be better??
YOU HAVE TO TRY their Philly Cheesesteak - thinly sliced and yummy peppers with a side of MAC & fabulous service. Love our new neighborhood!!!

Nova is my favorite bar and restaurant in SOMA: the bartenders are awesome, ambience is cool coz there's not too many TVs and it's not too bright, and the menu is awesome. I absolutely recommend the lobster and mushroom quesadila. Their margherita pizza is thin crust, the way it should be, and the warm spinach salad, tortilla soup and mac n cheese are fantastic. Great lunch spot, as well as place to go for after work drinks -- they make a seriously awesome Old Fashioned!
What's the best way to make a Monday night epic?  Starting out with a jalapeno shot from this place.
The food was great! I am a fan of their Mac n Cheese

After running our half marathon, we decided to have brunch here as it was roughly equidistant between the hotel we were staying at and where our friends live. Nova's got a nice big space and is probably a solid place to hang out when there's a sports event going on - there's a decent amount of Giants memorabilia hanging around. That said, it's nice and quiet if you want brunch here when it opens on Sunday, so we were able to get the circular front booth. Our waitress was nice, giving us time to think over the order, and she seemed to have a solid grasp of the brunch options.

This review is for the food. While staying at a rental property within walking distance of nova's, we decided that's where we'll order food. I was with 5 other people ..3 guys ordered burgers I got the chicken wings and Mac and cheese. Everyone who ate the burgers said they were good. The wings were good at best. The Mac and cheese was pretty damn good(but I've had better). My other friend ate the lobster quesadilla and said it was good.

I'm upping my review to 5 stars. I hadn't been in for a while, but recently started working in the neighborhood again. The mac-n-cheese is still the best I've had outside of moms. But, things have changed. It's brighter and nicer inside, with comfy, long booths. The menu has changed a lot....in a good way. The food has always been solid, but now there's more flair. I had the steak salad which I crave daily now, thanks a lot. Also, the salmon dinner comes with this sauce---it says saffron and I really don't taste that much saffron, but it's a delicate buttery, zesty sauce thats to die for.  The beers and drinks are pricey, but it's the city---what you gonna do? Great, friendly, still unpretentious service.

I've lived in Soma/South Park for 5 years and I am pretty sure this is the best bar/restaurant in the neighborhood. I don't really get the other reviews that say the food is bland because I think it's really great. Solid, interesting choices, especially during lunch and weekend brunch. Another plus side is the extensive spirits menu, which I especially appreciate because I am a bourbon drinker who goes through certain phases- bulleit to woodford to four roses, etc.

"Meh"  does sum it up. Food is bland and overpriced - including the mac and cheese which sometimes get rave reviews. Service mediocre. Wine selection limited. Our group was unimpressed. But super dark for those having affairs!
Yelp rated Nova as a 3.5...Its a rock solid 4+.  Great Lobster Quesadilla..the citrus creme fraiche was perfect.  $3.50 Mirror Pond drafts?  Thx!

I didn't really spend a lot of time here, but i enjoyed my $4 Stella after the workday. The bar has the typical happy hour techie crowd, and fills up fast around six. The interior is dark, and would be a great place to grab a drink before heading out to dinner or home for the night. The bartender that was on shift was quick to take my order, and didn't demand a card or anything, which was nice. I had to wait 20 minutes to pay though, because he went off the clock, and the other bartender got distracted doing several things at once.

"Meh" pretty much sums it up... Charging $13 for a drink with the cheapest alcohol available and no fresh ingredients involved is ridiculous and almost a crime. Even in San Francisco. Slow service. Waitress kept asking us  "Is it on the menu?" when we'd ask for a beer. Well, I don't know. YOU work here! You tell me if its on the menu! Also, I waited forever to order.. Not acceptable when the bar is empty. Am I being too hard on her? Umm.  No..

This review is for the bar and french fries only. We did not try any other food yet. We went in for a drink and sat at the bar. The bartender was super nice and made my husband an excellent martini. Sometimes that's hard to find. The atmosphere was nice and busy but not too busy. They had a good selection of beer. We then ordered some specialty fries and they were very good as well. The prices were great as well. We will definitely go back there for dinner sometime.

I love this place.  I have been in several times both for lunch and dinner, the food is great, rotating beers, and more bourbons than I can shake a stick at.  It is the staff that I have come to recognize who make the place awesome.  Some of the bartenders are masters at their craft and the lunch waiter made my girlfriend laugh so hard she tinkled.  This is a truly great neighborhood place.
I really liked this place a lot.

So we we were next door at 21st ammendment and were told for the best service go upstairs and have a seat it was 4pm on a Tuesday not busy at all. ..After 15 minutes and no server we just got up and left.  Thank god for Nova!!!!!!! Billy took great care of us!!!! Totally awesome guy, food was flipping amazing. .the crowd unpretentious and fun!!!! I love this bar. ..and it loves me!

Great restaurant/bar. The service is always amazing! Way better than 21st amendment next store. Billie the bartender was friendly and funny! We had a great time. The tomato and grilled cheese bite soup rocks, as well as the mini BLT! Coming back for brunch!
Pepper steak awesome seasoned well, lobster quesadilla was cooked well but I couldn't taste the lobster at all or see it. Crab tower was refreshing . Service bartender was attentive.

Sunday brunch is a relaxed affair at Nova. Alyse is so friendly and attentive that you will have great experience. Call me mean but she lost the last star because she's a dodgers fan and that's the only thing I can fault her on. Can't forget Chris behind the bar who makes great apple martinis and bloody Mary's. nova great spot for brunch.

I came here for a pre-night out dinner on a dear friend's birthday and I must say, it was much better than stuffing myself with pizza to gear up for a night of drinking like the other party did. No, my group had a nice, intimate (though cramped) dinner.
Had brunch here randomly. This place has delicious food for a bar! We had the apple French toast, the steak sandwich and the Mac and cheese! The Mac and cheese and tater tots are DELICIOUS!!!

This is more of a 3.5 star place.  Hubs and I decided to come here before our first Giant's baseball game (and on our year anniversary!).  Since hubs is new to baseball, I explained it might be a good idea to do some drinking outside of the stadium unless $10 beer was how he wanted to spend his money.
Very good Bloody Mary's. They only got 4 because I don't have enough to go off to give them more, or less.
They refill the Heinz Ketchup bottles with other terrible types :( Don't lie about what's in the bottle!
Love their tomato bisque w/ a nice surprise of grilled cheese toast points for perfect dunking!  Good neighborhood place for drinks & light meal for sure.

Oof, just a mediocre place. I went here thinking, "say it ain't so, Yelp!" But everyone's reviews were the truth. I had the crab tower appetizer and he had the sausage pizza. The crab appetizer was a very odd combination indeed, with seaweed salad on the bottom, jicama and mango cubes, and topped with crab, and surrounded by five very oily tortilla chips. I wouldn't come here again, but our waitress was very nice.
I can't believe it, but this place has amazingly good food for a bar. Say goodbye to the typical bar food snacks and hello heaven in your mouth.

Terrible! It's my friends bday so we have a table reserved.. It took our server FOREVER to bring us drinks! THEN I get the BILL and they not only add TAX for alcohol BUT they take also add 20% gratuity!! This server DID NOT deserve 20% AT ALL.. Will never come back.. WARNING: Don't get a table - likely that there's better service at the bar..
A free "welcome to Nova" shot? Yes please! Nova, what a great neighborhood find!  We are not from San Fran, but you can bet that we'll be back to Nova every time we're there!

I wish this place was open earlier! 11:30 isn't early enough for Bottomless Mimosas! :p I love the location! It's only a few blocks away from the Ballpark, so its perfect to get your money's worth before the game. $12 for bottomless mimosas, whereas the stadium charges $10-$12  for a beer.
I get lunch here almost every day. They rotate their choices frequently, and I have never been disappointed.
Good salads at a reasonable price. They really pack the salads in so you get enough for lunch - easily. Healthy and tasty!
Clean, cut fresh sides with gourmet sandwiches, but pricey.  It's a standard of one item for $6, two items for $10 and three items from the menu for $14.
Came here with a coworker for a bonding lunch.
I was hella hungry the other day and tried both the organic meatloaf and the roasted cauliflower sandwiches. The cauliflower was good (a bit too tangy/salty), but the meatloaf was delicious.
I waited to try this place for lunch twice before I wrote my review.. and I'm glad I did.
My office keeps on ordering their food and after awhile its the same stuff. Very meh.

I had resolved not to review Heyday again until I had something good to say.  They have a new Lentil Chicken Salad that is off the hook!  PLEASE never stop making this.  Together with the chickpea and kale salads, I am now happy whenever I go here.  Just wish they would make the dilled potato salad more often - that is so good as well.

On my first day at my office, we decided to go across the street to have a healthy meal. My coworkers mentioned that this place had some amazing salads and I was down to try a new joint. It was a done deal!
Good food, but overpriced!

Great food.  All organic choices.  One of the only places you can find all organic.  I wisg their food was a little more normal though.  Sometimes you feel like organic speggetti, pizza, or asian cuisine.  Do believe they should increase their organic options to more 'standard' foods.
My favorite lunch place downtown.  I get three items, usually, and save half for the afternoon.  That will set you back $14, but so will a Mixt Greens salad.

What a great deviation from typical lunch scene.  Simple Food done fresh, healthy and tasty.  While a plate with three antres and a drink pushing  $15 is a bit expensive but it is way better than a burger and fries.  I will go back.

Overall, this place is ok. A lot of their stuff is local/organic, so I get the price markups. Being someone who is budget conscious though, I had to factor that into my review and not give this place more stars. I've been here for lunch and usually gotten a sandwich, such as a fresh mozzarella sandwich I had a few weeks ago. Pretty delicious. I've heard their salads are pretty good as well.

You know you're getting old as hell when you look forward to buying oatmeal in the morning instead of a greasy fried egg sandwich. Not that I dislike the latter, but I don't find myself in a morning situation that requires fried egg sandwiches very often anymore (ie: extremely hungover).

Had lunch here while in town. The small menu was troubling, but I ended up deciding on a sandwich and salad, which I actually ended up enjoying. As far as portions, you probably do need two or three depending on your appetite, but I felt that two was just right for the price.

Just stumbled upon Heyday and decided to give it a try for lunch. I tried the two salad combo for $10 - romaine with cucumbers, mint and pumkin seeds, and roast chicken, farro, beets and radishes. Both were really yummy! This place is definitely going on my rotation!
Tiny, pretty food.
Ate Heyday as delivered to my office through TryCaviar.
Tried this place again (against my own advice) and I'ill say it again: a total rip off. Somehow I find myself feeling abused when paying $10 for a bowl of boiled birdseed and a drink. Phooey.

Pretty pricey for what you get.  Almost 6 bucks for half a sandwich is pretty steep even if it's organic.  I tried both the egg salad and the arugula chicken.  The chicken was better with a tasty aioli sauce even though it was a bit dry.  The egg salad was bland and stale in comparison.   Both sandwich halves weren't quite as stuffed as I would like.  The salad offerings looked good but I'd rather hit Super Duper with what's left of my lunch money.  With the trend of new healthy lunch spots opening up, it's becoming harder to find a decent meal for your slimming wallet.

I'm stoked to find heyday. Organic, healthy, salads. And no hipsters in line to beat in downtown San Francisco yipee! Just wish they can serve better coffee and start a rewards program for it is pricey at $10 for 2 items. Oh hell, can you complain when the staff do stuff as much as possible in those tiny salad boxes? :) hope you're around for a couple years Heyday.
I'm not sure how I've been working in the Financial District for so long and never knew about this place, but I'm glad I know now!

It's like the really healthy wholesome food you would expect to get at the Whole Foods deli counter (or Bi-Rite). Not cheap but comparable. The sandwiches seem a bit small ($6 for half a sandwich?) but the salads seem on par. Since there aren't many options like this in this area of town you can't be too picky (otherwise pack your own food!).
This restaurant is healthy, fast, and delicious!  Great price for the quality of food you get. Service staff is courteous and friendly.

Food is decent, but portion is horrible.   Only good thing about this place is you'll never gain weight eating here... given tiny portions just not possible.   I'd love this place to offer 'hearty' or 'guy' portions for a few dollars more.   After all... really how expensive is cabbage or quinoa?
In honor of yesterday's SF Giants' home opener, three strikes, and you're out!

Great concept for lunch - fast with lots of optionality.  Most get 2 for $10 deal and can select among soup du jour, a few sandwiches, and lots of salad variations. Felt healthy and was definitely very fast. Not exactly cheap given portion sizes though. And I didn't find it very delicious. I'm a 5'4" girl and I was starving again by 4pm.

So says the place is open from 7am to 3pm, but i get there at 10:40 for lunch because i have meeting for the rest of the day and the guy behind the counter says yuo have to wait 15 mn for a roast beef sandwich, and i say, there are 15 of you behind the counter you cannot prioritize my sandwich, he says NO. How does this place expect to survive long term if already its is rated 3.5 on yelp and the sandwiches are so expensive and the customer service is below zero

$10 can get you full. That is about the same as elsewhere. The portion may seem small but they give you healthy food. We had chickpea and a sandwich. I wish they could heat up the sandwich because I don't like them to be cold.

antastic place for a quick lunch in the financial district. Healthy, creative dishes. Fast and friendly service. I get in long line at noon that is snaking down the street but have my food in hand 15 minutes later max. Gotta love that. Very vegetarian friendly, too.

I tried this place for lunch today and found the food to be fresh and quite nice. I had the farro salad with chicken and enjoyed it. My colleague had the soup and liked it a lot (although she found herself wishing for more salt). The portions are somewhat small for the price and the flavors are subtle but it is a solid place for a healthy lunch.

Met a friend for lunch who worked nearby at Charles Schwab. Came here just a little before noon to beat the long line. I got the mozzarella and mushroom sandwich and their special daily salad - beet, cauliflower and cabbage. Flavors were very good and fresh. Also had a mint hibiscus house tea. That was pretty good too, but half of it was ice, so felt like I didn't get a lot of value. Pricing is probably higher, but the food is fresh , expect to pay more for good fresh food. I'd come back to try the other salads, the kale salad looked great. Great vegetarian selection.

Unquestionably the best lunch in downtown San Francisco, with prepared food that can go head-to-head with Bi-Rite Market. No joke! The design of the space is awesome, the food is delicious, and the people are great. Try the sweet potatoes, farro salad, and roast beef sandwich (yes, its happy meat). Delicious. Bravo, Heyday.

Went here for breakfast this morning. Have been to Heyday a couple of times for lunch or breakfast. Most of my colleagues love it because it's healthy and clean and they prepare the food in front of you.

This place is great for fresh, healthy options. I hear they have some great breakfast choices, but I ordered take-out for lunch here. I online ordered which was easy because you set a time for it to be ready, you pay online and you just come in and grab the food while skipping the lunch crowd. I got the 2 item combo for $10 which is pretty pricey, but the quality of the food was pretty tasty. I picked the raw kale salad and the chickpea and quinoa salad, both which were quite flavorful. The bitterness of the raw kale was balanced by its creamy dressing, and the quinoa and chickpea salad was seasoned with a bunch of good flavors. It made me surprisingly full I had to save my leftovers for later. It doesn't look like a lot but it did leave me satisfied. I'll definitely be back here to pick up more lunch, and to try and explore more flavors and varieties.

I find the food here to be quite tasty. The food is fresh and healthy, and the flavors are well developed. I usually go for the two item combo which is about the right amount of food for me for lunch. However, given the portion size, I think they are quite overpriced. I only go to them in a pinch because of their easy online order system and pickup. My favorites are the squash sandwich and the chickpea salad.
Delicious, fresh, imaginative.  This is the only place around you can get high quality food quickly!  The soups are the best i have had. The service is always friendly.

Kudos for having fresh, quality food. I definitely feel like this is definitely a great healthy option for lunch. I would have to say it's definitely pricey esp for a soup/sandwich combo at $10. If you add a pellegrino or soda, you're looking at $12-13+ for lunch.

There are a lot of decent places to grab lunch near my office, especially places that focus on salads and sandwiches, but I feel that Heyday consistently rises above all the others in quality, simplicity and most importantly, taste. It's fresh and I feel good after I eat there because it's healthy. I've never been disappointed with anything I've tried and I've definitely tried a lot by now. I've been going to Heyday pretty regularly since they opened (basically before the line started going around the corner).
Townsend never fails to deliver a great brunch, especially for a large group.
I had the best pancakes ever today - oatmeal pancakes with almonds and pear cooked inside.  The free scones on the table were amazing as well

A friend and I came here for breakfast the other day. Although we'd made a reservation, I didn't really feel as if we were seated somewhere a reservation would put us (why do restaurants seat you Right Next to the busy table even though there are oodles of adjacent options?). No matter, we had a fun waiter, and enjoyed most everything that we had there very much. When we sat they brought us a basketful of muffins and scones and those were quite tasty.

While the food quality is good, the service leaves a lot to be desired. That is probably hit or miss, depending on day or time of day, but the last 2 times I was there it seemed the waitstaff was inaccurate and unapologetic about it. Given the opportunity to correct the mistake they were snide. I'm not thrilled about going again. There are so many other places nearby I don't ever have to.
Great food & service. Not sure what people have to complain about.

I only come and eat brunch in this area with a friend from South Bay. For him, it's just easier for him to meet up with me in that area of China Basin. He chose this location and we got sat pretty quickly which is really nice for a brunch on a weekend.
Went here for brunch on a Saturday around 2.

Overpriced, slow and rude service, mediocre food. 30 minutes for eggs and bacon ($13) comes with a full plate of rude service who "didn't want to argue why it takes so long" before waking away and slamming a bill on the table. Yeah, probably not going back here...
I really enjoyed this place the food is really good. They also give you a lot of food. I well differently be eating here agin.
I had the Eggs Benedict and it was solid.  The waitress was hispanic and she was attentive for the most part.  Solid place overall.

I went there for breakfast this morning. We ordered coffee, toast, bacon and potato pancakes. The bacon looked like microwave bacon they sell you frozen at supermarkets. The potato pancakes tasted very funny, oily taste. The waiter came for the usual "is everything ok?", we said not really and explained. She looked at us and said "ok". We waited thinking that someone would come to give us some explanation, but nobody came. Requested the check immediately and left.
I agree with the other 3-star reviews of this place.  This is a solid breakfast spot, but only a few items to come back for.
Great selection of food and attentive service. We really enjoyed our brunch as well as the ambiance.
Great salmon scramble.  Wait staff was friendly & helpful.  Eggs are local & free range.
We love Town's End!  We hadn't been there in quite awhile because we moved and it was to great to find that's it's as good as ever.  Great food and service.
Some reason my friends always want to come here. Their scones and muffins are dry and tastes the same as Costco's.

Though at the first glance seemed pricy -quality must better than many. Among the menu the fried chicken I had in the first day really gave me joy of taste. Shareable experience from the staff - favorite food from the chefs-price for the food then seem ok considering the quality. Also had on the other visit the spicy black bean ----love the chicken overall. Will go more more and more--but only timing a problem for me to deal with other -single move not enjoyable.
best egg benedict ever!!!!!
This place is pretty delicious. The workers are friendly and relaxed. The service is very slow. If you're in a rush or need to be on your way in 3mins I wouldn't dine here.

Came here over the weekend to celebrate my mother's birthday and left satisfied but expecting a bit more.  Town's End starts you out with a basket of small muffins and a nice view of some of the piers.  I had one of their bloody mary's which I had heard good things about, but was very disappointed with.  Tasted watered down and uninspired.
They were very accommodating and nice to our group of 8.

Service was ok. I do loved the baked goods brought to our table when we arrived to this venue, but service just didnt make it for me. We sat outside during a really nice sunday morning for brunch and you can get a bit of a view and that was nice. I ordered a salad and fruit bowl, It was tasty but I dont think you can go wrong with this. Would I come here again? maybe, but was not wowed but this restaurant.
Open over the July 4th long weekend and got the seat (for 2) right away at 10am
Items Selected:

....this used to be a jewel of a place, used to have an extraordinary small bakery,  used to go there regular, used to recommend to friends.  For various reasons they have cut down hours, now its average quality for higher than average price...
$11 gets you two medium-small pancakes and a shot glass of mrs butterworth's chemical syrup. How can they look themselves in the mirror?

Convenient to financial district.  A bit of a hidden gem.  We were heading somewhere else when we found this restaurant.  Very nice inside and nearly every table is a window seat.  Great breakfast place!  Loved the muffins they brought first thing!  Our food was great :)
Quaint little breakfast place! Really enjoyed the eggs Benedict, wasn't crazy about the hash browns though...
Great place to eat before a Giants day game. No dinners any more. I had Eggs Benedict. Very fine. Good mimosa. Fast and friendly service.
Nice little place with great view on the bridge and piers.

Delicious brunch. The staff are always incredibly friendly, and on a nice day a table near the window overlooking the Bay Bridge and the water can't be beat. The basket of mini-pastries when you sit down doesn't hurt, either! Recommended: Mary's Special.
Great view of the embarcadero and a great place for brunch! Their Belgian waffles are amazing and the chicken pot pie was great as well. My personal favorite is their Cafe Mocha! Their barista rocks!
Very good simple food. I had banana-walnut pancakes with an order of strawberries. Quite good food, service is a bit scattered. Points for serving maple syrup.
Great a Fish Taco! Fresh salsa & Tomatillo & black beans. And the bread was delicious!  Also, FREE 2 hour street parking!
it was okay, the omelets are done only covering the top

Ordered the portobello mushroom salad and some potato chips. Amazing. The greens were fresh and firm, the dressing came on the side and the peppers and mushrooms were cooked perfectly. I've never had polenta and I'm a fan now. Definitely coming back to try more of their menu items.
Great brunch, we are never disappointed in the food or the service.

My boyfriend and I came to San Francisco and asked a friend for some recommendations. We had been told by a different friend that San Francisco had great food so our expectations had been set pretty high. Town's End Restaurant was recommended for breakfast/brunch and let me tell you... It didn't disappoint! There was only one server but he kept it together even when almost all the tables were sat and the food was great! I personally LOVED their freshly squeezed OJ and the baked muffins and scones they bring out with the fresh berry purée. I have never had a breakfast place bring something like these out and it added a nice touch. Not to mention there is a great view looking at the Bay Bridge eh adds to the already quaint atmosphere. We will definitely come back here for breakfast next time we come back and will make sure to recommend it to anyone coming to visit the city.

I like this place. Close to the spot and never too long of a wait (so far). They have complimentary baked pastries (which is nice), decent portions, and their food is good. Nothing notable, but a decent place for breakfast/brunch.
We like coming here for breakfast when we are in San Francisco.  It is good clean, nice atmosphere and friendly waiters. They give a fresh baked bread basket with scones and muffins.

The food is good - there's enough for everyone to get something that they like, and its generally of a very high quality. I've had the steak salad, the ahi tuna sandwich and the pizza and all were very good.  The service is always excellent too - great waiters.  It's perfect for a big group in SOMA.
I had hoped their 'revamp' a year or so ago would have improved their menu.

Came in for brunch on a Sunday morning. Jared was great, very attentive and friendly. Got eggs Benedict and there was a small mistake on the order. They quickly fixed the issue and we enjoyed our meal. Made a reservation easily on open table and were seated right away. Over all great experience and Jared was awesome! Just moved into the area, definitely coming back soon. When Jared is working of course :)
Excellent happy hour, great location and perfectly fried fries! Skip the pizza though, it's subpar at best.
My boyfriend and I went here last night before attending Cirque du Soleil.  The restaurant was closed for a private party.  However, they were offering the full menu in the bar.
Average food. Overpriced. Friendly service.
MoMo's literally "hit it out of the park" for us before going to Game 5 of the World Series yesterday!
GO GIANTS!
Fun place to catch a drink and some grub if you can't make it into the game. Very busy and very loud during baseball season, not in baseball season this place could be a good destination for a date.

Great hangout at giants game time. Tonight it was a fun place to be to watch the World Series Game 1 SF Giants against the KC Royals. The restaurant was well staffed and food was served hot and fairly fast. As usual we had no problem getting our beer. It is my favorite spot for watching the Giants game if I'm not in the stadium.

Horrible horrible horrible bartenders! Did i say rude as can be? And horrible. You would think a good place to catch the giants game but man if you want to be pointed at and ignored try this place. Such good food and location  managment please drop the older girl in the pony tail and the guy working with her.  They were an embarrassement to this great spot on the noght the giants won the pennant and are heading to the world series. Sorry Momo's but a bad employee trumps good food and location.
There are few folks happier for #OrangeOctober than MoMo's.

Omg, terrible. I came here for my boyfriends birthday brunch and really wish I hadn't. I ordered eggs Benedict with Dungeness crab and the sauce was so tangy! Too tangy. I really did not enjoy it. The server was so nice and offered to substitute a meal for it because I didn't like it but the brunch menu wasn't appealing to me. My boyfriends pulled pork sandwich was also a problem. The meats sweetness got old fast and he only took two bites before he was done. The server, again, was super sweet and took both items off of our bill. We had also ordered pizza, the tomato basil was super salty and the sausage mushroom had no salt at all. Service was great but the prices were too high for the food they have.

Came here for drinks after a Giants game one Sunday. Most bars around AT&T Park are packed after each game (especially after a Giants win), but MoMo's seemed the most lively. We got blatantly ignored at the bar and passed over for people who had been waiting for less time. When we finally did get the bartender to serve us, he had an attitude. This soured the entire experience for me. There are plenty of bars and restaurants surrounding AT&T Park to choose from that DON'T treat their patrons rudely. I'd suggest finding one of them instead.
Welp, it's a restaurant/bar next to the home field of the Giants. And since I've only visited on a game day, I can't say I could even tell you what the place looks like, it was so packed.
Came to MoMo's before last nights Giants vs Dodgers game at AT&T Park. Joined 3 friends for an exciting evening..

Who knows who got what bag of money to allow this place to open before the ballpark was finished. Kudos to them. I've been here numerous times for numerous reasons so I guess its about time I reviewed. Good place to go to get a shot and a beer before the ball game. I spent one entire game AT the bar even though I had a ticket. That's how much fun I had. Of course, we got seats, which is a miracle. In case you don't know, its right across the street from "telephone park"
Great location. Nice menu. Great burgers and pork sandwiches. Friendly staff. Nick is a great waiter.

I had heard so much hype about this place from TV and radio about it being THE spot to hit up before Giants homes, but after visiting, it was just OK and left not knowing why so much hype as there are many other restaurants and bars on this street right across from AT&T Park.
I had a nice piece of salmon here. They made onion stings for us even though they weren't on the menu.

My boyfriend and I tried this place before we went to the Giants game and I'm glad we did.  When you first walk in, a security guard will check for id to make sure you're over 21 (since there is a bar outside and the main bar inside) and you can go inside or stay outside to drink.

Ugh. I must say the only reason we walked in this place was because I hadn't pre-selected somewhere for dinner! I should have definitely looked into other places in the area, because I am very disappointed we selected this as our dinner location.
This is the go to spot before giants games...great outdoor patio area & usually about 6 bartenders on so getting a drink even though packed isn't to hard..has pretty good food also...

The service was the most outstanding part of my dinner experience at MoMo's. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. The food was all right but overpriced, especially considering the size of the portions. Our ahi tuna tartare appetizer was lackluster. My salmon entrée was good but at $27 seemed way too expensive for the amount and quality of food I got. The tastiest part of the meal was our desserts: flourless chocolate torte and an ice cream sundae, both of which were very good. MoMo's is all right if you're in a pinch and just need someplace to go for dinner, but I wouldn't recommend it as worth the price.
Decent food but over priced for what you get. We asked for blue cheese stuffed olives and they nicely offered to make them but then charged us $5 for the service! Really???

This place was pretty good. I came here to meet my parents for lunch before a Giants game, which I think might have resulted in the slower service. It took a long time for our order to be taken, but once it was the food came out very quickly. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries and cole slaw. The sandwich was good, the fries yummy, but the cole slaw was nothing special. I did also get the strawberry basil lemonade, which was great. Overall pretty good, but I wouldn't say I would go out of my way to go here from across town. Definitely a good place eating if you are going to a Giants game though.

Place is convenient if you're going to the Giants game but food was a miss for the price and so was the service. They are all about turning tables. My pasta was so-so. Dry with very light sauce if any. Not very much Italian sausage as advertised and even less broccoli. I was done with my food but not my beer and some lady (not dressed as a server) came up, put her hand on my glass and then asked me in another language than English whether I was done with my beer. I told her no and she looked at me like I was crazy. As I type this, a busboy picked up my hisbamd's napkin while he visited the restroom. What if he needed it when he came back. My pasta was $22, husband's gumbo was $20. Definitely won't be back.
7/19/14  Dinner

I've wanted to come here for a while solely because of the name (my cat's nickname is Momo). Finally I got the opportunity to check it out this past weekend. We made sure there was no Giants game going on because we didn't want to be stuck in any crowds, and went around 1pm on Sunday afternoon.
I had a burger - average, highly overpriced food. I won't be coming here again, since there's better food at half the price within the same block.
My and 2 friends came here on Saturday during the giants game, place was empty, so we sat down to order food and drinks at the bar.

Fun bar right across from the ballpark. Beers are only $6 compared to $10+ inside. They also have multiple TV's with the game on. I was there the other day and met the most awesome employee. He gave me a ticket to the game that he had been given (but he was working, so couldn't go). Totally made my day! I will definitely come back! :)

My first time to visit Momo's today before opera at the ballpark. Excellent service! Great atmosphere. Pulled pork sliders and steak skewers were perfect for quick bite before heading across the street.
Came before La Traviata at the ballpark for dinner. The hostess wasn't at the front so we had to flag down a waitress to get seated.

MoMo's is one of the coolest venues in LA. I've been to a bunch of private parties and a few wrap parties there and every time it was fantastic! There's a VIP lounge on the second floor that makes you feel like you're in Morocco.The patio is the best, candles everywhere! We loved the cocktails and food - they make some of the best pizza i've ever had.

Best calamari in town! The burger I had for lunch was so delicious! I loved my ice cream dessert and tasty Irish coffee as well! During our meal, we met the owner. He is an awesome guy! I'll definitely be back!
I came here to celebrate my wedding with my new wife and my friends.. The food was stunning and the service exceeded my expectations..

A friend chose the place, so I didn't know what to suspect. It is right across from the ballpark, so I can imagine how crazy it could get during the games. The food was very good, but nothing stood out.
Some of the worst and most overpriced food in the city.  Only tolerable if you are too drunk too notice. This will never change as long as they are right next to the ballpark.
Upon reading other reviews, wasn't too sure about this place, but went in on a friend's recommendation. I actually thought it was pretty good!
This review for Happy Hour. I'm unimpressed.

Stopped in for a drink prior to going up to my room at the hotel next door. Ordered their jalapeno ginger margarita- tasted good spicy like I like it. However, only intending to have one drink went to cash out and apparently they only accept debit cards for purchases above $20! That is ridiculous!  Its not like I'm buying a $2 soft drink its a $10 + tax cocktail! That is just obnoxious and cheap. I asked if they had a debit charge and, no, only the $20 min. Just silly!! Thanks now I can get screwed by both your "convenient" ATM fees and my banks fee.Jesus it's 2014 get SQUARE.

Rounding up from my real rating of 3.5 stars. I hosted a private event here, and it's a perfect place for a small VIP party if you are looking for a venue. The main event space is gorgeous, with small booths and a good sized dancefloor area where we had a table for hors d'oeuvres.
Two stars because they automatically add gratuity to your bill even though your party is less than 6.  Look and ask for  the itemized receipt..

Do not give these people your credit card.  They will overcharge you (apparently the menu price is not the real price) and charge you for things you did not order.  Went here with some friends, didn't order food, but was billed for food and they were completely arrogant about the mistake even though they had continually brought orders to our table that were not ours.  Extremely rude staff who basically steal from first time guests as they count on you not living in SF to come back and contest the charges.  Never going back.

Ok no fronts...I'm drunk as hell right now. Just came from Region where the baby octopus was good, bun bo hue was "aite" and the service was so so when it came to getting your order right. But it's Thursday, I got drunk there, I sang, rapped, drank, danced with other drunk hotties and made new friends. Granted I'm pretty awesome but it's a great place to meet other awesome people through karaoke and alcohol. Went here on a lark and will def be back. I can see how a place like this can have an off day. All I can say is I had the raddest Thurs night in a long time. Ok back to my drunken Bart ride....
I really enjoyed the attention to detail that this restaurant pays to both the food and the decor. Finally a trendy bar in the city that has good food too!

Came with a coworker after work....well break from work, since I had to hit the laptop later that night, and need a good HH fix. Thought I would try this place out, as it was on my happy hour (HH) list, and near my office in the Fidi.

Went here for dinner and choose all seafood options: Pad Thai prawns, salt and pepper squid, papaya salad with calamari, and salmon. It all sounded really good but we were pretty darn disappointed. All the seafood was obviously frozen and reheated. Nothing tasted remotely fresh or flavorful. Prices are steep for the lower quality and bland food. Seemed like other people were there for the happy hour. Maybe the drinks are worth it? We left with our stomachs full of food but still hungry for taste. FYI there is also a $20 min for credit cards and an automatic 18% gratuity included in the bill.

The second time I came here was two weeks ago for karaoke, I thought the sound system wasn't good (it was probably belonged to the owner) and didn't like the energy. However, I went on 8-21-14 8:40pm'sh, this time my friends and I ordered fried egg rolls, soup that contained ham and noodles, few other items, definitely delicious. I drank two trumers beers, amf, and a mojito.  Also, they repositioned their speakers and the karaoke machine more towards the front of the bar, much better sound, and more persons entered into this venue.  My friends and I sang at least 3 songs and was enjoyable to hang around with them.

My most recent trip to SF was to see Beyonce and JayZ in concert at AT&T park. My cousin and I were to meet friends for happy hour prior to the concert they decided on Region because of its central location. Upon entry I was met with delightful aromas and sounds of laughter and numerous conversation.
