The diningroom is a lofty comfortable space appropriately decorated with contemporary furniture and lighting. The happy Hour Menu was quite extensive and diverse in its offerings. To start I ordered the Japanese tea cocktail. The drink wasn't a standout in my opinion and tasted almost exactly like a midori sour. Our small plates were next, spareribs (they were actually full pork ribs) , 8 spice chicken , stuffed peppers and a mushroom steamed rice. The ribs were by far my favorite, the tender meat literally slipped off the bone and into my mouth sending me into heavenly bliss with each bite.  The other items were good and quite filling, our table. Myself and others included absolutely enjoyed ourselves. For a happy hour spot in such close proximity to the concert venue I expected them to be better staffed. Our server was also the bartender and with such a lean staff he was pulled in several different directions and service suffered as a result. I will definitely return for dinner and to try other small plate offerings. Region is a great place for food and for friends to have fun!
udon beef soup is good. and pork shanks

Had dinner reservations at Region for dinner and was curious about the food there since I've heard about the place being a lounge nightclub in the evenings.  The bar area is in the front and the spacious dining room had three booths in one side and larger booth table on the other sides and some tables in the middle of the room with a DJ booth overlooking the floor.  You can see how this is set up to be a nightlclub with the dance floor in the middle.
Doris and Matthew the bartender are the best.  Great service, good drinks, cool place.
Pretty standard fare - decent food while you pay for the 'trendy' atmosphere.  Also seems to be a spot where you can rent out the place post-dinner, if you're having a private party or something.

If you are in town on business this is a pretty good option if you are alone. The food is decent, drinks solid and service acceptable. You will certainly not be blown away by your experience and your expense account will take a hit but there are not too many places in San Francisco that will not kill the expense account.

Hip little joint. Not terribly family-friendly, but someone recommended it to my uncle so off the 16 of us went! For a Saturday night it was dead, which is generally a warning sign, but the club-like atmosphere made it seem like it gets busier later in the evening. I ordered the salmon rolls, the special fries, and the short rib ramen. All of which were tasty and seemed to be freshly-prepared. The waitress seemed a bit frazzled and forgot to take my father's order twice. Most of my brothers and cousins order pho, my husband got pad Thai, and I saw some duck on the table too. No complaints but nothing special. They did accommodate my picky young daughter with some plain pork skewers and a plan prep of the fries that she actually ate, so that was a success.
Living nearby in South Beach it can be hard to find new places to go out for food. This night we didnt want to go to our old haunts and so found this little number on opentable.
Very mediocre food and the wait staff seemed disorganized and not very interested in service. Won't return.
Short Story:
Very mediocre food.  Wait staff is plentiful, but a bit disorganized.  Asked for no jalapeño on my dish only to have it there.  Drinks are relatively good. Music is very loung-y. Nothing special.

We were at Region for a Bday Party, but had dinner prior. We had the BBQ pork ramen, the salmon rolls, and the house fries. Ramen was pretty good. I didn't really like the salmon roll much. And, the fries were okay. Food, I thought, was 3.5 at best. I heard good things about the duck dish and the Pad Thai, but I didn't try them.

There was bad traffic on the bridge and I pulled off and found this place. I remember coming to this spot before when it was a Mexican restaurant, now its some kind of fusion. I ordered a Tiger Beer and some pork sticks during happy hour. It was OK nothing fantastic, but I saw more interesting items on the menu that I would like to try next time.
This place is pretty good. A few of my friends and I went the Wednesday before Valentines day and ordered 4 dishes plus 4 glasses of champagne.

Came here after work to grab a bite. It was packed but were still able to be seated. We expected slow service as it was valentines day. Everything we ordered was on point. Must try : fried baby octopus and house french fries with furikake (seaweed) and truffle oil. The grass fed beef is a bit spicy but delicious (might want to order side of rice next time)
My experience here is similar to the one that Eddie W. wrote about just a short time ago this year.
Happy Hour Review only
Came here to have some good Beijing Duck (Peking Duck) and was not disappointed.  Well prepared with fresh condiments and pancakes. Look for it in the appetizer section.

With Region so close to our office, we decided to give them a try for happy hour. As soon as you walk in, the ambiance is definitely slick and feels like you have been transported to a lounge club in Vegas. It is definitely great for groups and ample seating for such a tight space.

I've never eaten here, only been for drinks. The drinks are decent, not too pricey (though not cheap) and the service is quite good.  The problem is, this smell comes in from the Bay and it smells like rotten eggs/sulfur so strongly it makes you gag.  I've been here probably 6 times (yes, I keep going back as it is across the street from my office) and the smell has happened 4 times.  Fun place other than the smell.
Had crispy rolls and ramen.  The crispy rolls were good. Ramen was weird.  It has bok choy, seaweed, cilantro and green onions.   Not that tasty.   The decor was like a club.
Had friends birthday there, drinks were awesome, specially the Asian bartender made his own special drinks!!
I have been here several times spread out over many months, maybe over a year. The food is good but the service is really poor.

Came here for a company party. Ambiance and food was ok. The frame in the front that looks like a fireplace is cool. I didn't like I had to leave the building and go outside to use the bathroom. The bar tenders were nice and did a great job pouring drinks. They have a dj booth that is elevated, kinda cool location, but the sound system could be better.

The reservation system is poorly attended.  Made a web reservation 3 days ahead - no response.  Call requesting confirmation c/b morning of planned meal, no c/b.  Stop in 90' ahead and advised there's a private party.  Little apparent concern and no responsible employee available to provide feedback.
I work across the street and have been to Region several times and unfortunately, have been nothing but disappointed.
We ordered two drinks (a whiskey and a gin on the rocks) and the bartender screwed them both up. This place is awful. We will never be back.
My wife and I love this place. The half or whole duck is great. Region has a rad atmosphere, too. Worth checking out.

This review is only for the bar area. We were staying in The Griffon Hotel next door and stopped by for happy hour drinks because the lighting in the bar area was very inviting. We were seated promptly, but then it was very difficult to get the attention of our server after that. It was apparent that the servers were more interested in chatting with each other rather than serving us. I'm only going with the two stars because the bar has a good physical aura, although the ATM machine by the front door is tacky. The cheap drinks and tasty potstickers partially make up for the in attentive servers. Perry's in the hotel a few steps away is a better choice.

The food may be great, but the service is horrific. Went there last night, and there were only about 6 tables seated. They have ONE waitress for the whole dining room taking order, serving drinks, and bussing tables. After 20 minutes of ordering our first drinks we are told they are out of Tiger beer. I order a Trumer. She brings a Stella after another 5 minute wait, saying they are out of Trumer. At the 45 minute mark we had accomplished only one drink each, and the appetizers showed up at the 45 minute mark. Now we order a second round of drinks. Seriously, it took 20 minutes for the second round to show up. Asked for waters as well - those NEVER showed up. The service was ridiculously SLOW and the waitress became rude halfway into the dinner because I asked her how long it will take to get water. My suggestion: Stay Away From This poorly run business. It won't be long before there is a "For Lease" sign in the window.

Amazing breakfast sandwiches!  Breakfast boat is soooo yummy!  New favorite!!   The bread is warm and soft, yet slightly toasted. The cheese eggs and Tita all melt together. The saltiness if the sausage is perfect!!  Will definitely start coming here in the mornings!!

I don't understand all the high reviews this place gets, their sweet potato tots are usually a little raw in the center, their turkey burger meat tastes stale, their other burgers are mediocre at best, and their execution is spotty and unreliable. The previous Burger joint in that location was much better. I only come here when the SuperDuper and Bistro Burger lines are too long, but no more.

I think that being new to the food court that is located in Rincon Center with other competitors, is the reason why their food and the staff flow is to be determined or to be for the better on improvement.

The skin-on French Fries made me happy with just the right amount of crispiness and salt.  Fries aren't usually much better than a ketchup vehicle, but these were delicious stand-alone as was the basic burger with it's lettuce, tomato, sauce and sauteed onions.
The sliders are so tasty. The bread for the sliders tastes fresh. The cashier is very friendly. I will be back.

This new lunch spot popped up in the Rincon center a couple months ago, and I finally gave it a try today. The line goes out the door during peak lunch hours, just like any other food spot in the Rincon center, but the line moves fairly quickly. I got the waffle sandwich with bacon and eggs. From the moment I saw the worker toss a soggy waffle into a panini press, I was unimpressed. Even worse, when I bit into the waffle sandwich, the waffle was still soggy! I would definitely not order this again. I'm giving this place 3 stars still because the fish and chips looked fresh and crispy, and the fries were really good. I'll come back and give this place another shot.

I really love the menu here. I had a hard time deciding what to order both times I went because it all looks so good.They put a new and interesting spin on things like having an egg on a burger or fried ice cream sandwiches. The burgers are so good, probably one of the best I have had in a long time. I can't wait to go back and try the desserts.
I have had the burger a few times which is always good, and last time my wife ordered the veggie skewers which were awesome.  Good food, fast and friendly service, and will be back.

The food court at Rincon Center is essentially the urban equivelant of a highway rest area.  It's role is to provide a quick meal for those working in the area but you need to have modest expectations.  If your alternative is going to One Market almost any option here is good enough and a quarter star better because you didn't pay $30 for lunch that day.

I love Roadys- it is what is says it is.  Generously sized and economical, quality ingredients.  If you have trouble ordering or understanding the concept, well, I don't think they can help you, you can't even help yourself.  It's a burger that's easier to eat, it's not supposed to be Michael Minna or Wolfgang Puck's version of a burger.
Why mess with the form of something that has been a great success if there is nothing to gain from it? I mean, perhaps to allow bacon strips to fit better?
What can I say...  This was my fourth time at Roadys Longburger and I'm still a fan!

I work in the Rincon Center and this place has been a WELCOME addition to the food court!  The staff is amazingly nice and accommodating and their short order cook is irreplaceable!  Currently I'm on the Paleo diet and they have helped me create a Louisiana Hot Link salad with egg and avocado that is to die for - and when they were out of sausages, I tried it with the bacon and burger & it was equally fabulous!  Have never been disappointed and worth every cent...I hope they don't mess with the formula (as start-ups tend to do)...it's working!

The Long Burger was pretty good.  But the experience at the store wasn't great.  Menu hard to read.  The ordering process was confusing.  Not much ambiance.  Par for the course with Rincon Center.  The whole food court there is on average a 3-star experience.

Awesome lunch spot! The OMG burger is a must try. A cheese burger with fried eggs! Sign me up. Really unique sides like Angry Edamame. Yum getting hungry just thinking about it. A definite place to check out. I have eaten a lot of burgers all around the world. Roady's is definitely one of the greats!

It's more than just a burger, it's an explosion in your mouth. The meat was juicy and was cooked to perfection. I hope I'm not exaggerating too much but there is no other way to describe this place. Must try when your around the area. The service is also excellent. It's rare to have a fast food place provide not excellent food quality but also great service.

The burger was excellent, and the service was supper fast. If you're the kind of person who does not have time to wait for more than 5 minutes for your food, then this place is perfect for you. I had the Corned Beef Hash Sliders and the Grilled Pesto Chicken Sliders both of these were amazing!!!! They were grilling the chicken per order, how many fast food place actually grill their chicken per order ? Probably none... (Well, at least not in the Rincon food court anyway) My food was super fresh and delicious.
CANNED CORNBEEF HASH, oh no they didn't!
The Burger was tasty and the fries were great. Not greasy at all. The service was fast, I would recommend it to friends. The idea alone is brilliant, I look forward to eating there again.

Decided to check out the second new addition to Rincon Market. The burgers at Roady's Longburger is true to its name as far as the shape goes. Instead of your traditional round patties. they serve it similar to a hot dog shape in a deli roll.
Time: 12:37pm/74°F partly sunny

The line at SOMA Chicken was out the door so I decided to give Roady's a shot. I had the Louisiana hot link sandwich and onion rings. I couldn't even finish the sandwich. Next time, I'll get to SOMA Chicken before the lunch crowds hit.

Just checked out this new spot after reading the positive reviews.  I must say, I was very impressed. I had the OMG burger and it is the best burger I have had in San Francisco by far.  The tater tots were great as well.  Can't wait to go back and try the other items on the menu.
So yummy.  Amazing burger and love the bun too.  On top of it, super friendly service.

New to the area and checking out various quick and easy places for lunch. Didn't have high expectations for Roady's but was pleasantly surprised - I had their OMG Burger, which is a fairly standard burger with an over-easy fried egg thrown in.
Nothing to complain about here. Couldn't distinguish this burger from the countless ones I've eaten at the Olympic Club. Fries were tasty and I believe the value is good.

As you can tell I haven't written a review in nearly 4 years.  But, I'm a burger guy and I'm always trying the new burger joint in town.  Roadys is the best burger in the FiDi hands down.  I've read some of the reviews and I don't think some people know the difference between greasy and juicy.  This burger is all juicy with the amazing grilled onion spread and the grilled bun.  If you even like burgers you need to go try this place and then you'll love this burger.
Took my 1st grade son and he liked the burger.  I really enjoyed the dessert  "crema pressata"...unique and very good!

Not very impressed by this new place... Their burger are very average (I'm generous) and I still don't understand the longburger thing. The person giving the food was lazy and my order was sitting there for a few minutes. I had to ask him to give me my food.

Tried this place out yesterday after walking by the store several times after my meetings.  Just for curiosity, I ordered the OMG burger because of the egg, and a side of sweet potato tots.  I must say the OMG burger was actually delicious.  The egg gave it that new flavor.  I would definitely eat that again, and also curious to try their other burgers and sandwiches.

Tried this new spot when I was in town last week and LOVED it! I had the OMG burger and my coworker had the sausage. Best lunch we had in that area all week, hands down. We just wish there was one near our NY office!
Loved this place! The burgers are looong!
loved the fresh sausages, great burger

I work across the street from the Rincon Center and saw this new burger place.  I figured  I would give it a try and it turned out to be the best decision I made all day.  The burger was very tasty (think Super Duper) and who doesn't like tater tots.  I will definitely be going back.

Just tried it for my first time and let me say...I was very impressed.  I had the Cheeseburger with french fries and it was delicious.  I love the concept of the burger on a hot dog bun.  It was perfectly cooked, not greasy and super juicy! Oh and I  have to mention the relish really made this Burger memorable.  I prefer this place over Super Duper any day!  I would come back in a second.  Can't wait to recommend it to all my friends!

It's just OK, nothing special.  But that's par for the course in Rincon Center.   I will agree with Morris C. that it is less greasy than SuperDuper.  I was glad to see the 2 women behind the  from the previous burger place are still employed there.

Not impressed at all. I ordered the Longburger w cheese and it was so soggy and greesy. The meat had no taste and the bread wasn't crispy or at least heated up. I asked for no pickles or tomatoes and sure enough they put it on the burger. Super Duper burger is way better across the street and worth the extra wait. Never coming back here again. I don't think they will last very long the way they are going.

Literally the worst burger I've ever had. I mean I'm no expert cook but how do you mess up something so simple as burger and fries? No flavor whatsoever and greasy as all hell. McDonald's has better burgers and fries and I absolutely hate McDonald's..... But, that's just my opinion. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Stick to super duper
I love the combination of ingredients for the OMG burger, feels less oily than super duper burger and great price! I cant wait to come back!

Not a fan at all. Came in on a Saturday night to a closed dining room at 9 so we sat in the bar area. Service was slow and unenthusiastic. Waiter was very condescending about his knowledge of tequila. Ordered a margarita based on his recommendation and it tasted like water. The salsa trio appetizer had no variety on spice. The tortilla soup was so spicy that was all you could taste. Quesadilla was good but nothing special. Not ideal for vegetarians. Extremely overpriced and ostentatious. Will not be returning here again.

Really loved everything about this place, other than their sangria. A forgivable draw-back, as the other cocktails were quite well built. The Albondigas were a stand-out as were the elotes. We shared about 6 plates and everything was well balanced and seasoned. Service was attentive and the room was really spacious, airy and well designed.
I came here for game 5 of the 2014 world series and this place was PACKED!!! But even though they were full, they let us in to watch the game.  So that was awesome!!
Fish tacos and margarita were good. Would go back. :)
I can only speak to ordering to go here since it's a close by spot when I want to pick something up for lunch. I usually just walk in and there never is a wait nor is it ever crowded inside.
The best Carne Asada I have EVER had.....
Here's the deal with Tres: the food is ok, but the service (Lance in particular) is what made this place a great spot to watch the World Series.
Tres was on my list of restaurants in San francisco to visit, and i wasn't dissapointed.
Fabulous place to unwind with friends after 3 straight hours of volunteer Oktoberfest beer pouring. :-) I can't review the restaurant since we sat in the bar.
cocktails were good & strong. Food though was just okay, and overpriced.
Fun, good bar food, drinks and atmosphere !  Didn't have much, but the chorizo fondue was the highlight. Soooo good !!! Service was ok, good for groups.
Review for bar only.

Went here for a pregame lunch. Great location near AT&T Park. Started off with the ahi watermelon ceviche which came with some plantain chips. It was quite good and had to ask for some tortilla chips to finish it off. Next I had the adobo pork tacos. They were nothing special at all, lacked much flavor, and were pretty greasy. I was disappointed with them. Washed it all down with an Anchor Steam on tap. Might be worth another try.
Had chips and salsa with guacamole. Can't go wrong there, although their spicy was no different than their mild in heat albeit different flavors.

I really wanted to love this place, but I think it relies on its tequila menu to compensate for the awful food. The carnitas was dry, leathery and inedible. At least the wait person took it off of our bill. Guacamole was bland, chips tasted stale, and the salsas were nothing special. The veggie tacos were passable but could have been elevated by some mole sauce. The only decent thing we ate was the elote grilled corn, but even that could have been so much better with a dusting of smoked chile, and a lighter hand on the crema. Not going to go back. Too many other good & great places to eat in SF.
Food is good, I had the tlacoyos and that beef with bacon, but bartenders can be a little more attentive...

Giving a rating between 0 stars = our last visit, and 3.5 - 4 stars = our first visit.  We've met here for brunch before Giants games on a few occasions.  Until this last time, service, food, drinks, and ambiance have been good.  It's walking distance to AT&T park, they have a wide variety of tequila, it's a large open and bright dining area with natural wood and rock decor, and their entrees are inventive.  We enjoy the chips, guacamole, and the spiciest/smoky salsa of the three that come with the order.  The other salsas and many of their sauces are sweet (perhaps a feature of Jaliscan fare?)
We'll never go back again over priced for small meals. Charged for chips n salsa. But food had good flavor.

Muy delicioso. I went for the first time the other day and was extremely pleased. I love chilaquiles and these did not disappoint! It was a ridiculous amount but I couldn't stop eating them. The elote was great too. Can't wait to go back!
Nothing to exciting.  Happy hour menu is lousy. Bartender acts like you are disturbing him to order in an empty bar.. i probably wont return.
Food is good. Kind of like a texmex spot. Though, I had the ribeye and it was great!

This is a solid 2 star Mexican food establishment, although the margaritas are definitely 5 stars.  What's happened to the food?--it's had some serious changes in the last 18 months; used to be a decent value & good food.  I ordered the chile rellenos ($17), which came with nothing as a side--really!? (Not even a splatter of salad--how hard is that? No beans?).  The chips were thick, and bland.  The hot sauces could be more tasty and... well, hot. Watch out if you order the ceviche because I could not find one piece of fish in the batch I received, and had to call the manager over....  But, I come here before the Giants games for the margaritas--they're still the best.

Tres expensive tonight & service poor. Granted, after the food order was re-cooked & we complained, we received our $ back. After ordering at the counter before the pre-game rush, we waited for 25 minutes in the back dining room. This restaurant has been around long enough to accommodate an evening pre-game crowd so we were surprised when we ordered from the back rooms' limited menu that even tho we were the first to order, our food was brought out after several others received theirs. Other people even received their guacamole & chips while ours was brought after our entrees. My Mahi Mahi tacos were nearly raw and had to be sent to the kitchen. My companion's enchiladas were lukewarm but when asked about warming them, was told it would be an additional 15 minutes. The asparagus appetizer was served hot and was tasty. Our tab of $55.99 seemed pricey for fish tacos, enchiladas, guacamole, asparagus & ice tea (which I had to return because it was fruity). BTW, when the manager came to our table with our cash, she just put it on the table & turned on her heel - no apology, nothing.

Awesome authentic enchiladas! Queso fresco, yes please. We sat at the bar, and our bartender was friendly and attentive. Cool atmosphere with high tops or more formal tables for groups. Definitely seems like a place you would take relatives or in-laws for a classy-but-not-too-spendy dinner in SoMa.

This place has a stand inside of AT&T park! Some of the best nachos I've ever had.  Don't waste your time or money on those expensive stadium nachos.  Get you some real nachos for just $10. That's a good price and it's enough to share with 2 or 3 people too!

A friend and I went to Tres Tequila Bar and Lounge on a first date. We started with drinks and proceeded to have diner I ordered the Carne en su Jugo and my friend ordered Grilled Skirt Steak tacos. The food was great and the waitress was very attentive to our needs. I would go back again and would recommend this to anyone who wants Authentic Mexican food and great service.
Was here on a busy game night.  Ordered the costillas.  They were bland, bland, bland.  Will not order those again.  The guacamole was good.

Excellent Mexican restaurant!  Waiting for the ballgame and were told to try Tres while we waited. Excellent salsa and munchies at the bar. Only recommendation is that there should be blended margaritas!!  Otherwise...excellent.

I organized a bachelorette party here this past weekend. We did the $35 prix fixe menu and the margarita making class ($35/person). I figured if the food was just average that the fun of doing a margarita making class would cancel that out. Imagine my surprise when the food turned out to be fabulous along with everything else about this place.
It's not bad, it's not great, it's okay. There are much better tequila lounges/ mexican cuisine place in the bay are in general.
Wow. Location location location.  Extremely expensive.  Poor value.  Bad Mexican food.  Let me elaborate.

When your native Mexican friends say "this food is really good" at a Mexican joint,  you must take it seriously. I came here for a quick catch up with my two good Mexican friends and had such a nice evening at this hidden place. What we loved? Tequila, tequila, tequila, they have quiet a selection here. I had the pork tacos and they were really delicious, and the happy hour price was actually pretty good also.

I had my wedding reception here and I highly recommend this venue for small wedding parties (40 and below).  Everyone had a great time and we paid for a personal bartender, worth it.  Highly recommend for moderate sized events.
Been going to Tres for years now, and its been consistently good the entire time.

We arrived 10 minutes prior to closing as a party of 20 and we were treated like family. The manager Octavio was attentive, accommodating and very gracious. We shared multiple pictures of skinny margaritas, which were smooth and fresh tasting. The guacamole and  chips were plentiful and tasted as if they were freshly made. The shrimp appetizer was unique and plated beautifully. My steak was perfectly cooked and very flavorful. The atmosphere was fun and upbeat. I only wish I lived in San Francisco and had the ability to visit more often. Thanks so much Tres, you were fantastic.

Everything from the service to the food was great until the very end when the manager came over to the table seemingly to ask us how we were only to briskly tell us that he needed the table in ten minutes when I had just ordered another drink. We had got there around 5:15 and were being asked to leave at 6:45. Our server came over to assuage the situation by telling us that opentable had ruined their booking and that her manager was normally more personable. To win us back, they comped two drinks and the sever apologized for the managers attitude. Several tables around us had been told the same thing. It was surprising to find out that the manager who came over to kick us out was the general manager as I would not expect that kind of customer service from a GM. I thought it was sort of sad that he had to have one if his severs follow up for what happened and explain the situation. Probably will not come back because of my unwelcoming experience.

Came by for a quick drink before a recent Giant's game. Headed straight to the bar area and had a seat at one of the communal tables. The restaurant was bustling so I'm glad we were able to find a couple of seats.
Wow what can I say? It really wasn't what i expected. The food was amazing. The ceviche was to die for. The service was great! This is my go to place in sf from how on.
Attended a function in the private room. I passed on tequila, but the drinks were good, and the servers friendly. The pick up food for the function was decent, but not great.

This was my family's first time at Tres, and we are NEVER COMING BACK! We made reservations at 2:30pm on a Saturday game day (game was at 5:30). While we were promptly seated upon arrival, everything else was down hill from there!! We clearly did not have a waiter assigned to our table and had to flag a waiter down to take our drink orders over 30 minutes after being seated! It took 20 minutes for our drinks to arrive and after that no waiter came to our table to check on us or take our orders! We had to ask the waiter who was waiting on  the table next to us if he can send any available waiter our way to take our orders, upon learning that we have been waiting about an hour for someone to take our orders he quickly agreed to take care of us. After we placed our orders, the waiter comes back 15 minutes later to let us know that they have ran out of cheese and won't be able to serve quesadillas for those who ordered quesadillas. How does a Mexican restaurant run out of cheese???!! It's game day, shouldn't have they known it would be busy???? So, my family members who ordered quesadillas did not eat b/c there was nothing else on the  menu that would help them w/ gluten free diet. While the rest of us who were able to place our orders got our food w/in 10 min, the food was less than impressive!  I got the Al Pastor Puerco (marinated pork tacos), the meet was bland even though it was marinated, and I really didn't like the pineapple on the tacos, it just did not compliment the dish, though the waiter recommended the dish. Also, when they were taking our orders, my aunt was very, very clear about letting the waiter know that she is allergic to onions and that waiter assured her that he will bring her tacos out w/ plain tomatoes on a separate dish. When my aunt got her tacos, it looked like they finally got something right,  tomatoes or salsa were a separate dish w/ no onions.  But when she poured the tomatoes on her tacos she noticed bits and pieces of red onions w/ the tomatoes.  Good thing she didn't take a bite of the tacos before noticing the onions w/ the tomatoes.  Not only did they provide horrible service,  they are apparently trying to kill us too!! We sent the dish back n talked to the manager before leaving, he agreed to take care of us and comped the drinks on our bill which reduced it by about $80 (we didn't do much alcohol drinks that day), but when they brought out the bill, they charged us for the 3 quesadillas that we never got b/c they were out of cheese....remember?!! That just goes to show you that they lack attention towards their customers and their customers needs!!! After we pointed out the mistake on the bill they corrected it and apologized. At that point we have been at the restaurant for nearly 3 hours and just quickly paid n left as it was less than an hour to 1st pitch!  Oh did I mention that they forgot to place one of our orders and brought it out to my cousin as they were presenting us the bill! WTF??!! NEVER AGAIN!!!
This place is okay but Victor's, across the street on Townsend, has much better burritos. Go there instead.
Very good food--this place should be much more crowded during lunch, but it doesn't have the trendy atmosphere, music, TV's, ambiance, etc. that other popular places do.

Not that convinced on how Street Grill's act while serving the food. i smell the evilness and the rudeness on these people. Althought they are good at it but still its bad. Food was okay, would recommend it to my friends.

I've finally decided to pick up lunch from here since it is right across the street from work. It's definitely not a place to have any expectations from the ambiance or service--it's a dated diner that you just come in for the food and be on your way.
I went into 3rd Street Grill having read some pretty positive reviews on here. The food was good but the service was lackluster, which brought down it's rating.
Just consistently putting out delicious food. Some have stated that they are not fans of the "lady" but I honestly think she is awesome/interesting.
Got the office lunch from here once and it was delicious! Wonderful service too. The owner really takes pride in the food and the quality of ingredients.
The food and service is great.

My colleagues and I wanted to eat burger/sandwiches that won't break our wallet since we are still student interns and we found this one $ sign on yelp. The menu looked good and price was ok so we gave it a try.
Their burgers are better than Umami around the corner.  The service is excellent and I have never been remotely dissatisfied.

This place really grows on you - I didn't think much of it when I first walked by, but as I came here for lunch more and more, you realize the staff remembers their regulars and it wasn't long before I was asked if I wanted "the usual".
It's all about the food at 3rd Street Grill, a nondescript diamond in the SOMA rough. The staff grows on you after a few visits, and by now they know my name and order right when I walk in the door.

Noticed "the lady" almost as soon as I walked in. Was seated quickly and brought a menu. Lady was a little curt, and took a few minutes to get my order. However, she warmed up when she asked if I had been here before and I mentioned that I had just moved to the area.
Decent food.  Liked the Chicken Sandwich.  A little disappointed my lemonade was never refilled, especially for the price.  But overall a nice place to go to have a quick bite before the game.
Been here a few times and the food is fantastic!  The burgers are made fresh and huge, the quesadilla are made with tons of guacamole, salsa and on the side

Food, especially the burgers and burritos, are fresh and delicious. The chef is kind and cooks everything personally, the lady is eccentric but if you're a regular here, you might even grow to like her. 3rd Street is not hip, the place badly needs a renovation...but if you just want a nice satisfying lunch without waiting in line for the privilege of buying an overpriced grilled cheese sandwich and prefer a real burger in SOMA, come to 3rd Street.

Been here a few times now- Ive read the reviews and yes, the "lady" can be less than attentive and not always polite.....but the food is usually good!! The California crunch salad is my fav- Veggie burger always looks good too!!
My friends and I came here on our way to AT&T park for the baseball classic. There were only two other people in the restaurant, which was weird since it was so crowded in the area.

I'm not sure why this place isn't getting more business. There's plenty of room to sit down, a totally decent menu, and friendly service.  The sandwich I got was very good as were the fries. Stop in and give it a try. It didn't disappoint.

Stop by Third Street Grill in SOMA.  The place has food to go/stay and you can easily get in and out in under an hour midday.  The atmosphere is casual, like an old fashioned diner, with red leather booths.  We had the special Arugula Salad with tomatoes/parmesan/chicken today and it was delicious.  Everyone in the neighborhood comes back for more, whether it be the burger/fries, burritos, sandwiches or salads.  Don't be fooled by the plain entrance - try it.

The burgers and burritos are the BEST, as well as the quesadillas, which come with a pile of fresh guacamole and sour cream. The chips (for chip & salsa) are always hot, and the fries are just right. Weekly specials are good, especially the recent jalapeno pork (like green chile pork, but with jalapenos!) and the Sloppy Joes are always a winner. The homemade salsa is sometimes extremely hot, but always tasty. My officemates and I come here at least twice a week.

Stopped here before a Baseball game at AT&T park because it was dead and there were a few TVs in there. As we were turning to leave after seeing the short menu options, the woman who works there told us that the food was delicious and everyone finishes their plates so we decided to stay.
This place is pretty figgen rad. I recently stared going here after I realized I work a block away. Try the pork loin sando. killer.

I went here a lot, despite having read all the negative reviews about the infamous "Lady."  My main reason for always going back was their veggie burger - man, it's awesome.  Like another reviewer said, it's made in-house, full of lots of veggies, and tastes so much better than the store-bought patties that other local establishments serve.  Personally, I never had a problem with the Lady's service;  in fact, she was always pretty normal and the cook was always so friendly whenever I came thru the doors.
Best burger on the west coast.  That's what I always order.  When I moved from the east coast I missed the burgers from my favorite diner.  I was very fortunate indeed when I discovered this place!
Strike One - The rude lady at the front desk waits to you order to let you know there is a 10 dollar minimum for credit cards.  Its always like 9.70 but there is nothing cheap on the menu.

I recently started working in the area and am scoping out my go to lunch spots. A good veggie burger is a must for my lunch repatroir. I've been on the lookout for one and I think I found it here at the third street grill. They make their own black bean patty chock full of different veggies that's way better than the premade garden burger style frozen patties you find at most places, like say the burger joint down the street. The cook was friendly, got started on my order before I actually placed it with the server... And the server, who I think was the owner, checked several times if everything was ok and even told me how they make the patties from scratch and how she hoped I liked it, it's vegan, etc., etc. She even mentioned something about how they need more lunch customers. They have booth seating available and the decor is nice enough, although a bit outdated. Cheese was an extra charge (I don't understand why veggie burgers usually don't come with cheese) and overall wish the prices were a bit lower, but seem par for the course for lunch spots in Soma. They take credit cards at a $10 minimum. I will be back.
Love this place the food is sooo good and healthier than most places in the city. Be sure to spot by sometime and try for yourself
blah... wrong review... flag for removal!

When we first walked in we were taken aback as the decor is not very attractive and really took us by surprise. We thought we might leave as it just looked hodge-podge and mis-matched. I had found the place on the internet looking for a place to eat before the Giants game on a Sunday afternoon and the prices were right and the menu sounded good. We decided to stay and we were so glad we did. The service was prompt and friendly (the place was empty,  though) and the food was GREAT! Yet another reminder to not judge a book by it's cover. $10 for a fresh chicken club sandwich and plenty of fries was a deal! Just 2 blocks from the ball park. We will definitely be back!
3rd gets a 5th.

The food is pretty good and comes quite fast. However, like others have mentioned, the lady that takes orders doesn't give off a very nice feeling. She hurriedly asked us what we wanted to order when we didn't have any menus and she seemed impatient when taking our order. Still, I'll giver her the benefit of the doubt. She seems to be nicer to regulars.

Wanted to try a new place in the hood, so I stopped in here on an exceptionally hot SF day recently.  I am not sure how the other two patrons were able to sit at the table and eat their food without sweating.

On the way to the Giants game, we passed by here and the $10 food menu and $4 beers caught my eye. We were hungry, we had some time and we were just a couple blocks away from the park. Given the choice of this place, McDonalds and ballpark food, the choice was pretty easy. The place was empty when we walked in, so we were seated immediately. The lady who waited on us was quick and really nice. I ordered the cowboy burger special (bacon cheeseburger with BBQ sauce) and upgraded to garlic fries. The food came quick, before I was even done with my first $4 Sam Adams. The burger was awesome, bbq sauce was nice and spicy, bacon was crispy and the patty was juicy. Fries had a really nice fry to garlic ratio and were not greasy like they can be sometimes at the ballpark.
Ok! I am here to quell the fiery confusion about The Lady That Works Here and decode her conduct for you, and tell you why this is a GREAT spot in SOMA despite it being less-than-gorgeous.
The atmosphere is dirty and service is pretty bad.  The burrito was very sloppy and tasted bland.  The old lady serving the food was pretty annoying as well.
A good lunch spot without the lines. You come in, find a spot and sit down. Momma comes and takes care of you. The daily specials are good too. I especially like the prawn super burrito.
I work across the street, so I wish I could eat here more often and still feel good about myself.  The food is good, the prices reasonable.
THE LADY
I agree with that Dennis S. guy. Actually I'm the buddy he was talking about.

The white chocolate macadamia nut cookie was as hard as a hockey puck! Gah. I was so disappointed! The moral of the story is, don't get cookies at 6pm from this location. There's not much selection and they may be hard! If the cookie looks burnt, it's probably hard.
I have tried their chicken soup for first time and i must say its YUMMY..

I had a caprese sandwich and a peanut butter chocolate chunk cookie for lunch. The cookie was delicious-- very buttery and not too sweet. The caprese was okay, I've had better. I would definitely come back for the cookies.
i use to love their cinnamon rolls.  thought i would treat myself with one of the fluffy frosted yumminess.  but instead was given an icing smothered hockey puck ...
I placed my order for pickup at 9:42 to be picked up at 11:30
Being from the east coast I was kinda shocked to find there were no Dunkin Donuts in California - now I know why - if there was a Specialty's Cafe chain in nyc I wouldn't go to Dunkin either.

If you want a sandwich with quality ingredient, this is it. I always get the sandwiches here. The salad is so and so, not worth it in my opinion. It's about $7-9 for a sandwich. The service was good and the sandwiches are made pretty fast.
This location gives the other stores a bad reputation. Cookies are stale, dry, and nasty. It's a waste of time going here... But, there's one by the Montgomery Bart Station that is awesome.
The best $4 cookie you can buy. $4 for a single cookie you say? Yes $4 for one cookie but it's huge and delicious.

Was walking by and happened to stroll in to Specialty's. I got the Turkey Pesto sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The best part was I got my meal for free for being patient:) I didn't get a dessert but definitely want to next time!
Just had lunch at Specialty's today and enjoyed it a lot. At first I thought that Specialty's was this prissy, upscale, overpriced bakery for the loooongest time, but they proved me wrong.

I've posted about this location before, but wanted to post again after I decided to try giving them another chance (as they're across the street from my office). Unfortunately, they're still incompetent!
Can't beat the prices, and the baked goods are ALL amazing. I've never had something I didn't like at this place.

This location quite small, compared to the other ones. There is no seating inside so it's really a get what you need and GTFO kind of place. Luckily for them, I don't mind too much because my work is right next door on Spear St. I've been here a handful of times and have eaten their catered foods. I've tried the array of breakfast and lunch sandwiches, some scones, and some cookies as well. Their breakfast sandwiches are on point with the fresh bread they use, and the melted cheese that stretches as you pull the sandwich away from your mouth. I've gotten both the Denver and the Southwester. Seriously, you can't go wrong. Cookies are also pretty good - the chocolate chip I had was melted and gooey even when the cookie isn't warm anymore.

Gotta love their cinnamon morning bun! So delicious. The counter people who work in the morning are pretty awesome. They aren't super friendly but they get the job done. I have to only give 3 stars because yesterday I ordered lunch for our IT group over the phone. When I arrived they told me they didn't have my order and was I sure I ordered from that location. I was a bit annoyed by them because they said that they only take online orders etc., etc.  So finally I told them it was put on the company credit card with another name on it. They were able to find my order. I would've been really upset if it wasn't there. So their sandwiches and cookies are pretty good. But the fact that they were trying to tell me that I didn't order from them kinda really annoyed me.
Comparing to other Specialty's before this, this one lacks umph in seating and tables as well as adding a Focaccia bread to my soup order!
Awesome drinks, and AMAZING pastries.

No long and wordy review needed here. This place has some of the best cookies around. The flavors are pretty basic, chocolate chip, peanut butter, etc. That is fine though because they are consistently delicious.
Love their cookies - especially hot out of the oven!

I've had the pleasure of sampling many things from Speciality's over the past year but have never thought about writing a review. Suffice to say, their baked goods are always a crowd pleaser but be warned they are on the more expensive end.

Specialty's is palatable for a chain -- the cookies rate 4 stars. However, this particular location is frustrating. Due to it's pop-up size, it seems it more so functions as an outpost. It's not clear that you can order sandwiches onsite, the employees are friendly (if not training and a bit spacey), but the main complaint is that they RUN OUT OF COOKIES in the afternoon EVERY DAY. I have been in there on several occasions where there only have 1 or 2 kinds remaining, usually less popular varieties. Not sure how this Yelp listing rides a 4 stars because I've definitely witnessed other people's disappointment for the same reason. Easy fix manager -- get it together!
Terrible muffins BUT the strong, delicious coffee drinks, smiling barista, and unbelievably perfect cookies more than make up for it.

yeah this is the place. Ask for Larry he will hook you up. Big coffee and ham and cheese croissant. The croissant is the size of frisbee, hot, fresh and delicious. You can have it in your hands in 3 minutes.

5 stars for the excellent comestibles, but 10 stars for the customer service. Slight glitch in an on-line order last week, but Nick and Jennison fixed it beyond my wildest expectations. The reason that when I think goodies, I think of Specialtys-Spear St. first. Thanks guys!
Great Food but MISTAKES!

My boss ordered in sandwiches for a big meeting, and while browsing online, I stopped on the only sandwich that had a first name: Rebecca. Not The Rebecca. Just Rebecca. I ordered it simply because I was intrigued as to why this sandwich had earned a name while all the other sandwiches suffered from boring titles like pastrami sandwich and turkey pesto.

Amazing cookies, pastries, and sandwiches! I wish they had more low(er) calorie options for cookies and pastries, but to be honest, I probably wouldn't get them because what they have is just plain AWESOME. Sandwiches are great too. :-)

Okay, if this is the Specialtys by the new HeyDay restaurant then listen up...my co-worker and I ordered a sandwich on line, it said it would be ready at12:38 so we went to look for it on the shelf and it was not there and we even walked slow to make sure s it would be there as we only have a half hr lunch.

Your typical cafe for working people. Relatively healthy choices, tasty salads, and a large offering of pastries. I'm a big fan of the berry salad especially since I love goat cheese. The food is definitely on the expensive side, and the portions aren't the biggest (but maybe that's a good thing so you don't go into food coma and take a nap at work).

Best chocolate chip cookies ever. Get the semi-sweet and know that the cookies are huge! Good spot for lunch as well - the sandwiches are all pretty good. They also cater so this is a good choice for corporate meetings/events in the financial district as they have several locations in the city.

This is a very convenient place to get your coffee/lunch and perhaps most importantly, cookie fixes. I'll admit - the service used to be faster, but the food quality is still there. Personally I find their sandwiches to be a bit on the heavy side, and their salads to be ill-prepared (not tossed). However, I give them major kudos for those irresistible sweets that keep me coming back for more day after day. Like most Yelpers who reviewed this place, I love the semi-sweet chocolate chip cookies, especially when they are straight out of the oven and are still gooey and warm. I give myself such a treat whenever I'm ready to give up on my day. Overall, I'd miss this place if it were gone, but I wish that the service is more expedient and efficient.
The food is good, but here are my qualms:
Unbelievable...
This goes for all of Specialty's locations, since their consistency in food prep and service are consistently top notch.

Such decadent brownies!! I'm not a big fan of cookies (lay down your pitchforks!!) as I always get such guilt eating a big stick of butter. A brownie is no different but the taste and texture of a brownie provide much more excitement for my taste buds.

I never encounter a line in the mornings when I need my Cap fix. I tried one of thir morning buns earlier this week and even though I've heard great things about this place, I was not impressed. I'll still come get my morning coffee here and there at Specialty's but I think that is all for now.

Soooo, I used to work in FiDi.  When getting fat off of Specialtys and then working it off at the 24-Hour Fitness was the thing to do.  When its glorious halves sat prettily on platters in the conference room for those all-important lunch meetings, waiting to be compiled into your own Specialtys sandwich marriage: Hot Hammer and Cobb?  Hellz yeah!  Tuna Salad and Mixed Veggie?  Meat-haters unite.
Just got a peanut butter chocolate chunk cookie, there was about 1 chocolate chip and the rest was dry and filled with peanut butter. I'd rate this cookie about 2 out of 10.
Fantastic cookies!  God, how I miss having ready access to those cookies. They were truly THE BOMB!
Specialty's is my Friday treat!

Sandwiches arent as cheap as they used to be. Especially quality ones. The porchetta, a Lurisia water, tax and tip can put you in the $20 zone real quick. However the pork, cracklins, veggies and bread are mighty tasty.  I didnt get to hang out as i had to make it to a meeting. Chomping on the sandwich as i walked down the street i probably looked like a dirty savage. However it didnt matter as it enjoyable even eating on the run. 4.25 stars
Been meaning to update my review for awhile now... I'll keep it simple. I said it before... food is great, Merigan only needed to sort out the biz logistics.

So pleased. Nothing grinds my gears more than a poorly made sandwich. This place exceeded my expectations in the quality of food, beverages, as well as the atmosphere. The Italian combo was so legit, I'll be back.

I was heading to the Giants playoffs game and since I ate unhealthy chicken tenders and garlic fries the last time I went to the game, I decided to get a healthy sandwich.  I suddenly saw the Merigan Sub Shop on my walk to the park so I took a turn in here to get something that won't take a couple of months off my lifespan.

To put it simply, it's all about the chicken parm. It's basically perfect. I didn't even bother with all of the other snooty sandwiches nor debate on whether broccoli rabe was an appropriate sandwich fixin'. It's a little spendy, but hey, this is SF. What isn't?

I think this sub shop needs a reality check. I came in before the ballgame with a strong craving for a tasty sub sandy. Took a look at the menu on the board and noticed one or two "veggie" options. Mayo fused egg salad doesn't really float my boat, so I asked the cashier if I could build my own sandy. "No" she replied as she shook her head. I gave her a look that would rival Larry David's, as I thought she was yanking my chain. I asked if she was serious to which she replied, "no, not joking. The chef doesn't allow it." The. Chef. Doesn't. Allow. It. I'm sorry am I at Gary Danko? No I'm at a fucking sandwich shop, where I just wanted a most basic sandwich, just sans meat or anything mayo based. I don't for see this place making it much longer especially with their elitist artisan chef crafted subs.
Amazing subs but they require respectful handling. Here is how:

I've walked by this place for several months after closing time and after peeking at the menu through the window in delighted anticipation, clearly my expectations were higher than they should have been.

Our first time (before a Giants game last Wednesday evening). Surprised the place wasn't packed. Only about 4 or 5 other tables used while we there. Had the meatball. Best meatballs ever in my diverse and expansive experience. Wife had the Porchetta, which she loved. We traded bites and agreed with each others' assessments. Really nice (short, but nice) beer and wine (on tap) list. Caesar salad (way big enough for two) was very good with unusual touches (bits of hard boiled egg and red onion) with very crispy romaine torn into bite-size pieces. Would have loved some anchovies. But, this execution was wonderful. Well thought out; fresh, quality ingredients; well executed. Sandwich rolls tasted/felt/smelled like just come from the oven. Every sandwich ingredient was distinctive and full of flavor. This place is a little gem; conceived and executed with an obvious love of great ingredients thoughtfully put together. Is it a little "pricey"? Only if you think of subs as those barely-edible things sold by the national chains. The size of the sandwiches and salads could justify their prices. But, ultimately, that's not really the point. The food is exceptionally good...truly great ingredients, prepared correctly, and put together so that every bite lets each ingredient shine on it's own while melding into the overall taste experience. Do not be fooled by the name. This is not just a "sub shop". Think: Gourmet sandwiches with prime, often unique, always fresh ingredients. Nice beer (tap & bottle) and wine selection. Offbeat, but tasty selection of "sides". Add, a dedicated and talented owner/chef and efficient/friendly service. What more could you want? It is a short, two-block walk from the San Francisco Giants ballpark.

Pricey, but a good pulled pork sando. Really unique tasting, unlike most pulled pork. Might ease off on the peppers next time. Also, I hate it when a sandwich is on paper and leaks, making the roll wet. Maybe put them on a riser or something. I'd go back.
I had the Porchetta Sandwiches'' to die for! Then to add to my zinging palate
My quest to complete my first 7x7 top 100 list brought me here. $13 sambo.. things we do b/c 7x7 says it'll change your life.
We stumbled in here to get a bite before a ballgame and found a hidden treasure!

Very good subs, I recommend the steak n cheese. However service is lacking. The blond girl managing the cash register has the same social skills as a cave man. She was not only rude when we asked for a receipt, but when I asked to use wifi she responded as if I just asked for free food. All things considered keep the subs ditch the chick.

My friend Michael and I stopped in for a quick break from furniture-shopping because Zagat had recommended their sub sandwiches. We ordered one traditional sub and the eggplant sandwich. The traditional sub was excellent, but the eggplant (with fresh basil) was to die for. The aroma filled your mouth at each bite. The crumbs were crispy and the eggplant perfectly cooked. We were still talking about it days later...how such a "simple" sandwich could be so memorable. Next time we'll order the eggplant again and try something new as well! Plus the staff members were friendly and helpful.

I just ordered the chicken parm hot sub. First it was $14 w tax and I nearly choked. Well, the sandwich must be awesome I thought. Boy, was I wrong.  Everything about it was soggy,  salty and wrong.   I just threw away over half of it because I couldn't eat anymore. I don't know if this price is a reflection of soma or what, but I will not be going back again.  Extremely disappointing.
Industrial theme

This place is awesome. Anyone who thinks these are typical subs have never tasted the porchetta, the arista, the cheesesteak. These are freaking works of art, some of the best food in San Francisco. Unbelievably high-quality ingredients, house-butchered, super friendly service. I'm pretty much addicted to Merigan's--unpretentious, amazing quality food that is hard to find in San Francisco. Perfect for eating before a ball game or taking with you. And don't miss the chocolate chip cookie. There's something magic in there.
7x7 100 Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2014

Yeah, very expensive. But my $13 Italian Combo was also very good, with very fresh, high-quality ingredients in the right combinations. It was also very large, accounting for some of the price. A similarly appointed "normal sized" sandwich would probably cost $10 at other shops, assuming all ingredients and quality stayed the same. Thus making $13 for a really big sandwich more palatable.
Price protection.
I'm consistently impressed by the quality of ingredients, service, and general concept of the restaurant.  (4.5 stars; -0.5 for price)

Really like this place -- I think it is the best local sandwich place in South Beach. Chicken Parm and Roast Beef were both delicious, and very generously portioned. While I am a fan of the Deli Board, I appreciate that Merigan's comparatively (a) has both cold and hot sub menus, and (b) is way more conveniently located. I like the space inside and the lady preparing the food was very friendly and down to earth. A bit on the pricey side ($12 - $14) but I'm sure the rent is not cheap -- given the portions and location, I'm willing to chip in what, in my mind, represents a small "convenience fee" to support a new local favorite.
Their prices are quite high, but I keep coming back.

Alright, I really don't do Yelp! reviews as often as I want to -- and this place warrants a review after trying it for the first time last night, so here goes! I was starving, wandered in 30 mins before close, and ordered the Meatball sub, while my friend got the Chicken Parm sub. My friend and I actually ate a 1/2 from each sandwich, so I got to try the Chicken Parm sandwich too; both are incredible. The bread, meat, and ingredients were all very fresh (I felt ashamed for ever eating at Subway kind of good). My friend and I ordered cookies to go as well, which were divine (chocolate with flakes of sea salt on top, YUM!). My only qualm with this place/reason I won't go back more often is price (it was $33 for 2 people, ouch). Worth it though!

I ended up eating here unexpectedly and was in for such a pleasant treat!  I got the Arista (I'm a sucker for anything braised and/or anything pork so it only made sense) and it was fantastic!  Better than Golden West even.  The rapini enhanced the sandwich as did the homemade mustard though the meat itself was of high quality so I'm sure the sandwich would have been great without them.

Merigan is phenomenal. I live in South Beach, and have been frustrated by the generally mediocre quality of food in the area as compared to other parts of the city. For that reason, I was thrilled to discover a high-end sandwich shop had opened only a block away from my apartment.

Seriously though, super hip, industrial decor can fool most into thinking this place has artisan level sandwiches, but take all that away, then place is just an overpriced sandwich shop that's freezing. Metal chairs don't help. Neither do the horrible attitudes of the workers. Never going back. +1 Star for lack of food poisoning.

I thought my sandwiches were AMAZING.  I'm a little surprised at the mixed reviews. Yes, there is a time and a place for killer $6 banh-mi, but there is also a place in my heart and stomach for a super high quality $16 chicken parm sub!!!

I'm excited to have found a new lunch spot in SoMa today.  I stumbled upon Merigan Sub shop and had the best eggplant parm sandwich.  Honestly, it was so delish and totally hit the spot. My friend had the Arista which I tried, and that was equally good with the perfect balance of spicy sweetness, the right amount of cheese and tender pulled pork. Totally going back!
I got their Italian cold combo, I liked it especially the shredded lettuce and hots. Unforunately at $13 this won't be an every day place.
Minus one star for giving me the runs.
I work around here and have been hearing of this really expensive sandwich lunch place for a while. Decided to gather a group of coworkers who appreciate good food and give it a whirl.
Not much to not like here.
Great place to get good sandwiches when going to see the Giants.  You can order in advance and pay on line and they're ready when you swing by, or just drop in.

Walked past this sub shop many times, since I work in the area. I'm really happy to have discovered a new lunch place - as there's not too much quality food around. There  lots of places that cater to the ballpark, but not exactly the type of atmosphere I want on my lunch break. My boyfriend and I are big lovers of eggplant parm, which is what we decided to split here and it was absolutely amazing. Not only that but the people who work there were really friendly! I can't wait to come back and try the Arista sandwich.

Overall this place has very good sandwiches. I have been there 3 times and have had the Turkey, Chicken Parm and Italian Combo. All in all the sandwiches are good and filling. I do enjoy the small piece of taffy they give you to finish off the sandwich with.

I get it SF charges you 10 cents for bags...and that's cool; but come on guys if I tell you I'm getting something for take out put the ticky tacky charge on my bill instead of asking for a dime after the fact. Your mismanagement shouldn't be passed on to me.
Great food and great service! The meatball sub is especially good.

I stopped by one evening (I appreciate that they're not ONLY open for lunch!) and found the service and wait time to be very pleasant and reasonable, respectively. However, I was quite disappointed with the meatball sandwich. The sauce was great but the meatballs themselves were very bland and had little structure to them. I also found the basil to overwhelm the other flavors.

The food was delicious, seasonal, and incredibly fresh tasting. We had the table side guac, the veggie tacos with grilled asparagus, roasted butternut squash & Brussel sprouts and literally the best chile rellano I've ever had. Our counter server Alfredo was very helpful, attentive, and so friendly!

I wanted to revise my review that I made after my Valentine's Day experience. The owner of the restaurant sent me a message after I left the review apologizing and asked me to come back and give them another chance. Well, I took the restaurant up on the offer...about 9 months later :) The manager Nicholas was great! He constantly checked on us and made sure my girlfriend and I had an amazing experience. The food was delicious and the service was top notch. To top it off, they comped everything including our drinks. Wow, way to win back a customer! Highly recommended!

So far my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city!   Rosa has the best happy hour.  I can't get enough of the Flautas. I did notice the last time I was here I only got two Flautas instead of three like usual. The service can be slow if you sit in the bar but that's expected.  I would give it a 5 but they always play their music too loud and I am not a fan of the type of music they play. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for good quality and cheaper happy hour in the financial district!

Great ambiance and the menu has lots of interesting options.   My co-workers and I couldn't decide what to order.  We got the tableside guac which was $14!  Yummy, but probably not worth $14. I ordered the nachos whic were amazing.  Can't wait to go back at night and try the Sangria.
My review has a major caveat - I didn't pay for anything, nor look at the menu.

Yes, the guacamole lives up to everything you have heard! Made to order while you watch mesmerized by the mortar and pestle. If we go back, I will split the main course as it wasn't as memorable. I had the pork tacos which were on the crispy side and came with at least 6 shells and enough meat to feed two.

Initially our office group went there for lunch in July.  There were 5 of us.  Two of us ordered the Chili Releno and it just wasn't very good.  When I wrote a review about it on Open Table, Executive Chef David Suarez contacted me and invited us back with an offer of two free meals.  The 5 of us just went back and not only did we get two free meals, they made us all a complimentary appetizer, and brought us a complimentary desert.  The General Manager Elias Mandilaras, visited our table several times as did David Suarez to make sure that all was good with the food and service.  All of the food and service was beyond excellent.  I just think that they must have been having an off day or something back in July.  We were very impressed this time and will definitely be back.
The guacamole was absolutely amazing, but the small portion for 3 people was barely enough...expected more for the price. Oh and it wasn't made table side?
4 stars for drinks and service.

Ew. Everything we ordered was nasty. I'd rather eat at Chevys. The $14 guacamole was horrible. Fish tacos- horrible. Chicken enchiladas- horrible. Nick was best thing about the restaurant. Oh- and the margaritas- those were decent. Never again!

We frequent Rosa for many business lunches, but will have to set aside this venue for some time.  During a recent appearance my colleagues and I were ignored by a server who failed to make any of us feel welcome.  Because of this, we decided that drinks were the extent of our visit.  Upon our deparure, my colleague noticed that his sunglasses were missing as we exited the restaurant.  Within a couple minutes we were back at our table and requested that his sunglasses be returned.  The table was completely cleared, none of the servers responded, but thankfully the manager told us he would look into this issue and follow up the next day.  I do not want to make any false accusations, and am hoping that the sunglasses were simply misplaced.

This is a decent, if pricey, place for upscale Mexican food.  Started with the tableside guacamole.  The tableside preparation is a nice touch, though the taste of the guac itself is decent but nothing special.  I then had the tres enchiladas.  They were tasty but a bit bland, though I admit it may be my fault as I asked them to not add any additional peppers to the dish.
The guacamole is probably the only 4 star aspect of this fancy mexican restaurant.  I loved that they made it in front of you and you could adjust the spiciness as needed, also, DELICIOUS!
Was here yesterday and enjoyed the attentive service we received.  We first ordered the chips, salsa and guacamole along with cheese and chicken
I have been a Rosa customer for about 2 years now, and in the past 6 months the service has significantly changed.

We went for happy hour and had a good time.  We initially sat outside and had chips and guacamole and drinks.  Everything was great, but it got cold and we moved inside.  They had no problem with moving us in and where very kind and accommodating.  I had absolutely no idea how massive the inside is.  It's HUGE!  I also like the interior design - it feels fresh and modern.  I didn't get a chance to sample a lot of food, so this review is really for the drinks, service, ambiance, and general experience.  The staff were attentive and friendly and everything was great.  I can't wait to go back and try everything!

Really wanted to try the upscale Mexican restaurant but very disappointing between the service and quality of food. Drinks didn't make up for it either ,,,, they are well at Rosa Mexicano in San Francisco but nobody seems to care much about customer service. I felt pressured to place my order and leave pretty much from the moment I was seated. The tacos were cold, the waiter forgot our second entree and it's almost impossible to get the staff's attention for water, salt, etc.

I went there for a podcast on Monday night, and as someone who grew up in Southern California as has lived in the Bay Area since June of 2001, I know Mexican Food. The guacamole was amazing, and I had the Tres Enchiladas and they were delicable. Finally, we went to dessert and I am huge fan of Ice Cream. I had the Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream and it was amazing. Very close to the Embaracdero BART and Muni Station. I will definitely be going there again.
If you like slow, inattentive service this is just the place for you! Then again, if 80% of your dining room tables are empty you let staff off and hope the "B" team can cover (note to GM: it can't)

Great guacamole, nice set-up with area for lounge and drinks separate from dining area. Friendly and attentive service. Good, not great, food, with average portion size. Expensive, but if on the company dime, then a great choice for a casual-leaning business lunch.

I come here every six months or so to remind myself that I don't like it. As a happy hour spot, it's workable when not filled with the badged conference-goers who so often get shunted into this corner of SOMA. I've had pleasant evenings on the patio with chips, guacamole, and margaritas.
High priced, average Mexican food. You can honestly get better Mexican food for a waaaaay cheaper price. Chicken Quesadilla for $14 is really pricey.
Meh.

The pomegranite margs are good, but real killers; crab enchiladas excellent and any of the ice creams for dessert!!! (Except the avocado!!!)  Overall, the meals were great, service great, ambiance nice.  I kind of expected more though...four stars is the best I can give it!
Amazing Guacamole

Lunch was decent, but expensive.  15 base price for fish tacos (3 of them).  The tacos were tasty, nicely fried and breaded, but it's just too pricy.  They also have a happy hour, which seems a little more reasonable, so I might check that out.
Rosa Mexicano is a hidden gem in SOMA area of SF. It's a cool vibe, great drinks, and solid food. I've always enjoyed eating there with friends.

I love this place!! Their table side guacamole, nachos and baja tacos are AMAZING. great service too. Its a really good place for a business lunch or dinner, but don't forget to make a reservation as they get packed.

I came here for a friends' birthday, so I was paying.  We sat at the bar for about an hour and had happy hour margs, chips and guac, and taquitos.  The drinks and food were really good.  As others have noted, the guac was delicious. It was a loud crowd at the bar, but that lent to the atmosphere.  The bartender was nice, but not overly so.  When we finally got to our table, we weren't that hungry anymore, so I got a quesadilla, which had too much sauce on it for my taste.   I would definitely come back for happy hour at the bar, as the margs and food were much more affordable and definitely worth the price.

I always love me some good mexican food and was excited to try out this place since there aren't too many upscale mexican dining places in the city. Checked in to this place twice with a bunch of friends and both the times, we didn't really leave happy.   While the ambience, service, location and the vibe of this place is just super, the food was a bit downer for us. With the ambience that good, I feel this place is just a perfect spot for the happy hour!

I went to this restaurant for a company lunch and it was a great place to go with your coworkers. Really good drinks, and even better food. The staff was oddly pushy and really wanted us to order more and more, even though we had already ordered appetizers, drinks, and main courses, but with that said, it was still a solid place to go for a company lunch. Would definitely recommend the tres enchiladas, as well as the lemon margaritas!

Wow, if you've ever been to Rick Bayless' Frontera Grill in Chicago, this place...doesn't even come close. I had really high hopes going in because my coworker said it was great and was charmed by its nice decor, but I left somewhat disappointed.

Best service ive had in  san francisco! Food was delicious and the service does not compare to any other place! They treat the customers as family and cater to your every need. The food is to die for. I would eat here every day lf the week

Absolutely phenomenal!  I've been here about 5 times already and have never been disappointed. The manager, Roger, goes above and beyond to cater to everyone's preferred tastes! Some of my favorite dishes are the short rib enchiladas,  the ceviche,  and the guacamole they make right in front of you. Great for both large groups and couples dates. We'll be going again very soon!

I'm addicted to the guacamole.  Best I've ever had. I dream about it.  But it's damn expensive.  Poor me has to settle for Costco guacamole.  Their lunch special is around $14 and comes with soup, 1 taco, 1 dessert, and a tiny portion of guacamole.  Good variety for a lunch special.  Their drinks are pretty decent too.  But other than that, food-wise, you don't get much for what you're paying.
One of my favorite mexican restaurants. Love the freshly made guacamole. The pan roasted cod was very good. Flavor wasn't too strong and was well balanced.
Regular @RosaNYC. was worried based on the reviews, but have to say our experience here was great. Definitely on par with our great experiences in NYC.
$26 tacos.
I paid $14 after tip for a margarita.
As I see the cook destroy 3 crepes and discard them, i looked down at my own under-cooked crepe and realized it wasn't going to be what I had hoped for.

Decent spot, but takes forever to get my order. I usually have the D3 which is the chicken, cheese, sesame seeds, avocado crepe. It is filling and the crepe is cooked with wheat flour which makes it healthier. The cashier is always friendly - which is good, but all the food court choices are just ok to me at Rincon.

Today was horrible!! The crepe was dry, tasteless and had a gritty constancy to it! The fries were drenched in oil and looked like they were pan fried after being deep fried. There was the special fot like 10 bucks.. A savory crepe, a side and a drink.. The best thing I had today was the coke. It's funny to cuz I started to eat it right outside at the  one of the tables.. The chick inside saw how disgusted I was and just shrugged. Went to Yang Sing afterwards to fill my belly up with sesame balls instead. Was so tempted to go back in and let them know that the food was disgusting but there was a line growing and didn't want to start shit!  Total waste of money!!
Great lunch spot. Had the duck salad and it was very delicious. They run great deals if you're willing to eat lunch before the usual lunch rush.

So-so. I used the GoDish app to get my ahi tuna salad for a discounted price however the salad was only sub par! Disappointed because I got such a great deal but there were so many things I didn't like about my entree. The seared ahi tuna had absolutely no flavor whatsoever, there were no cheese options (which I put in every salad), and the dressing was super bland (sun dried tomato vinaigrette). I won't be coming back unfortunately, I'd rather pay full price for a quality salad somewhere else.
I always get the D4, which is a steak, bell pepper, arugula, and chipotle sauce crepe. It has never disappointed.
4.5 stars

Been here a few times now... I'm pretty excited about this place.  There's a wide variety of interesting things to try, and while nothing's blown me away yet, it's all been decent.  They let me substitute brie for the cheese on the beef baguette and that was yummy.
Nice little place located in the back area of Rincon, has sandwiches, pre-made salads and make your own salads. Saw a couple items on the breakfast menu that were interesting as well!
Wooow, the food is amazing here people. Service is really good, i am totally satisfied and i will come back for sure. Recommend to all the hungry people haha

I saw a lot of people here so I got in line and ordered the veggie burger. The friendly order taker-cashier said it would take 5 minutes. After waiting about 10-12 minutes, I took my box and being ravenous, proceeded to take a big bite. It was tasteless, really without flavor. The burger texture was mushy, the bun uninteresting. I was very disappointed. The only reason I give any stars is because staff were friendly; too bad the food wasn't good enough for me to go back

Tried a table for first time today. Ordered a grilled chicken breast sandwich and fries. The chicken breast was on a long baguette and as soon as I pulled it out of the sandwich sleeve, the two pieces of bread came out and the contents slid right out and stayed in the sleeve. I ate the chicken separately.
The team at A Table did a great job of getting themselves noticed inside Rincon Center. The white walls with the bright lights will definitely catch anyone's eyes.
Center of attention.

Thanks to the app Go Dish, I scored the ahi tuna salad which comes with french baguette bread and a macaron for a measly $5!  The place gets crowded quickly due to their small space.
