The drill is to order your food from the guy at the register and then proceed to the salad counter to choose six ingredients as well as your choice of salad dressing.  Sandwiches are premade and you can pick that up right away. I really enjoyed my ahi tuna salad and especially the chili balsamic vinaigrette dressing.  A Table will definitely be my new favorite place to grab a quick lunch!

This place just opened 3 weeks ago. I was very impressed with the selection of food and loved my ahi tuna salad. It was larger then I expected and all the ingredients were very fresh. I'll definitely come back! Macaroons were great too!

After working in the area for many years it is always great to see something new open up at Rincon Center.  When the focaccia-driven Italian-ish place closed I wondered what would replace it and for a long time the answer was nothing.

New eatery in Rincon Center!  A Table replaces a froyo place, and indeed it was a great change.  I love the mod, bright look of the cafe.  A Table serves up savory and sweet crepes, grilled sandwiches, baguette sandwiches, salads and some special plates.  If you're in a rush, they have salads and some sandwiches in the fridge ready to be rung up and taken away.  They also serve pastries too.  I ordered a chicken crepe ($7.95) with avocado, caramelized onions, and substituted the swiss cheese for jack.  After I got rung up on the iPad like device, they asked if I wanted a free pastry.  Of course the answer was yes and I chose the mini almond croissant.
Well I randomly came upon this little cafe through Yelp. Driving through the city, I was craving a great sandwich, and boy did this place follow through!

I love this place. Until recently, I went three times a week for lunch. Let me be very clear: despite the five star review, this place is just a deli. However the meats and veggies are extremely fresh and just somehow taste better than a normal sandwich. I specifically love the Teriyaki Chicken, the TBA (Turkey Bacon Avocado), and the chili (best I've ever had).

Um, word of wisdom to the owner that responded. How about next time that a customer complains, you try saying something along the lines of "I'm sorry that I offended you. I would be more than happy to have you back at my cafe. We unfortunately don't allow dogs, I hope you understand, but we would be happy to have you back for a cup of coffee on us as a thank you and apology for your poor experience."
A bit of a hole in the wall, but they make good breakfast sandwiches. It is more of an office cafe than a place I would make a point of going out of my way to.

While the cafe is fine--nothing special but fine--the guy made me feel terrible for making a purchase for under 8 dollars with my debit card. He was like "I hate doing this, but I guess I have no choice" in the grumpiest voice ever. I paid the 35 cent charge for under $8 purchases--if it is so terrible for them, they just shouldn't except cards for under 8 instead of accept them and be butt hurt about it. Do not come here if you want your snack buying experience to be cheerful.
Nice people, good food. I tried the tuna melt, and it's DELICIOUS. Only thing annoying is the minimum payment for credit card is $8 and most sanwiches are $6.75.
No frills sandwich shop.  Cheap for the area, and a tiny bit stingy on the meat.  But the veggies and bread were fresh.

Can only speak to breakfast options here.  Great bagel combos.   Even though I only show up here once or twice a month now, the guy still remembers how I take my coffee.  Can't beat the prices, and if you want to be served by faux cheerful hipsters who think your yipping ankle biting purse dog is cute, and pay double for it, go to small foods around the corner.  I like these people and continue to stop in anytime I'm working nearby.   Good bottled drink selection and an ATM inside, and I've never had to stand in line in the morning.
Best breakfast sandwich ever.
The guy who owns this place seemed nice enough and the Dutch Crunch roll was good (although NOT crunchy on top or anywhere), but everything else was fail.

I like coming here not only for the food but for the friendliness of the dude that works there. He is very kind and makes me feel like I'm supporting the neighborhood place, which I'm in favor of. Very average place overall but a nice break from the crazy prices and lines elsewhere in the area.

Brannan Street Cafe is solid.  I duck in when I'm in a hurry and need a bite quickly.  By and large the sandwiches are no different than you'll find in most delis but I really appreciate the speed and price.  The owner is always courteous and friendly, even in the heat of a lunch-hour rush.  My current addiction: meatball sub on Dutch crunch.  Yum!
Meh.  $7 for a plain, no-frills grocery store sandwich and a Pepsi?  Plus a $0.35 'transaction fee' because my card purchase was under $8?  Bleh.

Let's be honest. With the other options in this neighborhood, you only eat here if you have to. Like when you haven't eaten breakfast in the AM because you were busy rushing out the door to catch the muni and suddenly it's 10:30 am and you realize you haven't done any work because your stomach is grumbling and you can't concentrate because you've been CRAVING some breakfast.
Delicious classic diner style sandwiches and the owner is super friendly.

I am surprising at all these negative reviews. If you give me a delicious $6 sandwich, I could care less what the place looks like. I only went in there because I was too lazy to walk any further but I was pleasantly surprised and will definitely be going back. They don't skimp on the toppings! Wish they were open later.
LOVE the Brannan Street Cafe!  Super close to my office and prices are great.  It's family run and the family is really nice.  Falafel and Gyro are by far my favorites.

I am writing this review based solely on one item... the roast turkey sandwich.  It is the only thing I have ever gotten here, but I have gotten it many times over quite a few years.  It is so good.  They are really generous with their meat.  I like that it is a family-run place.  I go maybe twice a month but they seem to remember me.  And they are super fast.  It is not a "sit down" place, but a great place to get a sandwich on the run.  I feel like I can't give five stars since I have only tried one item ever, but the sandwich is certainly five stars.
cheap and okay. egg on a muffin for less than $3. grumpy-friendly, non-nonsense kind of place.
Its super close to my school and its super fast and super cheap! YAY!!

Stingy and rather rude. I asked if there was wireless, and upon verifying that I would only be there a short while, I got the password scribbled on the back of a receipt. There was one other person in the cafe, and she looked like she worked there and was just on a break. Yeah, like they were expecting an influx of customers at 2:00 in the afternoon.
I will never go back here.  Went back out of desperation and the food was awful.

Lunch was almost as fantastic as breakfast. I was introduced to something I had never had before - a turkey reuben. Packed with smoked turkey breast and sauerkraut, this specially made sandwich was suggested by the friendly people working the counter to solve my dilemma of a veggie reuben or a turkey sandwich. I can't recommend this hybrid enough, and at $5.75, was definitely worth it.
I LOVE this place. They are so close to my office and are awesome!
a 3.5 star family run, hole in the wall sandwich joint off of 2nd and Brannan in the SoMA district.
Very good review for a very good place.  This is a family run place.  Mom, Dad, and daughter all working behind the counter.  That means they care about you and your food.  And it shows:

This is my favorite lunch place... this week.  They have good sandwiches, and hot dogs too.  Haven't tried their breakfast yet.  The sandwiches are comparable to Lee's, the closest one of which is about four blocks away (takes too long to walk).  Which is to say they're no frills, cheap, and good.  Just what you want.

I finally got a chance to try this place after passing by it all the time on my way home from work, but since it is only open on weekdays and until 4pm, it is hard to get to. I bought a delicious turkey avocado sandwich (50 cents extra for the avocado) and it only cost me $5.25! It was a decent size for lunch and the service was extremely fast. I would go there again and again....if only I could.

It's a cute family business. Their prices are great, service is as fast as it gets. It's just a small place to get a quick lunch, I don't understand why people have so high expectations. I work literally cross the street and it takes me 4 minutes to get my sandwich and be back, not only that they put so much stuff on your sandwich, its ridiculous. There were 3 younger girls working there (daughters I suppose) and they all do such great jobs except one of them, she's a bit slow and dad gets mad at her (not out loud, but you can see)
Sandwiches are pretty good for that price. it's much much better than Hennessy's sandwiches.

Upon entering the uninspired Brannan Street Cafe, you are greeted by a paper sign that reads RESTROOM FOR CUSTOMERS ONLY, which is placed beneath an entire dry erase board dedicated to the other rules and regulations of the establishment, such as "NO FREE REFILLS ON COFFEE" and "NO OUTSIDE FOOD OR BEVERAGE", scrawled angrily, however in a variety brightly-colored markers.
Their TBA (Turkey Bacon Avocado) on Dutch Crunch and chocolate chip cookies are off the hook. This no-frills cafe is great if you just want a basic sandwich away from the SOMA scene.
Sandwiches are ok, but the service is really, really bad.
The problems start with the uninspired sandwich options, and the baroque confusing menu that somehow does not contain things that you want to buy.

It's easy to miss Brannan Street Cafe because it's one of those nondescript breakfast/lunch places at the bottom of an office building that usually only the people who work in the building know about. Thankfully one of my co-workers noticed and introduced me to the TBC - Turkey, Bacon & Cheese (w/o sprouts) on sourdough.  It's rare that I swoon over a sandwich but the TBC is the best sandwich I've had in a long time... and you can order it with real roasted turkey meat (ask for it) as opposed to turkey deli meat... and it's only $6; no wonder I eat here at least once a week.

Good sandwiches at reasonable prices. They are also pretty quick so its nice if you are in a hurry. I tried "The President" which is pastrami, salami, ham with all the usual fixins (on a dutch crunch roll). Not too shabby at all...
This place is about as exciting as the name is creative!
Lacking in ambiance, but the food is good, I had a turkey bacon and cheese sandwich on a dutch crunch roll with an iced mocha for $7. There was no wait. I will return.

A no frills sandwich shop, this place delivers exactly what you'd hope to expect:  high quality sandwiches in a low key environment.  It'd be four stars if it was just a tad more tidy and there was some outdoor seating.
Quick, easy and filling. Good sandwiches, good food. I really can't complain.
Botton line: my bahn mi was VERY dry and lacked flavor.

We only made a stop here on our recent trip to SF was because of the coconut waffle sandwhich! It was a clever twist to the original banh mi, very new and different from the Vietnamese sandwhiches I've had in Virginia. I LOVE coconut so this to me was really perfect. The coconut waffle smelled amazing and had a nice crispy and sweet taste. It's definitely a MUST TRY!. The girl that was working there was really nice and friendly too.
I had both the spring rolls and the pork sandwich.

FiDi is as you would expect saturated with quick eats (e.g. sandwiches, salads) and expensive spots for the business lunches and dinners. It's hard to find good Vietnamese but now that I'm spending more time in the area I'm noticing there is a shocking amount of Vietnamese sandwich places.
The sandwich was Ok. Very basic. Not amazing, but I would go back if I really wanted banh mi, because it is one of the only places that serves them near my work.
Has all the necessities and reasonably priced for the area!!!

Sandwich is alright. The pickled carrots were a bit bland and seemed like they weren't pickled long enough. The jalapeno unfortunately had zero spiciness to it. Bread wasn't toasted enough--probably because of the line. Yeah, I could probably go on and on but overall my sandwich wasn't amazing in flavor but did fill me up.

Got the combination sandwich and added an egg for $1 more. Happily drinking my sweet Vietnamese iced coffee and opening the sandwich to pick out the jalapeno pepper that I forgot to ask them to leave out when I notice the egg is not a fried egg but just entirely egg whites!  T_T Why would you do this? I was so looking forward to a nice half runny egg (if done right) to ooze over the sandwich. So disappointed. Sandwich itself was OK. Would have been perfect with and egg that had a yolk.

I found this place walking to the Griffon hotel for my stay here in SF.  When I passed by there was a small line of several people.  That is a great sign.  Popular but not too popular.  I got a super combination sandwich and one of those green colored coconut waffles.  The sandwich was great with chinese style bbq port, tofu, jalapenos, pickled carrots, etc.  And only $5.75.  The green colored coconut waffle was good but very quickly lost any of its crispiness by the time I got to eat it.  Tasty though.  Not sure why it is green.
Decent Vietnam sandwiches fairly priced.
This place is  pretty damn good. I have tried the Chicken Sandwich as well as the Meatball sandwich. I like them both literally the same.
Short lunch break? Need to bust back to your desk and grind more spreadsheets than an intern? Broke?!

Green waffles were a novelty, but a little soggy for my tastes.  The roasted pork sandwich was also ok, but did not wow me.  Overall I thought that this was a good place to try if you like bahn mi, but I don't think I will be back until I've tried all of the other similar spots in the area.
Spring rolls are okay... the peanut sauce is a bit watered down.

Pretty good! I've had three vietnamese sandwiches in Fidi: Les Croissants, this place, and the cart stand on market and battery (i believe). this ranks in the middle of the three. Definitely better than Les Croissants, but didn't have the same authentic taste as the ones from the cart stand. it tasted a bit american? not that anything is wrong with that, i just dont like it in my vietnamese sandwiches :)
sooooo goood and affordable. get the waffle

My latest go-to place for a fresh, tasty, and inexpensive lunch.  I'm addicted to their chicken sandwich, and will often munch the green coconut waffle as my salad-equivalent first course.  (It would be a shame to have a cold and soggy green coconut waffle for dessert.)

I was working nearby for a while and was trying all the places that had banh mi in the area. I hit the jackpot with this one. Well toasted bread, enough jalapenos to get that burning sensation in your mouth and good flavor. I noticed that the sandwich wasn't as good as the first time, if they were super busy and were trying to make them quickly (i.e., the bread wasn't toasted enough). Sometimes I wish they'd add a little more sauce, but I liked them enough that I had one every week. Yum!

This is a good and good value Bahn Mi. Nice crispy roll, good meats and great condiments. I had the classic pork combination and it was fine... not much in the line of jalapenos though. It does deserve more than 3 stars but not quite up to 4 in my book. I'll have to keep sampling and it will be a pleasure.

I work across from the street from this place but I kid you not, I would not have noticed it if it weren't for a sneeze that threw me off balance right in front of the ordering window... (I did not sneeze in your food... promise)

Came here with the coworkers for lunch. I've always had the pork vietnamese sandwich which is only $4.75! Pretty good deal and not that expensive! The sandwich is a bit small; however, it fills me up! The sandwich includes pork, carrots, cucumbers, and jalapenos. The bread is a bit crispy/crunchy; however, after awhile it becomes hard. The flavor of the pork was not too bad. Service was pretty efficient and quick. It may not be the best vietnamese sandwiches, but it's doable.
90% of the time, my sandwich is made in less than a minute every time.
I was really jonesing to get a Pork Vietnamese sandwich. I live and work in SF so I don't always get to go to Cam Huong in Oakland(the best sandwiches ever, in my opinion).
Hole in the wall, but AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS SANDWHICHES!
Awesome place for a quick bite. I usually go for the pork sandwich (no jalapenos) plus a Teas Tea. Lots of meat and the right amount of tanginess.
2 stars for the sandwiches but..
The sandwiches and the green waffles are great.  (Who would've thought green waffles could be so addicting..it's true what the other Yelpers are saying about this place).

I enjoyed the food. I enjoy Vietnamese food, but never tried it at a deli. I was not expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. I definitely will go back and look forward to trying the green waffle next time.

Disclaimer: Having eaten enough vietnamese sandwiches in my life to fill up The Transamerica building leaves me a bit more critical than your average reviewer.  let's put it this way. You may have grown up on PB&J or ham & cheese. I grew up on vietnamese style sandwiches so even though this place is cheap (under $5) I can't excuse what they pass for a Banh Mi. First time here so I get the super combo with viet iced coffee and the coconut waffle.
And now for a dramatic reading of Dr. Seuss's "Green Eggs and Ham", we have the erudite Ed U...
Had their class combo.

Little Saigon Deli is a great place to get your lunch on. I had the chicken sandwich for less than $5.00. It's marinated chicken on a roll with sliced carrots and jalapenos. What's also great, is the Embarcadero is 1 block away where you can go post up and enjoy.
green waffle is ok, made to order, and comes hot off the grill (if you don't mind the wait) ... ask for it to be crunchy or it'll be soggy
Avoid at all costs especially when the delicious Les Croissants is only a few blocks away.

I always order the number 6- shredded tofu with veggies hold the mayo. I've only had Vietnamese sandwiches from a couple of places and they pale in comparison to what they serve here! The tofu is flavorful, the veggies are always fresh and the bread always seems freshly baked even when most of the time I don't make it in until 2 pm. Also, the ladies who work there are friendly, the sandwiches are made quickly and are under $5.00! The only times I was disappointed were when they were out of tofu for the day. I highly recommend this place!!!
Well many things about this place would have given me cause to give it 4 stars or more...
About the baguette, I'm going to have to agree with David D.

These Vietnamese sandwiches are awesome!  Bread is fresh and crunchy when you bite into it.  Reasonable price.  It's a tiny little spot next to ONE Market, but they have everything you need!  SO DELISH!

This was the first banh mi that I didn't like.  Overall, the sandwich was smaller than I'm used to getting at New York joints.  The bread was a little chewy, the meat lacked flavor, the vegetables didn't have a bright, fresh flavor, and even though I asked for "spicy," there was no spicy sauce on it, only a few peppers.  The green waffle had a good flavor, but was a little soggy - should have been cooked another minute or two.  I do have to say, the vietnamese iced coffee was good and strong, with a rich flavor.  It seems like there are better places to get this kind of sandwich in SF.
Got a breakfast sandwich (egg & sausage with cheese in a bagel) from here on a weekday afternoon (because breakfast foodies are my fave). I'd get one again.

It's like clockwork, we're always trying to find a place to eat for lunch. I work on Howard and Spear and never seem to be satisfied with what's offered in the area. I've always passed this joint but never really stopped in, as I've always thought it was a sandwich joint. My coworker mentioned there were some Asian options and I was definitely curious to see what kind of options were available.

This is a five minute walk from my work place and I enjoy going there for lunch especially when I am craving for some dim sum! The price is a ok but the food taste really yummy! It's a food bar and you get to pick what you want, my takeout usually comes out to be around $7-9. No parking for sure...
Very good here and they open early. The staffs are very friendly. The health score is why one star is missing.

Food is decent tasting. Like all Chinese food, quite greasy. It's a food bar so you pick what you want to eat or you may order as well. The thing I don't like is its 5.95 per lb and most of the food have greasy thick sauces.

I just found a piece of metal wire in my food during breakfast (eggs),  had I not found it in time it is likely I would have eaten it and been forced to go to the hospital. Eating here is taking a big risk as the food prep and handling is not done with much care. When I returned the food I was given a refund but not much concern was expressed about the rest of the eggs that were still out.
Love this place! They sell cronuts :)
Very convenient deli serving pay by the pound Chinese dish and salad. Collection of sodas are good too. The eat-in space is wide and clean. Wanna go again soon.
I know this place is economical, but their turkey sandwiches are just....gross

Fairly good Asian food, with a surprisingly large selection. Considering where it's located, I would've expected a more "food-court" selection, but was wrong. It's also very convenient, which is the other big thing it has going for it. It's only a couple blocks from the muni, and right in the middle of the financial district!
This place has a big variety, and i like that they sell cronuts, thats pretty cool.  It's hard to come out of here with less than a pound of food however.
Convenient spot, as always, coming from Lee's.

I would go here for drinks and in desperation only.  Don't get me wrong, I have been to plenty of Lee's lunches when I first started working in the Financial District as a recent college grad.  The cheap sandwiches were a must and fit my budget.  These days I am doing a bit better so I normally skip this place, although I do like that they have added quite a bit of hot cooked food.
They have croNOTs here. Not to be confused with the trademarked Cronuts of NYC. They are filled with custard and will run you $2.50.

I didn't actually eat at this location.  I only came here to buy cronuts as they're sold here.  I came in early in the morning so the place seemed clean.  The lady behind the cash register was friendly.  I like that there's a seating area and huge salad bar.  They also have a counter for sandwiches and noodle soup!

Lee's has many locations.  My previous quick dependable spot on Fremont has been demolished and now I've found the "super" Lee's at 170 Spear Street (with seating!).  Huge salad bar, soup bar, and (of course) sandwiches.  I stick with the sandwiches which have consistently generous portions.  Hardworking staff, good quality food, prepared quickly. They know their customers are in a rush at lunchtime and make sure the lines move quickly.

One of the crazy efficient (one might even say machine-like) women behind the counter who bags, takes my credit card, and sends me on my way in 3.5 seconds stopped to give a little boy a free cookie today.
Lee's Deli is great and this location is among the better ones.

I was really disappointed in the price and quality of food. I was really excited to try their asian cuisine which has a lot of variety. I filled my carton about half full, everything is weighed to determine the price so I figured I wouldn't have to pay too much. But when I went to pay, my meal was $11. I was shocked. For that price I could get twice as much food from pretty much any other chinese restaurant in the city. The quality of the food was also dismal. I mean, you can't really have high expectations for food thats been sitting around all day, but what I had was really gross. For the same price I could have gone down the street to loving hut, and actually felt full and satiated. After sitting down, I heard this other guy go up to pay and he actually had the courage to say something to the cashier about how ridiculously expensive his meal was.
This place is far overdue for an updated review. The last couple of times I have eaten at Lee's, I have been very unhappy for a couple key reasons.
Noodle Soup Bar!  EEEEEEE!
I got food poisoning. Bad. I'm not totally sure why but it might be related to leaving greens and food (including seafood and meat) out at room temperature all day. Damn.

for food quality, i'd give lee's 3 stars, but for value i have to bump it down to two.  i got the hot food bar for lunch and it was so expensive!  for decent food, it should not cost this much.  ridiculous.

You're an aspiring screenwriter except you lack talent, vision and originality. You're in a bit of a rut ever since your last screenplay, "Grapes of Math," a harrowing tale set during the Great Depression which focuses on the Escalantes, a poor family of math teachers driven from their Los Angeles home by drought, economic hardship, and changes in financial and mathematical equations who help Okies learn how to pass Advanced Placement classes in Calculus, was soundly rejected by your script agent.
This is the best Lee's Deli in the Fidi, I've been told.

I had $1.32 worth of food...small salad. They tried to charge me 2.00 and glossed over the fact my food was much less. I called them out on it, and said 2.00 is their minimum.  Good variety of food, but I don't like being over-charged and them not being honest about it. I wont be back.
I got the chow mien and shrimp dumplings amongst some other sides and now an hour later I feel like my body wants this food out of my body asap and I can't focus on anything else except for the pain.

Their sandwiches are ok but their buffet food is so packed with MSG I lost feeling in my left leg. The idea of Lee's Deli is fabulous, all you can eat anything, but in this case I'd choose quality over quantity. You want to meet your grandkids? Don't eat at Lee's.

I'm a sucker for this place... value, value, value. That's the thrifty Chinese side of me when I want to eat here. They offer a wide variety of hot food and salad setup buffet style. They charge by weight so avoid getting a ton of rice and noodles. Everything is generally fresh when I'm there either around 9AM or 11:30AM. After 2PM, you get leftovers.

I came here for lunch about a month ago and I kick myself for not going back already! This place has a variety of entrees and a stocked deli! I had brown fried rice, salt and pepper fish (surprisingly not sold in a lot of Asian food places) and a few dumplings. Since they charge per pound, you might want to take a lap before loading your to-go box! You might end up with more then you can actually eat in a sitting. The pricing is decent though, I believe I paid around $8 for my food. I honestly didn't get that much but next time I'll have to remember what my lunch weighs and the price point.
There a lot of horrible places to get "food" like products in the city, this just happens to be a really dirty one.
I go here often for lunch. It is right by my office. They are very affordable and the service is lovely. They ladies there know my order and always are generous with the sandwich toppings.
**BACON, BACON, BACON, BACON, BACON, BACON**

I've been hittin this joint for YEARS, food quality is always above level,I work across the street so  the workers in the morning know my schedule, and they know exactly what and how I like it- & I love the customer service- Nice and FAST- and honestly.. I never get sick of it cuz they have just soo much to choose from-This is also the PERFECT SPOT to take friends to grab a bite-at least everyone can choose whatever there hearts desire here- Its like a mini food court but all in ONE-This place is a ONE STOP SHOP for breakfast. or Lunch- energy drinks, candy bars, , brownies, cookies,  MONSTEROUS HOT PASTRAMI  sandwiches, Won-ton soup, Salad Bar, Sushi, Burgers, dim sum.. I could go On and On and On.. The best part.. you can mix you're own stuff up- My regular morning breakfast? sliced pita, with hummus, tuna, sprinkled parmasean cheese and a slice of bacon, with a couple of strawberries, pineapples ... YUM.. so ya if you're twisted like me and like mixing it up a bit, or even if you're into the Normal stuff- this is the place to get it-

Lee's was a pit stop while I was waiting for a bus. I paid by the ounce for the buffet, which was massively salty. The picture that I uploaded cost me $11. That little plate cost eleven bucks? Seems like a rip off, even for the city. I know that meals in the Financial District are expensive, but at least it could have been loaded with something else than MSG and sodium. I won't return when back in the Bay Area.

Lee's is a perfect spot for those who want basics for cheap. They've got a variety of breakfast and lunch sandwiches, a hot bar, a ramen bar, and yummy deserts such as rice krispie treats with m&ms on top, snickerdoodle cookies, and yummy brownies. For cheap! The staff is also very friendly and very fast.

Quite possibly the best dining option along the embarcadero financial district border. I always go for the fresh broccoli (best in the game), mushrooms, and teriyaki chicken. But there is something for everyone. Make sure to check out the new inside seating.

Good bye, Lee's, my most frequented near-work breakfast/lunch spot. I am moving and I shall miss you, so I figured I owed you a yelp-out. I shall miss your hot and cold salad bar. I will miss your eggs in the morning. I won't miss your giant selection of fried, unhealthy chinese food that I pretty much never ate, but I will miss your generous offerings of healthier fare. Your made-to-order sandwiches were also the bomb-dig. I will miss the excellent selection in your beverage fridge. Most of all, I will miss Sharon, the friendly, fleet-fingered cashier. Nobody can mow down a long line of customers like she can.
I stop by here 3x a week for lunch. It's a Chinese operated deli/ salad bar/ chinese restaurant, sandwich shop, and noodle soup place.
I'm surrounded by Lee's Delis at work, so it's inevitable that I'd eventually get something to eat from one of them. I've only had the wonton soup, so my review is based on that only.
I'm a fan of this place for a few basic reasons:

This place is next to my apartment. One day we were in rush and so ordered from this place without checking reviews. We ordered Mongolian beef and orange chicken to go. The taste was OK, but the quality of the beef was so bad we ended up trashing the whole Mongolian beef. The orange chicken was no better, it had so much bread crust and sweet syrup around the chicken pieces that it tasted more like a bad pastry rather than food.

This place is pretty unspectacular. The taste of the food more-or-less matches the somewhat depressing and sterile atmosphere of the restaurant. Specifically, the sesame chicken and shrimp dumplings were okay. The steamed pork buns and Shanghai dumplings were below average. And the lemon chicken was soggy and not good. And to top it off, it isn't that cheap.
Nice cozy spot for great chinese good! Their bbq ribs are super bomb
Came here for a late night dinner outing with friends. First thing I got to say for the BBQ Spear Ribs I ordered "OMFG" it falls off the bone! So soft and tender! I never had ribs like this before.
At first, convenience took precedence over tastebuds. Newbies in the city, moving day chaos... eventually, hunger took over...

This place is convenient to our new place so we've been here a couple of times now.  I know some people have had an issue with the 10 cent bag fee, we always just tell whoever is working that we don't need the bag because we have our own. The portions are a little less than we are used to but the Mongolian Chicken and Chicken Chow Mein are really good.  The staff has always been cordial to us when we've been there, I won't say friendly because they are focused on the work more than going out of their way to chitchat, which is fine with me.  I will say that they prop the door open sometimes because there's no A/C and that does let flies in, maybe they should try an air curtain?

The waiter and owner kept pouring water into my glass full of 7up.  I kept telling them it was 7up, but always too late.  Then the owner said she would give me another can of 7up, but she never did.  Also, the food took a long time to cook.  Food was about a 6.5 out of 10

I forgot how this place was when I went back recently.  The portions are good but it's kind of expensive.  Dinner combo will set you back $15 for Chinese take out.  The wonton soup was not good.  The sweet and sour pork had too much fat and breading and felt gross to eat.  The small veggie egg roll was all bread.

Decent portioned, inexpensive Chinese restaurant that leaves little to imagine. It's a good place to stop if you want to pick up a quick dinner after a long day. I've been there four times, and haven't been disappointed. That being said, the taste/quality can be described as 4/5 at best.
The only Chinese food restaurant nearby and it's good. All those dishes that are marked as spicy are actually not that spicy at all. Very mild cuisine.

Went here a few time & had take out because it's the only Chinese food in the area.  The soups are pretty good.  Ate at the place but it was kind of gross with flies & dead bugs around the windows & seating area.  Also was grossed out about using the restroom & there was no hand soap...absolutely dried up...so do the cooks not wash their hands?  Uck.  In all honestly, that was last year.  I do see now that the health score improved into the 80's.  We'll might give it another try just because of location but any restaurant that is empty in this area is never a good sign.

Horrible customer service for mediocre Chinese food. I have never felt discriminated on in my whole life. I'm Filipino and the owner was racist towards me. On numerous times, she has served whites and Chinese  first and had forgotten my order or that's I was in there. I only came back because I live a block away. The final straw was when I had asked for extra chili sauce and she charged me extra for it. That's is fine except when a white lady walked in and asked for 5 extra chili sauce but was never charged.  I brought it up and why I was charged and others are not. She just ignored me. Never coming back to this place again. It's not that good anyway. I'll just order from Eat24 or Grubhub fo4 my next Chinese craving.

I added a star because of convenience to my place but I had to take the 1 star out for still charging customers a 10c bag fee for her superflimsy non-compliant plastic bags that is thinner than a no-name brand 10yo condom.  The lady owner there is unfriendly and never smiles but I buy food  from her restaurant only because it's the only Chinese restaurant within walking distance to where I live and is on my way walking from the Caltrain station going home. She should always be happy to see me because I'm there to patronize her business.
We picked up from here.  The people were lovely and so nice but the food was really not very good.  It was like they were trying to Americanize it and missed the mark.
No credit card for charges below 15.

I'd give it no star or negative but yelp won't allow it. This place is not good in food and service. I've lived within a 3min walk for over 5 years and the only thing I get there is the wonton soup and shrimp dumpling.. And after many trials and errors! They now even messed the wonton soup up which smelled like cat pee recently /:  I did get the chicken spicy noodle soup which also changed recipe for the worse. I really hope another Chinese place opens nearby. The only reason this place is still open is because it's the only Chinese restaurant in the immediate area.
Lunch Plate-Tomato Beef over Rice

Stumbled in on a late lunch, no patrons? Hmmm I'm starved have 20 minutes to make a decision before the work day winds down, and I have to head back to the office cube.  The place is in a potentially good location so I just bit the bullet without fully yelping it.  Food was cheap but it doesn't mean it had to be so depressing.  Got the twice cooked pork, which probably got nuked in a microwave, so better change the name to triple cooked pork.  The woman working was nice, and then the staff emerged from the kitchen and sat down and ate lunch.  Who knows what their topic of conversation was about, probably wondering wtf I chose to eat there with all the other great affordable options on the waterfront.

They're back! We ordered some dishes delivered recently and the excessively greasy junky food feel had gone: we had clean, lightly seasoned dishes full of crisp fresh  vegetables that were a joy to eat and taste, without excessive use of soy sauce or oils. Good stuff for a quick nosh-up!

Food is somewhat authentically Cantonese (they spoke Cantonese to me).  First Chinese restaurant with food that is not at all greasy which deserves a star.  Pretty tasty Chinese food in an unlikely corner of SOMA, very unnoticeable unless you happen to wander in.  My order of garlic pork over brown rice was done in minutes, yum!  Other items coming out of the kitchen look good as well.  Will go back again if I'm in the area and feeling Chinese.
Decent neighborhood restaurant in an area that lacks a lot of night time dining establishments.
Decent doesn't make it yummy, not to be picky!
I tried the garlic chicken with asparagus lunch special on July 2nd and it was to die for.

So I only have two issues with this place. The bundles of human hair I found in at least two lunches I bought there. I did take out and thought the first one was just a fluke but then it happened again a week later. The food is not bad and the servings are huge but the fact that I found hair in their twice in two weeks tells me they are a little lackadaisical with their food preparation protocols. I won't be going here again. Sorry guys, I really wanted to go there since you are the only chinese restaurant in walking distance.
The food is pretty bad and no matter how much you order the lady will give you ONE soy sauce and if you ask for more you will either get ONE more or "too ma so sau bahd"

The best Chinese take-out in San Francisco. Before I moved away from the area 8 years ago, I ate at House of Hunan at least once a week for 15 years and, when it comes to Sweet and Sour Chicken, I have yet to find better. I felt honored to support this small, local, family owned and operated business.
Cheap and simple.  About what you would expect.

Great Chinese food, small restaurant with all-Chinese cooks. It's very much what first-generation immigrants would love to eat, as well as expats from mainland China. I love their prices. Don't come here looking for good service or great presentation.
I went here with a group of Mainland Chinese students. They seemed to like it so that's saying a lot. The food here is good but there was nothing extraordinary.
Friendly service, good food and reasonable price.

We went to this restaurant last night to order Mongolian beef and yanchow fried rice for dinner. The Mongolian beef was really nasty & dark, and the taste was unacceptable too, not at all, the yanchow fried rice we ordered, were made by the old meat, taste eww and you can even smell it.

RAT OR CAT TOOTH? Food was good with one notable exception...we found an incisor tooth from either a cat or rat. What do you think it is? Picture included in this link. I called to let them know and they couldn't care less.

The food here is cheap. They say they don't use MSG which is a plus. I would stick with the basics such as Sesame Chicken lunch plate. My personal favorites are the Mapo Tofu & the Mongolian Tofu. I avoid meat at places like this for obvious reasons.

We've been ordering from here for about 6 years now.  We definitely know which dishes to get (sesame chicken, BBQ pork fried rice) and which to avoid (potstickers - usually burned and too doughy, spinach with garlic - they leave the stems on that can choke you).  They're definitely all business so don't try and make friends with the counter people/owners.  Delivery is pretty quick and 90% of the time has been accurate.  The actual shop is pretty small and I can't say we've ever eaten there.  If you want some quick and easy "chinese" food, House of Hunan is pretty decent.

WORST (and completely RACIST) customer experience of my entire life. Delivered and charged me for the wrong meal, so I called and spoke with the woman who took my order. Rather than apologizing and canceling the order, she sent back the delivery man back to pick up and take back the entree. She said if it wasn't touched THEN she'd refund me.  I thought it was ridiculous, but I said "OK." Man comes back and asks whether or not I was Chinese. When I told him "No" he said that Chinese would have not made this a problem, but because I was Japanese he has no interest in delivering to my apartment again.
House of Hunan can be hit or miss. As a general rule, go for the noodle dishes!
Their hot and sour soup is both hot and sour!  Their chow mein is how I remember lo mein from my young days on the east coast.  Their mongolian beef is greasy delicious goodness.
Really terrible.  Every dish was pretty much disgusting.  I would avoid this place.

This is a great lunch place to eat or take out. Prices are good and food is tasty. The owner is always nice to me when taking my order and she always gives me extra fortune cookies for my daughter. For an easy non expensive chinese lunch I recommend this place.

Everyone sings the praises of the fried chicken here, but I am overdue in giving a shoutout to the burgers at HD/LFC.  Nothing fancy, just your basic angus beef pattie (generous) on a fresh bun, with or without cheese, and lettuce, tomato, onion and mayo.  Generous side of fries comes with each burger.  The only downside is that the closing time of the grill is erratic and unpredictable.  Best to order early and do so over the phone so you save yourself the walk, only to find out they may have already shut the grill down.  Best burger for the buck in all of SOMA.
This is the one that I like the best. No bums in here! But real good apple fritters and ham sandwiches! Nice counter staff.
Don't let the scary homeless folks outside dismay you.  This is the best place for fried chicken that's easy on your wallet.  Right across from stadium, so pick some up for the game.
Fried chicken was amazing. Mac an cheese was amazing. Catfish was amazing. Customer service was amazing. Extremely polite. And doesn't get overwhelmed with a crowd when she's working alone

Since 2012, Louisiana Fried Chicken has become a main spot for me when I'm walking Downtown before a ballgame. Whether it be one of their great sandwiches, or awesome fried chicken, it's a cool place to stop and grab something that isn't too heavy. I have yet to try the waffles that everyone tells me about, though. I need to get on that one of these times.
Best fried chicken of my life. After traveling Taiwan, Thailand, Cambodia, the Philippines, South Africa, Malawi, Zimbabwe, most countries in Europe, now, so late in my life, I discover it now!

Best place for a last stop before going to a Giants game.  You can get decent fried chicken or a sandwich that are pretty decent to take inside the park. Don't forget to get a sealed drink too - buying one at the game will cost almost as the food your bringing in.
When you need a donut...
LOUISIANA FRIED CHICKEN. Did it hurt? When you fell from heaven?

Donuts here are pretty good, but a little on the greasy side. I actually had an apple fritter and it was the largest one I have ever seen. I didn't try the chicken or other menu items, but it looks like they have quite a large selection at reasonable prices. The atmosphere leaves something to be desired; the tables and floor are dirty and the bathroom is pretty gross. But it's not a bad takeout option if you're in the area.
The best burger I've ever had in my life. No fluff. Hot and juicy and cooked perfectly.

Just a little bit sad after coming here around the time they opened to come for their chicken and waffles and it wasn't available! They said it would be available at least after 11am if they were lucky. So sad. We left to get breakfast somewhere else but came back for dinner time since we were still in the area. They had the chicken and waffles meal but had no other sides! Couldn't get anything else besides potato salad. I was a little frustrated because I can only have a small bite or two of it.

Louisiana Fried Chicken is an example of what's great about San Francisco -- it's a simple menu, friendly and efficient service, in a perfect location, and the food tastes great too.  What is surprising is the price is also quite reasonable, especially for the neighborhood, and when you dig into the menu a little bit more, it turns out to be an even better value -- grass fed beef in the burgers, various cajun options, and more.
Bomb ass chicken and waffles...nuff said

I go here every day because I work right next door. Good prices, tons of options, this place has everything. I usually get a deli sandwich, which is $6 and comes with chips and potato salad! What a deal, man.
The burgers here are made out of grass-fed beef, always the best. My blt on a croissant was bomb.

Neat menu. I ordered a pastrami reuben and she asked me how I wanted it, and I guess I didn't order it right because I asked for "regular" and didn't turn out to be a pastrami reuben, just a regular sandwich with pastrami...woops...yes, it comes with potato salad and chips. I like the fried chicken and burger offerings and would like to try it if I am in the ATT Park area again. The kitchen closes at some point. I asked for mashed potatoes side and she said "the kitchen is closed."

Louisiana Fried Chicken serves reasonably priced food, especially if one were to consider their proximity to AT&T Park (i.e. prime location which I am sure comes with a hefty price tag). They have fried chicken, Louisiana staples such as catfish, gumbo and Cajun rice, sandwiches, and donuts. The service is perfunctory and no-nonsense.

I've had better fried chicken and sides at almost every fried chicken place I've been to in recent memory, I'm sorry to say. Not that the fried chicken was bad, but it wasn't anything great either. I'd rather go to KFC if I want premade fried chicken for lunch, and their biscuits taste a lot better, too. The larger biscuit that comes with a combo meal at LFC has a decent texture, but lacks flavor. My mac 'n cheese also could've used more cheesy flavor. And my friends mentioned that their corn was bland as well. The best part of this meal were the freshly fried fries they gave me (fortunately) as a sub for the corn they just ran out of, although I had to remind them about the fries as I was eating my meal. Those fries are thicker cut than a McDonalds, but have a great crispiness and fluffiness to them with a good amount of salt and pepper.
To quote my friend: the fries must be seasoned with crack.
Cool place to have a bite to eat. Decent food! My only problem is that sometimes the chicken seems cold :/

Service is great and convienently located across from AT&T Park.  I have been here many times since it is near jobs that I work.  Staff are helpful, and the sandwich meals are reasonable price as well as deal (sandwich, salad and chips).

I've been here so many times and yet I'm just getting around to a review. It's been here since I can remember and open 24 hours. I work nearby and wanted to bring in some breakfast snacks to my coworkers early at 5 am.
Open 24 hrs it seems

The fried chicken was fairly flavorful and crispy. $8 is a steal for two pieces of chicken, a waffle, and side of potato in area. Atmosphere is more of a donut shop/takeout place, but there is ample space for a small group to dine in. From the exterior, it looks empty, but I saw several other guests there for coffee and pastry. I was disappointed with the donut holes. They were tough and stale, but that could just be timing since I visited in the afternoon.

Much like most donut places, the name of the game is GO - as in go early while the cases are fully stocked.  It's fun to make the other Giants fans stare at the donuts you bring in while they get that "I should have done that" look, but by that time of day the case is 3/4 gone.  Their donuts are a bit on the sweet side, but comparable to other ballpark fare or snack stuff in that neighborhood that's not a bad thing.

I love me some fried chicken. I also love going to Giants games. Imagine my delight when I discovered that I could combine these loves all thanks to one place! The prices certainly beat anything you can buy inside the park. I usually get fried chicken with some sides. The fried chicken has just the right amount of spicy goodness and is not too dry. You can't go wrong with any of the sides either. I usually go for mac and cheese and coleslaw.
The Bacon Cheeseburger with it's soft/pillowy bun and crusty flat-top patty is capital-L Legit.
Happy Donuts SLASH Louisiana Fried Chicken is the best of like, 5 different worlds.
Well, today after reading fellow yelpers saying how good the chicken is, i had to find out for myself.

Donuts, fried chicken and sandwiches. Fried chicken = good. Sandwiches = good. Donuts = obviously, good. I like this place. It's close by where I work and they always serve you speedily. Not the best chicken and waffles, nor the best sandwich but for the price they're asking, especially in SF, it's worth it. Plus, their potato salad isn't bad.

Nobody wants to live forever.  If you come here and get their waffle burger, you won't have to worry about outliving human civilization, and I mean that in a good way.  The burger is thick and juicy, yet somehow the waffle manages to stay reasonably intact and crispy on the outside.  Fresh vegetables inside make you feel like you're being at least somewhat healthful.  Fries are made fresh and hot with every burger.  And if you're still concerned about your immortality, you can finish off your meal with a donut.  Service is a little slow, but it's worth the wait.
Awesome Burger! It was exactly what I wanted. Reminded me of 1/4 Burgers in Oakland. I wanted something that tasted like a diner/greasy spoon style burger, this delivered.

I did not feel well after eating here. That is rare because I tend to have a stomach of steel. Look, I know that its fried chicken and that means a certain level of grease, but it was just too much for me.They also were dry and obviously had been sitting around for a while. Maybe that is why I didn't feel great later? I didn't care for the biscuits all that much either. The waffles? Meh. Just not that interesting or worth the calories.

After my friend and I got our baseball signed by Hunter Pence and Brandon Belt we got hella hungry. We were looking for a certain bar called 21st Amendment but my friend couldn't find it, so we opt for this chicken joint across the street from the ballpark. Talking about prime location, this is the definition of prime location. Not only does this place have chicken but they also have donuts too, but I didnt try any. On to what I actually ate: I ordered the #2 original. When you order your chicken combo, you can either have it with two sides and a biscuit or a waffle. I ordered my #2 with two sides and a biscuit( potato salad and cole slaw). The chicken was good. It had some kind of herb seasoning which added some kick to the crunchy skin. I like that. The #2 came with a breast and wing. The chicken was really moist. The worst thing that can happen to fried chicken is dried over done breast meat. The potato salad was ok and so was the slaw. Its a classic flavor combo and everything went well together. I put some slaw  and chicken in the biscuit and made myself a fried chicken biscuit sandwich. And all that food was just around 10 bucks I added a Vitamin water too. Not bad at all!  Shizz I am craving some fried chicken now... DAMMIT!
Oh. My. Word. I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!
We were starving at ate here before the SF boat show.  It's very casual and there is limited seating.

Delicious! Wasn't expecting much based on comments from friends, but this place definitely was a surprise hit. I got a few of the fried chicken pieces. They were juicy, crunchy, and the flavor went all the way through to the meat. Sooo good. Much better than little skillet around the corner.

Their donuts are overpriced and not super fresh tasting. The afternoon that I visited, their kitchen was closed for cleaning, so I didn't get the chance to try the fried chicken. I do like the idea of getting the two in the same place though. I'll return some other time.
WAFFLEBURGER!!!!!
Talk about a secret but in a good way.
I had the buffalo blue wrap on Monday. It was so good I had to go back and get it again.
Little whole in the wall right next to where I work. follow the big "221" and roof lights that leads to a reception.
Love the staff and the food. It has now become a regular spot for our office to lunch.
Second half comeback.

Better than ballpark food...service is ok...wish they place was cleaner...at least I could get pizza and beer before the game...nothing wrong with that...and they have a tv that always has sports...better than some silly talk show or TBS movie.  I go when I hit a game...nuff said.
Never deliver!!!!!! I just want my money back! They didn't return my money! Don't buy from them!

Great lunch spot for pizza by the slice. There were about 8 different types of pizza to choose from. The crust is a bit thicker than Amicis or Escape which was great. Slices were about 3.50 each. Fast service. One draw back is that its small so there isn't much room to sit there and eat.
Pizza is a little expensive. Wide variety of food.

Definitely a grab and go kind of place. The slices are premade, and they go to heat them up a bit before handing it over. I got the sausage and mushroom, which was tasty, but not the most delicious place I've ever been. If I remember correctly, my slice was around $3. SBC is the kind of place that you go to because it's convenient and you need to head back to work soon. Tasty pizza, but I wouldn't come out of my way for a slice.
Your average pizza.  Nothing special but it is quick and convenient when you need delivery.

I worked at ATT Park, so I would always come here for a meal. Their pizza is subpar. They sell it by the slice at the front counter, fresh or not. If not, they throw it back in the oven to heat it up, which kinda throws off the flavor of the original masterpiece. Their burritos are excellent. Meat, rice, beans, salsa, avocado and amazing, made from scratch salsas. I also like their chicken sandwiches and Philly Steaks..come with middle of the pack fries. I've made friends with them over the years, and they do care about their customers which is nice! Also a bunch of drinks to choose from, made from scratch pizzas and sizes, calzones, salads, pastas with four different sauces, and burgers! Try the pick me up burger, comes with bacon! Honestly, should be called SBC burritos and more bc their burritos are their best item!

Came home from work CRAVING a meatball sub and this was the closest place that seemed to have one on their menu.  Now as a former New Yorker, I have very high standards when it comes to things like pizza and casual Italian food.  However, I've learned to "relax" them because after all, this isn't New York.  However, I CANNOT relax my standards enough to consider a meatball sub from this place as being good...or even passable.  Two golf ball-sized meatballs buried inside half a loaf of bread is NOT a sub...not one worth $7.50 price. 'nuf said.
Thankfully I ordered only a couple of slices. They used BBQ sauce on a pizza! I personally dont like that, and since the pizza wasn't that fresh, It was a little below par!
Good vibes, and pizza is just right. More selection of beer would be nice
Not a better pizza in the city. Annie knows her pies, great New York style pizza is a must try when in the city.

This place is just around the corner from my work so I decided to give it a shot. I paid $7.50 for 2 slices - one pepperoni pineapple and one BBQ chicken. Good thing is they have lots of different pizzas. That and I don't think I usually see pepperoni pineapple anywhere. Woo hoo!! The pizza itself was just OK though. Wasn't very hot even though they did heat it up for us and the BBQ chicken felt like it'd been sitting there for awhile.

I actually went here for a burrito over lunch one day--NOT pizza--so my review is for that. It was definitely tasty for $6.75 (but beware they have a $10 minimum for credit cards, so I ended up buying two Gatorades and spending $10 and change in the end since I wasn't carrying cash. Rookie SF mistake).
Perfect for a quick pizza. Get in, get out. That's what sh...
Came in today around 3:45 - and grabbed a cheese slice of pizza and a soda for $5. Overall, the slice was about average - filling, however, it wasn't anything out of this world.
Perfect for a quick bite before our tour of the park. Fresh mushrooms on my pizza and good flavor. Wasn't hot enough but any more time in the oven and it would have been burnt. Overall very happy.

Besides all the negative reviews, I happen to enjoy this place! They have an amazing chicken pesto pizza with just the right amount of everything. Besides, who doesn't love beer and french fries!? Since it's just around the corner from my home, this is my go-to place for a fatty meal on a Sunday night! Oh but I do try to avoid it on game nights.
They offer a quick cheap and yummy thin crust pizza with all the greasy meat toppings! It's right off the MUNI and super close to the AT&T stadium, so it was perfect while we were out sight seeing!
It's simple - decent pies for decent prices. Can be a little greasy, which forces me to act like an old lady and blot the grease with a napkin before eating.

Zach, when you're on the case near the AT&T Stadium and need a quick bite, SBC Pizza makes for a decent option, doesn't it?  This establishment aims to serve mid-thickness slices of all kinds, and offers other options such as Tacos and Pasta.  It is as simple as it sounds Zach, and though it isn't the best pizza out there, it gets the job done.

The slcies here are well worth the price. Its a nice little palce where i can sit down, enjoy a beer, orde a slice or maybe a burger with some fries. They also have these delicious tacos that are top notch! Defintely i would say its my favorite spot for Pizza in San francisco!!!!!
Im rating this place three stars because when i ordered a philly cheese steak they put american cheese instead of mozzarella cheese.

I really liked the simplicity of this place. Our group (7 people on a Friday night) were about to go to Amici's across the street, but decided we wanted something cheaper and more casual. SBC was perfect. Hot slices for $3 and change, and they were delicious. Crispy crusts, great bread, and fresh toppings (I tried the veggie combo, the Hawaiian, and the Cheese - all were fantastic). They must have high turnover because I was expecting pretty gross quality for a slice that had been sitting for awhile (they reheat it for you). The store was decently clean, too.
A good place to go for a slice and a beer before the baseball game.  They have good deals and a tv to show the pregame action.  Not a bad spot but not great either.

Best Slices around the ball park! Fresh, wholesome ingredients are put into every pizza creation here at SBC Pizza, as well as everything else on their extensive menu. Burgers, fries, pasta, salads, tacos, burritos and more! By far the most deliciously affordable Pizza joint in the SOMA
Ballpark slice.

This place took my horrible evening of missing the train and smothered it in pizza. I ingested quite a bit of it and shared slices with others who had missed the train. We were made happy and my farts smell great this morning. If it was up to me, I would have all of my sweaters made out of SBC pizza and I would wear them everyday.  Even in the summer time despite my intense fear of being hot.  Happy Saint Patrick's day SBC.  you deserve an eternity of happiness similar to the joy you brought me in my evening.
Great spot to get a slice and a beer before the game and people watch.

This review is especially directed to the woman that works here. I'm sorry I don't know her name but she is always so friendly. I go here often since I work nearby. I left my wallet in the store and freaked out when I realised I left it. She recognized me as soon as I came in the next day and handed me my wallet. I tried to thank her with cash because I'm so grateful for someone so honest and good but she refused to take it. So I wanted to thank her again here so everyone knows the kind of good people who run this place.

This place is the perfect stop after a Giants game to sop up all of the $10.00 beer ingested at the game. The pizza is greasy good and cheap. There is never a crowd and they always have the postgame show on. This place is always a must stop on game day.
Grabbed some pizza here before going out and it was awful and overpriced. For $7 I got two slices that tasted like Di Giorno, and that's not a good thing.

Not bad for the price. The slices are large enough to fill an empty stomach, and the location is great since the ball park is about a block away. Extremely convenient to come in and grab a slice and head to the park. The pizza is ok, I have had better, but still not bad. Don't expect to find a seat inside because this place is quite small, typical hole in the wall, but overall not bad.

Excellent spot before a Giants game.  Little hole in the wall pizza place that also does sandwiches, burgers, tacos, pasta, salads, and calzones.  Everything is inexpensive and can be taken to-go and into the baseball game.  SBC has a few beers on tap and also some bottled beers.  Usually they offer a pizza slice / beer combo deal which is great.  Much cheaper than food in the park.  And really good, fresh food.  Had the burger last time and it was great.

Stopped in because a friend and I was hungry before a Giants game and didn't wanna pay a gazillion dollars for food in AT&T Park. Don't get me wrong, the selection and price is great, but the quality is not what I expected...
Convenient spot to grab a couple slices of pizza and a gallon of beer before a game. Every time I've been here, it's not very crowded, which is good.

This is an excellent quick stop on the way to the ball park. They have tasty beer and slice of pizza specials, and they have a very solid burger as well. They specialize in takeout, so they can give you stuff to bring straight into the ballpark! I have carried a slice or burger right in plenty of times.
food is eh, but the staff is nice. :)
Yum. Food is fresh and it's cheaper than the pizza place across the street.

I've been working in this area for over 8 months, and yesterday was my first time in to get a couple slices. My coworker had told me that the pizza here totally sucked and that I should avoid it at all costs. Well I shouldn't of taken his advice for so long, because it really wasn't that bad. I ordered the square thick piece of bbq chicken pizza and a slice of pepperoni. The pepperoni was ok, but he bbq chicken was yummy! It only took a couple minutes to warm up, and I was out the door. Next time I'm in the food for a quick slice of pizza, I'll definitely come here. It's not even close to being the best pizza around, but for being what it is, it's pretty good! Oh and super bonus is that they give you free ranch!

I didn't plan to eat here, in fact I just ate at Lousiana's (Happy Donuts and Fried Chicken) so I technically was full from my sandwich.. we were walking to the Giants parade and then there it was, a small pizza joint, seemed inviting for some reason lured me inside and I got a slice of pepperoni pizza.

I usually don't bother with writing reviews but I was so disappointed here considering the line was out the door.  Ordered a Shawarma  Lamb & Beef plate for lunch.  Got back to the office to find the meat was too dry.  Figured I'd just eat the rice and salad but found not one but TWO strands of hair in my food.....The Sesame Snaps were good.

You know that feeling when you started eating at a restaurant over 20 years ago and you fantasize about their lentils and rice with the best carmelized onions you've ever had and you are in the neighborhood so you treat yourself to some just because you know that it's going to be just amazing as you remember?  Yeah, that.

Tried their lamb shawarma in a pita (not the plate version) for lunch today, and the only thing I'm sad about is that it took me so long to discover this place! Generous portion of tender lamb, flavorful sauce with just the right amount of spice/heat. A tad heavy on the parsley for my personal taste, but overall it's a great dish. Friendly service behind the counter, and an incredible spread of salads and side dishes which I look forward to trying soon!
Three of us dined here and none of us were even slightly satisfied. The things we ordered and recommend not to get:
Wednesdays are reserved for Arabi as they have their special lamb shanks, which are awesome, and they have other great options as well such as kebabs, shawarma and salads.
Holy Moly. Their Lamb Shank special is DELISHHHH.

I am surprised there are only 60 (now 61) reviews for Arabi.   And after reading some, I'm surprised at all the negative reviews.  I did NOT notice a microwave (perhaps this was the previous owners way of cooking dishes), I did however notice a GRILL.  Notice most of the reviews are OLD and outdated . . .  give this place a try, you will be glad you did.  Now for my review. . .

Very good food, but make sure you come early! They generally run out of the salad early.  I got chicken kabob, very good, moist,salad and hummus.  The food is wonderful and priced well.  The staff is very friendly and welcoming.  The lamb shank looked awesome!  Will try next time.
Delicious Middle-Eastern food. Very clean homemade dishes at a very reasonable price. The felafel is to die for, and if you want to get it real fresh, get there shortly after 9:00 am :-)

Yes, this place costs $2 more than your average lunch spot in the area. However, in turn you get larger portions and healthier, fresher food. The kebobs and shawarma are good quality and lean. They also have a great selection of salads (anything from steamed veggies to dolma to tabouleh). This is like a home-cooked lunch; perhaps a little on the basic side but it is the only thing in the area that is truly low-fat and not over-processed or over-seasoned.
Get:
They treated me so nice with compliments and jokes. I wish your beef/lamb shwarma wasn't drier than summer.

This is the most amazing Arabic restaurant I have ever visited. First off, all of the employees are the nicest and kindest people you could ever meet. They are very helpful and keep a smile on their faces. The food is so amazing. Everyday I go in for breakfast and lunch, and I don't think I will ever go to any other Arabic restaurant in my life! This is the only place I'm not afraid to try new things because ever thing, from the salads to the hot plates, are delicious in every way possible. I recommend everyone going in and trying their delicious foods because I guarantee you all that you won't regret it! Arabi is the best in the west, as the Middle Easters would say... Lol
They are very nice in there, but the chicken schwarma wasn't.
Just had the lamb shank that I've been hearing about.  It's now served every Wednesday.  Fast and friendly service at 1:30 on  Wed.
Review is for the lamb shank and breakfast burrito.

Went here on a Friday.  Service is slow, because one of the workers does not speak any English, so I had to wait for another worker tell the first worker what to do.  I ordered beef kabob plate.  Came with rice.  UGG!  The rice is not authentic long grain rice that you might expect from a  Mediterranean joint.  It's this fat grain stuff that you get from a box of Uncle Ben's, and you get plenty of it to make it seem like you're getting a lot of food.  Doesn't taste good.  Screams "CHEAP" to me.  EVEN WORSE - The beef kabob:  you get 4 small chunks, and was MICROWAVED with the rice and veggies in order to heat it up.  Guess what - it became beef jerky, and the veggies were totally dead.  Also, whatever marinade they put the beef in is too sour.  All this for $10 - NO THANKS!!!  Avoid.
Quite possible the worst middle eastern wrap I have ever had!

I still crave for the Middle Eastern food we got in Europe, especially the Kebabs. It just doesn't seem that the same thing exists here. This place does a nice Shawarma in Lavash, not the same thing at all, but it's okay.

My coworker and I decided to venture out for lunch instead of dining upstairs in our cafeteria. I never been tried anything at the Rincon Center so I decided to branch out and try Arabi food. It reminded me of Greek food but only less delicious.
Their menu on Seamless has no resemblance to the options they actually offer and the staff is completely unhelpful when you try to call in an order.

I hate giving one star reviews, but hopefully my review will save you from wasting your money on this place.  I ordered the Chicken Schawarma plate with hummus, tabbouleh, and wheat pita.  Extremely disappointing. The hummus was decent, but nothing else was worth eating.  The chicken was dry, bland and generally not good. Pretty sure it was microwaved to death, but I don't think it was seasoned well to begin with. The tabbouleh was one of the worst I've had... the tomatoes were terribly mealy and it was unbalanced.  Way too much acid, no salt.  The pita was a complete throw away... incredibly stale.  Too bad... I really wanted to like this place since it's close to my office, and convenient for take out.  Clearly they do not care about food quality. Too many other great choices to waste your time and money on this place.

I love this place. I have been going here for the past five years. The ownership has since changed but the service has remained the same. I have told the owner this as well but they have the best falafels I have ever had.  And their breakfast burritos are awesome as well.  I have called and ordered the same one so many times that now when I order the owner already knows my voice.

disgusting. uncooked eggplant with soggy/chewy old chickpeas soaked in oil, wrapped like a burrito in a giant pita and some wilted lettuce. they asked "spicy?" i said yes. apparently that meant turn my pita into a sponge with bland tomato sauce. no flavor, terrible texture, bad temperature (microwaved then grilled, like a taqueria)...nothing was good.
Bad.. Bland..  stale food. It tasted like it was cooked atleast a couple days ago. The Chicken was so dry, I could have thrown at a car and it would break the window.
The service (yes, I know, how bad can service be at a take-out counter) was excellent, so props for that, if it means anything.
Got a groupon now deal for Arabi and I thought I'll try something new today.  For $8 (including tax), I get to choose a hot plate, a salad, and a drink (along with some pita bread).
Came here on a Wednesday and tried their specials which was Lamb shanks. Was disappointed, didn't have much flavor to it! Maybe I'll try something else later on and see if it's any good.

Best Breakfast Burritos in the area. They have an awesome spicy hot sauce that's got a mediterranean, sun-dried tomato taste to it. My favorite, Sausage with Feta and potatoes with an extra side of hot sauce. The owner is super nice and often gives us free, freshly fried Falafel balls while we wait.
GREATLY IN NEED OF SOME QUALITY CONTROL
Regrettably I tried this place couple of times.
No lavash surcharge. No oil soaked wrap. No reason not to be a fan.

i love this place!  Come here for lunch all the time.  You cannot beat the prices, for 10 bucks, i get shawarma, tabouli, humus, and mujadra.  It is all really tasty and they make great sauces to accompany their dishes...really like the parsley tahini sauce.  I don't care for falafel much, but the sandwich here is super good too...i'd replace the tomato tahini with the parsley though ;)  The owner is also super nice and friendly.

Let me start by saying the I am hesitant to give 1 star reviews. I am aware it is based on a one time experience and I may have caught a business on simply a bad day or I was not in the right frame of mind, but this was the worst kebab I have ever had and I want to warn others so they do not waste money as I did.

I am a big fan of Middle Eastern food - Israeli or Arab - and I have experience with both courtesy of spending a lot of time in Israel. I decided to head over to Rincon today because I work across the block and I was getting a bit tired of going to Rincon Grill.

I am in shawerma heaven.  This beef and lamb number on lavash bread is ridiculous.  The meat is perfectly grilled kebab, and the sauce is a delicious mix of yogurt, parsley, and ...chives, maybe?  The bread is crisp on the outside, soft on the inside.

Mediterranean food can be really hit or miss, but I think I might have found a new go to when grabbing lunch at Rincon.  Arabi is clean and easy to navigate when you come in.  Their main dishes are laid out easily for the untrained eye. Luckily, one of my friends ventured in with me so I got to try some of her plate as well!

I got the lamb/beef shawarma plate and the beef was very dry.  It was $7.99 and came with either rice or hummus, some lettuce, tomato, onions and a side of green dressing.  I know it's Rincon and it's doesn't have the best places, but I'd rather go to the Thai restaurant in there. Next time I'm craving Mediterranean food, I'll pick Sausalito Express next to Justin Herman Plaza- everyone there is so nice and good chicken shawarmas. Or Oasis Grill around the block on Drumm, but there's usually a line.
Great place for a falafel sandwich. Fast, convenient location at One Rincon. The falafel deluxe with eggplant and potato is a very filling and delicious lunch option. Happy to go back often!

Love, love, love this place.  I used to work a block away for almost 8 years and I have to say this was always my lunch of choice.   Pastitisi, Moussaka, Spanakopita,  tomato/cucumber/red onion salad and so much more.  I used to have a greek room mate who cooked all the time and I have to say this food is close to what I used to sample then.  Very home style feeling.

Get their veggie breakfast bagel. Even if you're not vegetarian, it's still delicious. You choose the type of bagel and spread (cream cheese or hummus), and it's topped with sprouts, tomato, cucumbers, and potentially more but I forget. They toast the bagel so it's all warm but the veggies are still fresh and crisp. Delicious and fairly cheap!

ah, the main tower deli. This place is a staple of my work week. I happen to work in the same building, so it's ultra convenient to pop in here for a bagel and coffee in the morning, or run down and grab something hot for lunch on days I don't feel like bravin g the FiDi crowds. The food is decently priced with good selection- I'm a fan of the falafel wrap and the Cool Ranch Chicken myself. The breakfast burritos are pretty damn good for eggs cooked on a panini press (seriously), and the bagels are hot, toasted and full of yummy cream cheese. I miss the fountain sodas, but the guys behind the counter are happy to grab you a cup of ice to go with your can or bottle of Diet Coke, should you need it. It's basic, it's simple, it's cheap. Seating is plentiful, the service is friendly and fast- what more could you want?
I have had at least 7 meals here.  All have been excellent.
I eat lunch here at least twice a week. The food is fresh and the dudes hustle. Not much more you can ask.
Found this place just by chance. You can't see this off any main street so they must get foot traffic by all the workers in the nearby buildings.
Just had a Vegan Wrap.  It was Killer.  Definitely coming back to this spot.
$8 for the daily special is a nice price, food was good. Went there with 5 friends, every one enjoyed their food. Good price/quality.
$7.58 for the Giants burger, on an unusual bread. Very nice quality/price ratio, and a bonus: very close to my new office :)

All the food is good. They have a nice variety of breakfast items (bagels, breakfast burritos, etc), the coffee is good, fresh OJ. And their lunches are good with a variety of sandwiches/ specials. Usually you can get a combo special for lunch for like $7. Pretty good prices for downtown!

In the city for a meeting I stopped here for breakfast.  The service was great, folks really friendly, and food was good.  Prices are decent.  I see they have a lunch buffet set up but I didn't have time to try that.  I would recommend this place if your on this side of financial district.

So I was looking for what used to be here but now it's called Main Tower instead of Nazdak Cafe since it's in the Schwab building.  Anyhow, I was here for the breakfast burrito and it's pretty good here.  The egg is tasty and you get a good amount of cheese in the burrito.  Otherwise, it's pretty standard fare, but a solid option if you work in the building.  I also saw my friend @jmk on CNN while eating here - random!
I had a turkey melt on sour dough and it was really really good. I will be going here and trying more of the menu in the future, but for now this place is really great.
Great food, best prices.  I get breakfast AND lunch in here for under $10 a day, which is unheard of in the financial district.  Always a smile from the employees.  Keep up the great work!

I ordered a tuna melt from their menu and they tried to charge me extra for cheese.  Shady, shady.  Sorry, but a tuna melt is not a tuna melt without cheese.  Until they change this practice, I'll have to give them 1 star.  I'll stick to the better deli at Rincon Market.

UNSANITARY!! The cashier was counting change on the cutting board!! I didn't even notice because I was looking at the menu on the wall as I placed my order. Can't imagine where those coins have been in the financial district.. The lady preparing my sandwich didn't even wear gloves! Where's a health inspector when you need one?!
This little deli is hidden and convenient for those of us searching for a quick bite at lunchtime... Especially in Soma when 10k employees empty into the streets at that same time.

Nice place to get affordable food. I have no problem with the quality of the food like other reviewers. Quick service when I go there. Small little hole in the wall spot. Ihey have no indoor seating everything is togo.  There is some really nice outdoor seating around the corner in the courtyard
$3.50 for the breakfast burrito.
While very affordable, the food here was not very tasty.  I got a breakfast burrito and a pb&j.
BIG sandwiches, cheapest place I know of in the entire downtown which is great on my budget and the sandwiches are actually good too.
