This place is a hidden little gem in SOMA.  It's always the same 2-3 people working there, so it has a very family-ish atmosphere, and they're very friendly.  There's no seating inside, but just outside is a pretty public area with fountains and benches and tables around the corner.

Really nice people, but bad food. I ordered the breakfast burrito without salsa. What got was a MICROWAVED potato wrap with barely any eggs & some cheese. Not worth it, threw it away & went to Specialtys. Seriously bad, nuked eggs! WTF?

Hole in the wall place?  Check.  Greasy breakfast burrito that will put you in a food coma?  Check.  This has got to be the cheapest place in SF where you can get a HUMUNGOUS sausage breakfast burrito for only $4!  Definitely not for those who want to eat healthier; they basically microwave the sausage and potatoes, but it's good once in a while for a "cheat" day.

Um, I can't believe how cheap the sandwiches are here. I got a PB&J for $2. Yeah, it's just peanut butter and jam on wheat bread, but honestly, I've never seen a sandwich cheaper than $6 in the FiDi. They also have what appears to be a really extensive menu. I'll be back!
Stopped by last week and this week to pick up my usual lox bagel and noticed that they've raised their prices. Lox Bagel is now $3.50.
Get the special, bagel w/ cream cheese, lox and the usual trimmings for $3.50!

There's something to be said for the no-frills experience of City Kinetics. Their sandwiches and salads are simple, with nary a leaf of frisée or pomegranate relish to jazz it up. On the other hand, what they do offer is fresh, made to order, and much cheaper than everything nearby.  Many of the people who come here are so familiar with the menu that they don't even glance up at it as they order. While I was waiting in line, one customer began to specify how she wanted her sandwich only to have the person making it respond: "don't worry, I know how you like it."
Come here every morning for the lox bagel... $3!!! Where else in the city can you find that? The owner is always there and is super friendly, gonna try the tamales today!

Cheap sandwiches- great service. Cheap food in SOMA? Wow, awesome. They are perfect for lunch. They have the best egg salad and its super yummy. The women there make it fast and the price is unbeatable. Less than $3 for an egg salad. Cant beat that!
It didn't make me sick, so that's a good sign. I don't know why I don't just give it two stars, that's all it really deserves.
They have a sign on Mission Street advertising $5.99 for one or two years now.  I get their sandwich, one bag of chip and 12 oz soda.  They have always charged me $6.00.

Was in search of a smoothie place since Jamba Juice shut down. Found this place, ordered a strawberry banana smoothie and was greeted by the nicest man in all of San Francisco. The smoothie is delicious and exactly what I was looking for.
I'm not sure how this place has so many stars, it's not a really bad place, but it's pretty ghetto haha, and there's definitely better options.
Stopped in for a breakfast burrito. Fine burrito, excellent, friendly service. What's not to love?

Eww I will not going back. Surprisingly in the 4 years I have been working in the area and the number of times I have passed by this place I have never been tempted to go in and I never will be again.

Dude gave my friend a free cookie.  Great service.  Where else can you get a roast beef downtown for $4.75 out the door.  Bfast menu looked on point $3.50 bfast buritto.  The owner obviously take alot of pride in what he does and takes credit card.
two stars for how nice the guy is who owns it.....stand up guy and always pleasant.

Food is a solid good. Prices are REALLY good for downtown SF, although technically in the SOMA. I have had one of their rbeakfast sandwhichs and it was quite nummy. I tried their tri-tip sandwhich and it was "ok" - I have had better, but for $5, I am not going to complain.

Workers a really sweet, the guy is super flirtatious and can make even the hardest women smile on a Monday morning!  You can't beat the prices at this small hole in the wall.  I always order breakfast burritos, no meat for $3.
I stopped in to get break, and to my surprise, the staff was very much into providing great service.  We were all greeted with an enthusiastic smile that seemed to permeate the walls and floors.

This is a good place to get a sandwich, chips and can of soda for $6. However, customer service depends on who you get to serve you. The owner and the thin lady are nice and competent, but the not-so-thin lady is sort of rude, doesn't listen well, and acts like she doesn't want to be there.

This place is clutch.  It's hard spending twice as much for a sandwich at Working Girl when you have City Kinetics pretty much next door.  They're sandwiches aren't inventive, but that's not the point.  And very friendly service.
Weird name for a place.
Super friendly owner and fairly priced food for good quality!
I love ordering smoothies there due to good drinks and good prices. But the lady inside doesn't like to make smoothies for me.

so... lets start off by saying, when i think of getting brekfast from a cafe in the financial district, a bagel sandwhich porbably will cost me around $5! Here at kinetics, you can buy almost anything on the menu for less than $5!! Even a gyro or a tamale! The customer service is amzaing, and the staff is very welcoming.
"You're a good man."

You cannot beat this place for the price. The burrito was under $4, and by far the HEAVIEST breakfast burrito I have had in this area. It's literally TWICE the size of seller's market breakfast burrito!

I ordered a smoothie. It tasted like bubble gum. Gross. Fresh orange juice NOT. The lady put Sunny Delight and she must have put bubble gum flavored sherbert too. I took one sip and ended up giving it to a homeless woman.
Good value for the FiDi area.  No line at lunch. It's a little hard to find.
You could bludgeon somebody to death with the dense breakfast burrito I ordered here this morning, and at 4 bucks for a sausage breakfast burrito, that's one cheap murder weapon right there!

Makes me want to move to San Francisco without a job & get drunk every night.  That way I would need a really cheap hangover cure that was enough calories to last me the entire day on my nonexistent budget until I went out again that night.  A City Kinetics breakfast burrito would be all that & more.  Cheesy, starchy, eggy, hearty, booze sopping goodness. For $3!
I love this place ! They have a huge selection of things and are always super friendly. They have anything from sushi to wraps and a bunch more.
One night, my boyfriend and I were about to make a late fajita dinner.

This is a really conveniently placed shop (the nearest supermarket is a 20 minute walk away). There's a good selection of groceries and other goods. Some things are reasonably priced, others are overpriced - as you would expect, it being a small shop.
Amazing salad bar! So many things to choose from! Also, great deli sandwiches and if you don't want to break the bank they always have a daily sandwich special for $4.99.
This place is such a gem! Sooo thankful to have this place a block down from my place!

My family and I have been shopping at Bayside Market for over 20 years. The checking clerks they hire just keep getting more rude, holier-than-thou and pretentious. The prices have crossed the line into downright robbery. And now they've implemented the most ridiculous policy of closing the restrooms for several hours during baseball games, even if you are a paying customer. This market is a mile from the stadium, mind you. This was the last straw. I left my groceries at the register and walked out.

Ya know? Generally this place is pretty good. The food is fresh, and tasty and there's a pretty good selection. The staff is... satisfactory, but then again, its a small grocery, i'm not trying to expect top -notch customer service here. On the flip side, I hope your wallet is on a diet, because it's about to slim down a bit, things are quite expensive.

This place is really bad. I only go when really desperate as there are so few places to run in and pick up a couple of items. But this last experience was SO BAD- I had to post a warning. Looking to grab a quick snack to eat while I waited for my hair appt to start- ordered what I thought would be arguably the SAFEST fail proof thing to order from the nightmare of their so called deli counter. Yup I ordered a peanut butter and jelly on whole wheat bread- it is listed on the wall menu. The woman who prepared it did not seem to know how to make it! I know - hard to be believe but I am not kidding. She used what looked like a 3 foot thin sword to get the peanut butter out of jar! That was a real eye opener. She then wipes the long sword on a filthy dirty rag by the garbage and uses it again to get out the jelly. That was enough for me. I said never mind and walked out. Last time. Ever.
LOVE BAYSIDE.
I LOVE THIS PLACE. The salads cost the same for me to make as in REDMOND, Washington (middle of nowhere land 15 miles from Seattle, where all the Microsofties go).

I love this place! I always come here when I have the munchies because they have everything! I've tried their sushi, which is better than trader joe's/safeway/cosco sushi. The people working there are super friendly and attentive.

I am so sick of this place.  They will continue to do a brisk business because of the location, but the employees are such a-holes, that you (business owner -- whoever you are) -- will never get a dime more than I am desperate to spend.  What I am trying to say is that because of convenience, I end up making a few purchases from time to time, but only out of desperation.  Most (not all, but trust me, MOST), of your employees are jerks.
Short Story:

No wonder that I go to this market often, the staff this morning was rude. I was holding a cup of coffee and he asked what was it and I looked at him that it was obvious and said coffee and he smirked under his breath and kept turning his head.
This place employs at least one thief.

I rely on Bayside market way too much, but that's because I know I can.  Yes, they're prices are a bit higher than Safeway or TJ's, but that's because it's basically a convenience store, not really a full blown supermarket.  That being said, they always have what I'm looking for, whether it's any flavor of Ben & Jerry's, garlic salt, shoe laces, or bleach.

It is all about convenience.  We had someone stopping by for breakfast last minute and I had no food. So walking down a block to pick up sausages, oranges, bagels, pancakes and grapes really saved me. :)We've also stopped by in the morning when Red's wasn't open for coffee and a breakfast sandwich and it wasn't bad.
Bomb ass salad bar and my co-worker is addicted to their sandos. Service is a little surly from the one cashier who runs hot and cold but who cares, it's takeout!

I came by during a walk in the morning, I was a little hungry so I picked up a breakfast burrito, ham. But where was the ham? It was 80% egg 10% wrap, 5% cheese, and 1% ham. Yes I know, that's 96%, it was wrapped so bad the 4% accounts for all the air between. My eggs were green...flipped green! I stopped eating half way...

This place is overpriced but that's what you pay for the convenience!  Love this market and the workers are always friendly.  This place is stocked with ready to eat items as well as plenty of alcohol, wines, drinks, etc. in case you've forgotten to buy something.

I love the salad bar and deli.  The food is tasty.  They have a little of everything so if you're in a pinch and didn't get it from the supermarket, it's an easy walk from most of Rincon Hill neighborhood.
Convenient lil' market. After I finish my last round of petsitting I love stopping by for a light snack or salad. Friendly folks and varied selection of everything!

People people people, this is a neighborhood market! It's not intended to be your go-to grocery store for your everyday items. Even though I'm pretty sure they want it to be, but it shouldn't be. The prices are definitely higher here, but it's for the convenience of the residents/businesses in the area for a quick jaunt. One day I badly needed chapstick because I left mine at home, and I went down the street here during my lunch break and even though it was overpriced I still got it for the CONVENIENCE.

You know how much stuff costs at the grocery? Think about how much that same stuff costs at Whole Foods. But that isn't the end. Take another price leap, and you've now found yourself in Bayside Market. Every time I've walked in, my subconscious has kept making item-for-item $ comparisons between here and Whole Foods or Pride (aka Rainbow). I get turned-off at the inflation and decide to just leave.
Their tuna salad is terrible. I bought 1/4 lb and couldn't eat one bite. I'm not sure they even use tuna, it tastes more like mackerel.
This place has a disturbingly large stock of White Castle burgers in the freezer section.
Overpriced mediocrity.

I loooooove this place!  They continue to surprise me by carrying things I would never expect them to have...lowfat buttermilk?  Yes!  Chocolate cheerios? Yes!  Super fresh fruit? Yes!  Fancy cheese?  Yes!  I could go on all day...
Went to charge a snapple and was told there was a $5 min
Right around the corner from me, this place has almost everything you need. The deli is good too.

I love this place!  I haven't tried their deli counter yet, but their fridge deli has lots of vegetarian and vegan options, including Savvy Savories stuff (awesome spicy peanut noodles and pesto pasta).  I wish the deli counter had labeled veg*n items or ingredient lists.  They also carry a lot of the basics like spaghetti and noodles, juice, etc.  Really nice staff, too.
Perfect day to be Bayside.

At a first glance, the place looks a bit dicey, but it has quite a lot of quick pick-me-up options. The deli makes sandwiches to order, and the size of the sandwiches is quite big. On the downside, the groceries are a bit expensive, but when you're in a hurry or just want to pick up a snack, this place is very handy since the nearest grocery stores (as far as I know) are Safeway and Whole Foods, which aren't all that convenient in this location.

This place is right under my building. But it smells :( Every time I go there there is this really bad odor throughout the store that kills my appetite and I end up leaving the place. I think they use a dirty mob to clean the floor.

Great little corner market with a surprisingly good selection of healthy and vegan options, good beer selection, great salad bar, good sandwiches, and an always friendly staff.  My only complaint is that it's super expensive for all the groceries.  Great shop to have nearby work though.

Got lunch at the sandwich counter today - kind of annoying if you want to try a little bit of several things - they have to weigh them separately to price them. Also not everything in the display was labeled so I couldn't tell what the prices were or really what everything was. This was a late lunch, at like 2pm, but I still think everything should be labeled.

Like another use mentioned, it is convergent - yet pricey.  If you need some milk or detergent in a pinch, this is a solid option.  Other than that, you are doing yourself a disservice if you are trying to get all of your grocery needs here.

Salad bar is amazing!  Lots of choices and everything is very fresh as opposed to some salad bars when you can tell they've left it out all day.  They also have good sandwiches and feature a special sandwich daily for only $6.00!  The grocery part of the market is a bit overpriced, but that's pretty standard in soma.
I like this place a lot... I go there every day as it's right next to my house.
Calling all sammie addicts!!

Their bomboloni Italian donuts are a true treasure.  The dough is slightly chewier than an american donut and the fillings are perfection.  I've tried the nutella, chocolate/almond and pistachio, and have been impressed by all of them.  Worth the trip from Oakland.

I've heard a lot about these Bombolonis and so I went one morning to try to Ferry Building I was struck by how they were really tasty and different from the usual donuts, really delicious, if I could I'd like you every day ....

The woman who works this little stand is surly, but man, these donuts are ah-mazing. I've had them all, and I think the lemon cream is the best. They are cash only and the hours seem irregular to me but she is there usually there at noon when I drop by for lunch.
I came here on a Saturday morning. I've heared about bombolonis and just HAD to try one!
I'm switching to five stars. For $1 for a fresh, real East-Coast style bagel right in SoMa, this place is bomb.

This is a great place to grab a bagel sandwich before heading to the Caltrain just a few blocks away. I tried the traditional egg and cheese on an everything bagel, and it met my expectations. Surprisingly. the eggs are cooked in the microwave, and they come out seemingly light and fluffy.  Nice staff and fairly quick service for a small bagel shop with minimal to no seating available in-store.

This is a little bagel shop that is convenient especially for SoMa/Mission Bay workers to pass by to pick up a quick breakfast or lunch. They have a variety of different types of bagels from onion, blueberry, asiago, jalapeno, etc. to go with creamy and airy spreads. If you'd want a little more, they do have bagel omelets (think bfast sandwich from McDonald's but on a bagel) and bagel sandwiches on their menu.
I love this place, I want to go every morning because it's delicious, affordable, and fast.
A reward to myself on Friday's are these bagels.
Small, grab-and-go place. Well-toasted bagel with a generous (almost too generous - I actually had to scrape about half of it off) spread of rich, fluffy cream cheese.

I enjoyed my sausage omelette on bagel here.  It was pork sausage which I can't find at Noah's or any other breakfast cafe in this area.  They seemed to have a big following from the local work community.  Since this is on my walk commute to work, I'll probably stop by here to try other bagel omelette selections.

THE ONLY REAL BAGEL IN SF. Seriously. I've been looking for an east coast style bagel, boiled and baked, and I finally found it. They have solid Reuben's too, iced coffee is good, and they do a very good sausage egg and cheese sandwich

I love this place and go there daily. Kate and Ben are the best!!! Their bagels are made fresh every day. The sandwiches and salads are also great. The line can sometimes get long but I think it's worth the wait.
If you've read a previous post of mine you will already know that I have been on the search for a new bagel sandwich spot after my company moved it's headquarters.

Ben and Caitlin are the absolute best. Such a sweet, kind, laid back couple. Its been a joy to work with them and they are always accommodating of any changes to my company's weekly Monday bagel order, even going so far as to call on a Friday when it is a holiday Monday to ask if we'd like to have a Tuesday delivery. That alone is worthy of 5 stars....

i really don't get the rave reviews. i got the breakfast bagel with egg, mushrooms, and green onions. bagel was nothing spectacular, maybe even a little dry. eggs were fluffy but MICROWAVED and did not have enough mushrooms. it was cheap at least... $3.50 something after tax, but nothing to write home about.
Great bagels. They microwave their eggs which is a big no no. They should get Taylor ham (it's an east coast thing. Better than bacon).
Do much better than subway a few doors down. The sandwiches are always good, and on a warm toasted bagel.

The best bagels in San Francisco live here! Always fresh, always yummy, and still affordable in tech$ crazy SOMA! Love going here once or twice a week for an All In One (their word for Everything) with cream cheese or one of their delicious (and affordable) breakfast sandwiches. You can't go wrong with the #2 on All In one, or the Cali Omlet if you need some Avo to start the day.
Yum Yum in my tum! I love the people that work there super friendly super awesome! It's a must in San Francisco!
I absolutely love this place! Not only is the food yummy but the people are so friendly!

I wanted to add that the Bagel Bakery usually has a vegetarian soup of the week and it is usually fantastic.  So far I've had the tomato rice and spinach orzo varieties.  Both are probably very simple to make at home, but there's nothing like being able to get a hot cup of tasty soup on a cold day without having to toil away in the kitchen.  It's also nice to not have to rely on Subway's random availability of vegetarian (?) soups all the time.  Way to go, Bagel Bakery!

The last 3 visits have not been good.  A bagel with butter should not be hard to make but they seem to keep fucking it up.  First 2 times there was very little butter on the bagel making each bite hit or miss.  Then when you request a bagel with a lot of butter you get something inedible.  (see picture for example)

Ahhh bagel bakery, or as we like to call it in the office...the bagel place. I love this place! Sandwiches are super tasty and filling. Once in a while I actually get a breakfast sausage bagel sandwich for lunch, yum yum. My favorite is probably #15... i forget what is in it, but if you're there just get it!

Great bagels and cream cheese at the Bagel Bakery!  The prices are good too.  I always stop by here before Giants games and bring a bagel sandwich to the ballpark.  I just wish they were open on the weekends as well.  Sometimes they also run out of most bagel flavors by noon.
Had the everything bagel with jalapeno cream cheese.  Was good, but a little too chewy for my taste.  Still on the search for a good bagel place in the city.

I frequented this spot a lot for lunch when I worked in the building right next to it.  They have a wide selection of freshly baked bagels.  My go-to for lunch was the ham, egg and cheese bagel, usually on a whole wheat bagel.  Their specialty bagels, like the pizza bagel, is so tasty!  If I was feeling under the weather, the chicken soup always hit the spot.  They also make a very yummy chai tea latte.
Awesome Breakfast Spot!!!

They say they make the best bagels in the Bay - as a transplant from South Florida who's had his share of real NYC bagels on visits to that city, I would have to say, these are as close to an authentic NY bagel.

The Bagel Bakery is my best buddy when I'm coming into work completely starving or hungover. Pouring mass amounts of sriracha on one of their breakfast bagel omelets at my desk is a favorite pastime of mine.
I like this place. Their bagels are awesome and their prices are pretty reasonable, but man, check your bagels before you leave, because this has been the third time they've messed up my order.

I regularly come here to get the breakfast bagel with cheese, bacon, and egg on an everything bagel. The bagel is toasted perfectly every time and the light spread of salted butter on each half ensures that each bite is packed full of flavor and the right balance of texture. In the morning the place can get pretty busy so don't be surprised if you're waiting 10 minutes for your order.
Awesome breakfast bagels, a nice selection of flavored cream cheeses, cheap coffee and fast! Great way to start the day.

Breakfast Review: Really yummy bagels, where the bagel is toasted and heated through and the egg and cheese all fuse together into a beautiful harmony so then I can take a bite without anything moving. In the morning there's usually a line, but it goes pretty fast and efficiently.
Bomb ass blueberry muffins! #swag

The first time I came here I was really annoyed bc the woman at the register wanted me to give her all my change so she'd have some. After that the experiences were way better. The service is awesome, they remember everyone, and are just very nice people. The food is delicious as well. I usually get the number four with no egg and extra bacon! Yum!!

The best bagels we've found in SF. Hurray! Now if only they were open on weekends... it's a bit tough to get there during the week and I'd love nothing more than to have my cupboards constantly stocked with these little rings of deliciousness.

It's quite simple really. You enter the small shop, you get in the usually snaking line, you order a bagel sandwich with a choice of bagel, you pay, you wait a tad, and you receive a little brown paper bag. Then, you merrily skip to your tech company or startup while swinging your little brown bag.
I was downtown and decided to swing by. Parking was a mother. I got flipped off and called a b*tch while I was trying to find a spot. I ended up parking at the Safeway down the street.
I don't get to the city much, but this will be my new go to location for a quick bite. Very tasty club bagel which!

Sorry, not sure why there are these good ratings. This place like microwaves all their food, especially when they have a grill. Their egg sandwiches are egg poured into tuperware and then microwaved then put onto a bagel, which is then microwaved to heat up the pre-cooked bacon. Same with all their hot sandwiches. Bagels are pretty good for SF, but the sandwiches and anything beyond just a bagel will be prepared quickly and not very good.

They have a solid selection of bagels and bagel sandwiches...both for breakfast and lunch! The one main complaint is that they are not open on weekends...I realize they cater to the work week crowd but man I'd go there way more often otherwise.
Usually pretty packed in there but the food is worth the wait. Pesto bagel is pretty damn good. Great service.

The Bagel Bakery is so good, it actually has me re-prioritizing my life: Men or bagels? Men or coffee? Orgasms or The Bagel Bakery? Orgasms AT The Bagel Bakery? Hmmmm...it's a lot to ponder. But there's no pondering when it comes to the fact that the bagels and coffee at The Bagel Bakery absolutely rock! The coffee is amazing, and not only do they have a huge variety of bagels, they even have different sizes! They also offer anything and everything else in the way of lunchy brunchy munchies: muffins, granola, yogurt, fruit, all-natural potato chips, tuna/chicken salad, pasta salads, soda, juices, etc. The place is a bit small, but you can always take your food items back to your room and have you way with them.

This place is terrible, it's an Asian resturant with only white people.  How is that even possible in san francisco?!?!?  The management  is rude and service is slow even tho there was no I ne there.  We had a mixed group of people and we were told that we could only be served one round of drinks at 9 pm I n a friday.  Basically this place sucks.

Ate there llast Thursday night. The best bottle of sake I've ever half in my life. At $120 it was also the most expensive... A-Rod was sitting two tables down... overall a very enjoyable experience... great food as well...
I just wanted to give an update, even though I can't give half stars, this is close to 5 stars!
Yummy!

Fabulous restaurant. Great place to go with friends, a date, family, and business colleagues. The food is excellent! Service is great too. I really enjoyed their Sake flights and the green tea ice cream was delicious. Definitely a must to go back!

Ok, for everyone thinking this place is over priced, it's not. The old adage of 'you get what you pay for' definitely applies. Not only is the food incredible but the service is unparalleled. I didn't have to wait for water, my server was attentive, friendly, and fun, and then there was the food....BEST BLACK COD EVER. If you're up for a little adventure, try the 'Charlie's Special' (uni shooter)....delicious.
Ozumo is now my favorite Japanese SF restaurant.  I should have come here sooner!  Great food, atmosphere, and Mel the manager was just great.

I take business clients from out of town here but last night I took my wife for the first time for her birthday dinner. She had the best time and is still talking about it this morning. The food, the drinks, the music, everything is 5 stars. Also Want to give props to Mel who went out of his way to really make my wife feel special on her day.

There are so many options for sushi in San Fran and this turned lot to be a great choice for a group dinner. Cool atmosphere with a great view of the Bay Bridge. We loved the small-plates menu and the opportunity to share and sample a bunch if different things. The tuna tartare, the filet, and the prawn tempura were particularly good. Extensive sale selection and an ample wine list. This isn't the place to go if you are looking for traditional sushi but its strength is an avant garde menu in a trendy setting.
Decent sushi, best so far in sf. Came highly recommended. Sushi was very fresh. Flavors lacked a little bit of oomph. Was pretty busy when we were there, so service was a little slow

Sushi is slightly better than Safeway sushi. Waitstaff is slow and unfamiliar with the menu. Bar looks like your brothers room at your parents house. Go to Chaya three doors down...way better selection and fresher sushi.
I have eaten here twice.

One of the best meal experiences we have had, hands down!  My husband and I came for dinner on a Saturday and were able to get great service throughout. Drinks, appetizers, sushi rolls, and chocolate fondue dessert with herbal tea. We tried it all, and we're pleased. I will say the riceless lobster roll may be an acquired taste. Other than that, loved it all!

We went here on out first night in San Fran at the suggestion of our concierge. It definitely has a great loungy vibe, perfect for a date night or even a night out with a big group of friends (there is a lot of space and there were lots of big tables for groups). We made a late reservation so there was only room at the sushi bar, which was just fine for my hubby and me.
Amazing!!!!! Food was spectacular. Service was outstanding. Ambiance was lovely. Can't wait to go back ......tomorrow??!
Some of the best sushi I've had in the city, with stunning views of the Bay Bridge if you snag a good seat in the restaurant.

The food was good but even the web side says they are open till 11pm when we hot there on Saturday night the hostess told us they are not going to serve dinner!!! We asked for the manager and after going back an forth he told us they will serve us dinner if we order right away !!!! The bar tender was rushing us to the order before we had time to Oder a drink. Not a good experience at such beautiful city!! They were not attentive. I will not go back.
This. Place. Is. AMAZING.

I love Ozumo! They have sofa seats, which makes it so comfortable and will just wanna stay longer and order more dishes! The view in their main dining room is very pretty. Too bad I was not sitting there and just saw it when I was walking to the bathroom. Their sushi might not be too special, but their sashimi is fresh and sweet. I think their cooked dishes are better. The duck breast is good. I heard they will change their menu from time to time, so I will definitely go again after a few months!

We ordered Omakaze Saturday evening.  It was busy, but our wonderful waitress, Veronica, delivered an amazing experience.  We started with a Hamachi sashimi in a wonderful sauce, moved through sushi, sashimi, and beef.  Each step of the way, Veronica checked in on the direction we wanted to go, but she controlled the menu and we were delighted with her selections and the food.  What amazed me was the Sake pairings.  We moved across and wonderful selection of sake from sweet and cloudy to dry and clear.  Each pairing amazed me and really opened my eyes to sake and its complexities.  Five stars for sure and many thanks to Veronica.
Great place. Beautiful view of the bridge. Hip ambiance. Very attentive staff.
What a wonderful restaurant! I loved the robata, sushi and sake as well. I will make sure to stop by every time I go to San Francisco

Nice lunch place close to Rincon center. If you don't have reservation you get to sit at the sushi bar. Even though the place is huge.. guess it's popular. I had the sushi bento box which was good. My hubs had the spicy miso ramen which was good. Nothing spectacular (ok the service is prob above average) but worth repeat business.

Usually I love Ozumo but....today was horrid.  the service was SLOW.....Beer took 10+ minutes.  My main sushi never came, after almost an hour.  Finally I cancelled it and told her we had to go.  Clearly I was irritated and it took almost 10 minutes to get the bill back.  When the bill finally came the manager said, we took the roll off the bill.  GEE, really?   Like it was a favor that they took the roll off I never even got.
0zumo...what a great find. Ozumo has the best sushi and is such a beautiful restaurant.

Everything I ate was so delicious, drinks included! Tuna tartar and the sushi were amazing. The service was excellent and our server Molly was beautiful and so attentive! Definitely going back, great overall experience
bucho roll, tontoro, octopus salad, salmon belly, rice pudding, short ribs, branzini, buritoro, hamachi, scallops/risotto

It was date night for my lady and I, so of course sushi was our number one choice. Ozumo's is our favorite place to go to enjoy smooth sake and sushi. We ordered two appetizers garlic edamame and ahi tuna tartare. An order of toro and an order of the ozumo roll.
Chic ambiance, fresh sashimi, extensive sake selections.
Came here for my birthday week. Best sushi I have ever had. I am originally from DFW area, and man I've been missing out!

A beautiful place in every way--food, service, and location.  I had the steak tar tar, ankimo, and salmon belly.  The food made my heart sing!  Plus, they have an amazing selection of Japanese craft beers.
Expensive and small portions....the end
Solid large scale, upscale modernist Japanese cuisine right by the Embarcadero.  Yelpers and the server agreed mostly on what to order:
Mediocre at best. I'm sorry SF but this isn't your best sushi restaurant as the concierge made it out to be.
Delicious.
This is truly the finest sushi restaurant in San Francisco! The sushi is fresh, filling and melts in your mouth! I highly recommend trying the seafood gyoza - you won't regret it!
Excellent service, cozy but classy interior, dressy vibe... Great lunch spot.

I've been to Ozumo twice and they never fail to disappoint.  The place is habitually packed to the brim so I would make a reservation unless you enjoy waiting at the bar, which I do - the bar there boats a great number of domestic, imported and Japanese beers and delicious mixed drinks - but don't drink too much, or you'll lose your appetite for their vast array of appetizers and succulent sushi list.  With sushi, you tend to get what you pay for: great sushi comes at a great price.

Shabu was good, good meat but lots of cabbage which is the cheapest vegetable. We had shabu which is a kind of soup but no spoons were provided. We had to ask for it. We ate at bar area, our waitress was not that good. Seaweed salad is salty. We told her it was salty & we needed some lemon. All she was " you need some lemon", not saying anything about the salty salad. Cocktail is really mediocre.
Outstanding sushi and the best garlic edamames! Awesome place to have drinks and dinner. Classy crowd! I recommend making a reservation on weekends, it gets pretty busy there!

Get any of the sandwiches on the whole roll. You'll end up having enough for food for two meals. Although it's definitely quantity over quality, it's gotta be the best deal in soma. The veggie soup left me with something to desire. They have a great beer selection and a patio in the back which looks quaint but I've never eaten there.

Horrible customer service! Man at cash register with white beard was extremely rude and condescending. Man behind deli counter was polite and that is why I'm rating 2 stars. Food not good enough to make up for the treatment. Not coming back

Went there today for lunch and was very impressed with the loaded turkey and salami sandwich. I only got a half and I'm sure glad I did, it's all my little tummy could handle. The bread was fresh and soft and I loved that we can select our own fixings. The back patio is nice and cozy. Looking forward to going back and trying more of their delicious meats.

Pretty disappointed by the place.  Second try after being let down the first time.  This time stopped in for a quick slice of pizza and took a longer look around.  Noted the wine/beer prices are about 75% higher than grocery stores and 50% higher than other speciality stores.  Pizza was very disappointing, to the point I tossed half of it on the way back to the office.  Two strikes, won't be a third.
Not only are the deli options varied and delicious, Hennessey's also has a decent selection of ales and spirits.
The sandwiches here are fantastic! It's a nice hidden gem, that I frequently visit during my lunch break since it's near my office.
This place doesn't have much of a selection, but what it does offer is basically good. It is very pricey - $12.00 total  for a half gallon of milk, quart of milk, and 5 0z. bag of chips!
It's a day game at AT&T and all your regular lunch spots are being terrorized by MLB fans...

I walked into this place (the door was open) at 8:02pm on 12/11/13 to see if they were still able to sell me a bottle of wine.  When I asked if they were still open, my question was met with, "NO!  That's why the door is closed and there's a sign on the front saying, WE'RE CLOSED!'"  The only thing missing in this young man's response was ", YOU IDIOT!"  Regardless of the fact that they close at 8pm, this was not exactly the best customer experience.  I live down the street and have been to this place a handful of times, but I certainly won't be returning after that.

There's only one reason to patronize Hennessey's: To run in for a quick soft drink, or to buy a bottle of wine before you head some place more inviting. But I made the mistake of ordering a sandwich. I can't believe this place survives in the monied, high-tech climate of South Park/2nd Street. Don't the local bourgeoisie expect more for all the money they drop? And woe to the Giants fan who thinks this is the place to grab a sandwich before a game.
I've been coming to this place for a while, on occasion, as they make decent sandwiches and have a good assortment of specialty foods and wine.

I took advantage of my surprise indefinite vacation today to visit some old coworkers up in the city for lunch. We were supposed to meet at 21st Amendment, but the wait was going to be too long and the rest of the folks who are still employed had to get back to work. LP (who has never let me down in the food department) suggested a tiny liquor store a couple of doors down and said that they have great sandwiches.

I love theirs bagels and sandwiches,always made fresh. I have always been a fan until they hire a new Spanish man ( 40ish) who takes forever to make 1 sandwich for me. I normally come for fast togo food but he makes it 20mins just for a bagels with cream cheese. He moves super slow and has no idea where stuffs are. I hope they train staffs better. Otherwise,this place is very good.
Hennessy's is fan-fucking-tastic.

Solid Sandwiches and awesome cookies.  I have the Chick Salad on White bread and it was awesome.  Tried Roast beef on the Baguet the next time and it was also really tasty.  Definitely worth hitting for lunch or to grab sandwiches before a game.
Their sandwiches are good but a bit pricey.  Although, they are pretty big.  I haven't tried their pizza but it doesn't look appealing.
Sandwiches used to be loaded, now they are half the size and overpriced.

I've been stopping at Hennessy's before Giants games for the past few years. It's a great place to pick up a sandwich rather than spend the big $$ for food in the stadium. Sandwiches are ordered by checking on a card what you want along with fixings, bread, cheese, etc. The rolls are all freshly baked. They also have fresh baked pizza, cookies, chips and a good selection of micro brews

This place is really cool i admit this review is about 2years overdue- because that is when i came. But it looks like its still just the same. This place give you a little card to fill out in the deli section *they make HUGE sandwiches* it's nice to fill out the card yourself because you can take proper time to choose what you exactly want- i feel like alot more places should do this. You decide all the veggies, sauces, meats, bread or cheeses you may or may not want. This place is also like one of those corner markets, except its really more of like a corner/specialty market. Almost every corner "grocery/deli" tries to be like these guys, but these are the only ones i've been in that have truly powned it. Their deli is real, not half assed prepackaged chicken/tuna/lunchmeat/crabsalad deli. And come on, if you live in pit of Frisco like i do i imagine you've set foot in many and have discovered this. They all suck, but this place is awesome. Their store is actually realy decenty sized and the fair sized deli section had it's own designated area. They sell tons of other homemade special items as well as tons of drink and snack options you could also choose from.  Staff was friendly
BEWARE They charge an extra .75 cents for cc purchases under $5.

I have mixed feelings about this place. They have decent selection of snacks and drinks, large/filling sandwiches, a nice variety of local and crafted beers, and their claim to fame seems to be their wine selection and tasting bar.

Like the others, to me it looks like a shady liquor store from the outside. Like the others, too, I frequent here for lunch. Once inside you'll find a deli counter with excellent food and service. Their approach to ordering is unique (fill out a card, place in the basket), and all the ingredients are fresh+delicious. They have a huge wine selection, and if you don't see it -- they'll find it.  Pricing is good, and the best bread is the home-made baguettes.
It's a super convenient place near where I work to grab a cup of coffee or a quick snack. They brew Capricorn and Peet's coffee and have cinnamon to put in, which are both pluses.
Four stars, plus 2 more for Cindy T and James H!

I work in the area and Hennessy's is my go-to lunch spot for a quick and delicious sandwich. Tip: on the sandwich form that you fill out, write "1/2" for half sandwich. It's more than enough food, and it's only $4. It's a great deal. This place also has an excellent wine and beer selection!

What a gem! I work literally right next to this joint and have only just now discovered their delicious, affordable lunch menu. A frittata sandwich for $3.50??? Are you freakin' kidding me? In SF? WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?

Dropped to one star.  First, one of the rude employees swept of mouse droppings in front of me while I waited for my sandwich.  She also handled the mouse traps with her bare hands and didn't wash them before moving on to touch other stuff around the store.  I had to move out of her way for her to sweep, but this was only indicated to me by a look.  God forbid she say a word, much less "excuse me."   Also, the sandwiches now appear to come with about 1/4 of the amount of meat.  Not going back.
I really need to come back and try the wine flight with cheese plate ($12.95) while sitting on the back patio. I'm pretty confident that'll warrant a 4th star.
The value and quality of Hennessy's sandwiches are pretty decent by San Francisco standards but their customer service and unethical business practices are horrible.

the sandwiches are good here but i think it is way too expensive. buying a drink and a sandwich you run over 12 bucks easily i wish they would lower the price. One big complaint i have about this place is they will rob you if you smoke cigarettes. my goodness 9 dollars plus for a pack of smokes are you kidding? they are surely taking advantage of the students.

So I'm in the store to get a brew after picking my little 7lb dogs up from their haircut down the street, and this girl with a really bad attitude tells me dogs not allowed unless they are companion/guide dogs or some bullshit.
The sandwhiches are pretty good, the home-made bread is really tasty.
Got a chicken breast/ turkey on a roll today - HUGE, delicious, loved it. The roll was crisped just enough and so soft on the inside. Yummy.

This is where I tell someone "GET ME A SAMMICH!" To know the sandwiches here is to love them. I've had cravings for them week after week which make me go offroading from my lean and mean diet. But yeah, I give in. Custom-made to order and enormous. Two words: TWO. MEALS. I don't think I could ever finish one in one sitting unless I wanted to rupture. So it pays off to pair up with someone who wants the same thing and voila, cheap a$$ lunch to go (take note, Academy students.) Highly recommend the baguette bread since these are heavy duty sandwiches... especially with avocado and sprouts. Also happy that they also have mini peanut butter cups sold by the container. Nice SOMA deli. You have a sammich counter loyalist here!

The food here is amazing. You should always try their pizza of the day. It's incredible. They have amazing meats and deli offerings like curried chicken salad, egg frittatas, dolmas, and homemade soups. Also great coffee. You can get a small coffe for a $1! Hit this place up if you're in SOMA.

I love sandwiches and these people make some god damn delicious sandwiches. You get your choice of bread, cheese, meat, veggies, and all that jazz. The end result is pretty much whatever you want and is 99% of the time great. They also have soups and pizza if you are some sort of weirdo who hates sandwiches. They also sell cookies that are as big as an obese baby's head! In addition to all of that you can by tons of chips and other sides; along with cans, yes CANS of soda or whatever beverage you want. Now for the downer part: they are not the cheapest. They seriously sell a snickers bar for like $2.00! Who in their right mind does that?! Those giant cookies, kinda pricey; along with the pizza. The sandwiches are not bad though, it's usually about $7.00 or so for a sandwich and it is about 4,000 times better than any other sandwich place so, yeah. Also the place is kinda small so if it gets busy, pray that no one farts in there. Oh yeah, it is extremely easy to miss this place, but if you find it you won't be let down, or maybe you will who the hell knows.
I love grabbing a sandwich for lunch here. Made to order, they load them full of meat, cheese, and anything else you ask for. Plus, you can't beat the price.

I love this place.  It harbors one of my best San Francisco guilty pleasures: a piping hot cup of coffee and freshly baked pizza for breakfast around 11 AM, right when pizza and bread are coming out of the ovens, especially when it's raining.  You gluten free types who don't actually have celiac disease can keep it because I like fresh hot square pizza and coffee, and it turns any bad day on its head.

Great little SOMA deli. They make really good sandwiches on fresh-baked bread that are definitely two meals if you're not starving. The fresh baguette is absolutely delish and the prices aren't bad considering you can probably eat the sandwich twice. The speed of service really varies, so be aware that sometimes it can take several minutes to get your sandwich even if there's not many people there. I'm not a huge fan of the veggie sandwiches, but if you like cheese they're good. (Just not any other options besides the normal toppings for the MEAT sandwiches.)
Great dive-y deli with HUGE sandwiches. If you order up a sammie on their roll, be warned, it's gigantic and could possibly be enough for two meals.

I come here all the time for happy hour before the Giants games I attend with my dad! (Coincidentally they always win those times) I love it! My Dad is a usual costumer. They have an amazing atmosphere, food,  and service.

I attended a networking gathering last week at One Market and used the valet service for my car. At the end of the evening I came out to my car to find that someone had rifled through my center console, taken my cheap sunglasses, and stole my expensive jacket.  There was no sign of forced entry, so I think the valet simply left the door unlocked.  I sent an email to One Market over a week ago with still no reply.  The food was delicious, but their lack of professionalism has left a sour taste in my mouth.  I'll take my money (and car) elsewhere.
I went here for a company dinner with a fixed menu so my review is just on the food I never saw a menu or the prices.
Delicious gourmet food. Beautiful cozy atmosphere. Spent about 2 1/2 hrs here. You need a reservation. It was packed all night. Our group included a baby which didn't throw anyone for a loop.
I went to One Market via a "foodie group" I belong to:  SF Foodies on

Well located and inviting interior, but the menu is meat. All meat all the time. Hubby ordered the pork loin and got a PLATTER with three very large pieces of pork loin (see photos posted on yelp). It was too much food for one person let alone two yet you pay through the nose. Probably would not order the bland broccoli-flower side again. But the side of Brussel sprouts were well done with bits of tasty applewood bacon and the portion size was very generous. Service was efficient until the end, when we were ignored a bit and had to flag down the waitstaff for the check. Drinks were very clever and good- hubby had a classic Manhattan which he thoroughly enjoyed and I had the one with basil. Unique flavor but too strong for me to finish! Gave this three stars because of the menu choices and meat portion sizes. Wish Menu was more diverse- too much meat and only a one dish I could see appropriate for a vegetarian. So if you like meat, you'll have a good time here.

I went to One Market last night with my aunt and uncle who have frequented this place for years. I must say that it was a very pleasant experiece. Soft lighting, very attentive staff just make for a great atmosphere. I had the shrimp bisque, the duck, and pear streudel for dessert. All were delicious and were good sized serving. The restaurant is a bit pricy at about  $19-39 for main dish but worth it. I will be going back when I visit San Fran again!

I recently went to a birthday celebration for a friend at One Market.  The entire experience was superb.  We had a tasting menu with wine pairings included: six dishes plus wine with each.  The food was top notch, and our server (Steve) took care of our every need.  The result was one of the best evenings out that any of us had ever had.

The first half of our meal, the six item tasting menu, was fabulous. Delicate flavors artistically juxtaposed. Wine pairings that were surprising and delightful. Then something happened.  There was a delay in our next course coming out. Long enough that our server came over to apologize for the wait. The remaining two courses both suffered from over salting of the vegetable component of the dishes. All of the courses were constructed to create a harmony of flavors. With one part nearly inedible, the dish lacked the balance and harmony of the earlier courses. For both of those courses we left the salty part Uneaten. Overall the service was OK. But the server did not inquire "how was the dish?" after the first couple of courses, and there is a team of servers, not just one. As a consequence it was not til dessert that I got a chance to inquire what had happened and let our server know about the sudden saltiness. She conferred with her manager and a small adjustment to the bill was made.

Excellent in every way!  Had dinner here last week and everything was delicious, fresh and very tasty.  I had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and my friend has the 3 course meal of the beet appetizer, duck ( a few ways) and a creme brulee duo.  The duck was amazing.  So flavorful.  The bread that was included ( the one I ate was warm and filled with green olives) almost made it hard to save room for the meal.  We both got cocktails and my friends Manhattan was very well made (brandy soaked cherry inside was epic) and mine was too sour, so I asked for it to be adjusted with a little more simple syrup and then it was great.  The service was excellent.  I dropped my knife and it slide into my sauce heavy plate and instantly they gave me a new one so I didn't have to use a saucy knife.  It's a very nice restaurant with excellent well prepared food.
There's a reason why this place isn't on the Michelin Star list for 2014.
I have read that this restaurant is michlin rated. It is very good and they do everything well from the service to desert.  Great cocktails and everybodies seafood dish was good
The service was horrible!!

We had our daughters law school grad lunch here and it was amazing. The event planner was professional and very coordinated. The food and service were excellent. Usually with 30+ people in a party and a fixed menu the food sometimes suffers, but one market really delivered. Our guests really enjoyed it. I highly recommend one market for events.
OMGDTFKPORG!
The food was 4 star.

This is one of a handful of go-to places for me when I travel to San Francisco. With all the new fancy restaurants opening every week in SF, I can't keep up, so when I make the trek from Sonoma, I like to host my business lunches here. The food is always seasonal and delicious. The service is consistent, professional and friendly. I like to come here at least twice a year,  July which is 1/2 off on all wine by the bottle in September for their heirloom tomato menu. Had a fantastic birthday lunch here last week. Kris and Jose made were outstanding and the kitchen turned out amazing food. This restaurant should have 2 Michelin stars, not just one. I can't recommend One Market enough.
Yooooooooo!!! Dis iz dat fancy shiit. Me and my homies walked in like damn we ain't fancy. Errbody dressed nice and shit. Whatevs, Cali don care.

an interesting place...not quite interested in the food, but the venue is great.  I came with a large party and the food was average but good service, great ambiance, and perfect location will bring me back.
Been there several times for dinner and all have been positive to excellent across my four main criteria: taste, service, ambiance and value.
Very impressive!
Was here for an event and they have private rooms and a back area. The half roasted chicken was juicy and I recommend it

I made a reservation with a special request for a window table facing the water. The staff was incredibly helpful and made the night fantastic.  Our food was delicious.  I really enjoy the crowd at One Market as it is fairly diverse.  There is definitely more of a business feel to the place but it also has a fairly wide variety of folks.  Couldn't ask for a better dinner - thanks!

One of the greatest meals I've had in a VERY long time. It is a Michelin Star rated restaurant and you can absolutely taste the quality. The ambiance is well suited for a higher end restaurant, and the service was completely on the ball all night long.
Came in for dinner to squeeze in one last DAT meal.  Restaurant has a nice feel to it.  We were greeted and taken right to our table.  Throughout the meal the service was timely and pleasant.

My visits to One Market have always been great and satisfying. It is not a surprise to me that they are a Michelin Star Rated Restaurant. The food is always delicious and beautifully presented, and the service is always impeccable.
I have wanted to try One Market for some time and when I found that they were taking part in Dine About Town, I made the reservation as soon as the participating restaurant list was released.

All the fancy people in my office always came here to eat and I was always super envious. When Dine About Town came around I decided to take advantage of the discount and made a reservation for me and 5 of my frugal coworkers. The food was delicious and the price was reasonable....if you were one of the smart ones that didn't buy a drink. The iced team that my coworkers bought were $6! Did they know they could get a tea bag at work for free and put ice in it.
Carrot puree done badly. Fibers everywhere.

Went here yesterday for a business lunch. Fantastic service. I love the grilled flounder. No skin and the filet was perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was perfectly seasoned as well to my taste buds, light but fresh. I also had the Cesar salad which I loved. I love the whole romaine leaves served and just the hearts. The mint lemonade was great but next time I would order it without sugar as it was a little sweet for me. Overall great expierence.

I had a great time here, went here for happy hour, was a lol crowded, but we happened to get a table. Our waitress was Dora, she was super busy but very attentive, and friendly. I told her it was my friends bday and the manger sent over a really cute desert for my friend, totally made her day. It was the sweetest thing, she didn't have to but she went the extra mile...she was a complete delight. :)
Men is sharp suits and stiff vodka martinis equals a panty dropping event for women of all ages (21 and over).
Probably one of the worst bangs for your buck in SF.  Food is bland, some items taste microwaved, deserts tasted Safeway bought.  Mostly a place for corporate dinner meetings, like the one I was at.

Came in here for dinner. The appetizer that I had was the pickled sardines. which were quite delicious. For my main I ordered the 12 oz NY steak. it was cooked perfectly, but a little too heavy on the salt. I had to down my water because it was a bit dry on my throat the more bites I took. We also ordered some sides, and same thing with the buttered spinach - too much salt.

I ate here the week before trying Frances for the first time. Good grief. If you are looking for Michelin Star food, save yourself some money and go get a vastly superior meal in the Castro. I'll try not to draw too many comparisons between the two restaurants (I could go on and on about Frances' applewood smoked bacon beignets with maple chive crème fraîche or the five-dot bavette steak with sauteed wild ramps, fingerling potatos and crème fraîche); just know that Frances is considerably better.
Horrible!

I usually give this place 4 stars, but on my last visit I was very impressed. One Market is one of my favorite restaurants to hangout with family and friends. It is also a fine restaurant to bring your clients as well to discuss business and enjoy the views of San Francisco. The food and wine list is top-notch as well. The service is very attentive, and I would request David or Mickey to wait on your table for incredible service. I would recommend starting with the smoked trout which is one of their signature dishes. For the main entree go with the bacon wrapped pork tenderloins which will make you come back for more. The NY steak with a side order of sauted spinach is very good as well. I would recommend ordering 4 or 5 desserts and sharing amongst others at the table. All the desserts were fabulous. You can always tell if a restaurant is good by their coffee, and yes the coffee was very good. Overall, I will keep coming back here on a quarterly basis, and you should as well.
2.5 Stars for the Food.  Not terribly bad,  but not good either.
This place is so so good.
Great business lunch location, highly recommend - crab cakes were excellent!
Second time coming here for the breakfast burrito.
Two words: FISH BURRITOS!!!
Great food, and the owner (usually at the register) is a really funny guy (when he's in a good mood).
Service is very rude!!!

I hit this taqueria up at minimum once a week.  Pepe's is my go to place when I'm craving their carne asada plato or carne de cerdo chile verde (which is DELICIOUS), also the breakfast burrito is AWESOME.  There are many other platos and menu items I haven't tried, but I'm sure they are just a delicious.
The tacos were a sloppy mess and the service was rude.
The carne asada tacos are seriously the best!!!  Get it with both hot sauces and you'll be blown away by the flavors. Yummm.
I will keep this brief...
mmmm drool carnitas burrito how you like it...
Nothing special. The food is pretty subpar. I ordered the carne asada burrito. Steak tasted old. Beans tasted like it was from a can. Rice pretty much filled up the rest.
$5 minimum to use your card.
Came for a breakfast burrito at the insistence of a coworker (*cough*Albert*cough*) because he read somewhere that this place was a "hidden gem"...child please.
Great lunch place and reasonably priced on the entire menu.  Chicken dishes are the best!

Went Yesterday, And Got A Rajas Veggie Burrito. These Are Soo Good! I Usually Dont  Like Green Bell Pepper But These Are Soo Darn Good! Great service Everything Is Really Fresh! Only Thing Is Burritos Are Really Big And Can Be Messy.
WORST customer service I have ever experienced. And there was something wrong with the food as well.  If I could give this place a negative star I would.

I had the super burrito here and the tacos. Both were very ROTM and pricing wasn't too bad. This place won't blow your mind but you won't walk away with a bad impression either. The neighborhood can be a bit sketch but okay during the day.
Do NOT be fooled by the long lines.  I was looking where to buy when I saw a long line here and Mexican is one of my fave cuisines so it seemed like a no-brainer choice.
Yes, the guys are nice and I will definitely give them another try for breakfast and maybe even lunch at some point, but they forgot the eggs in my breakfast burrito.

I ordered the Chile Colorado plate for lunch.  The portions were ample for $7.25.  The beans and rice were fine, but the Chile had no "Chile".  It was more like tomato sauce.  It had no spice to it at all.  I added their spicy salsa to top it off, but again, there was no spice.  This place is definitely not "Authentic".  I may try it for breakfast one day since the burritos have great reviews...not sure about lunch again though.

COME HERE FOR BREAKFAST!! The chorizo breakfast burrito is amazingggg. Chorizo, two eggs, potatoes, and salsa on a large flour tortilla all for under $5. It's so easy to make this work for breakfast and lunch. And it comes with a kitchen crew that's eager to talk and brighten your day.

I liked the vegetarian burrito with rajasm, sauteed peppers and onions in a sour cream sauce. Both black and refried beans are vegetarian. Tasty and I felt good a few hours after eating it, which is a sure sign the ingredients are high quality. Next up - the breakfast burrito!

Fantastic food, value and location. Pepe's food is flavorful at a price that can't be beat. The carnitas and grilled chicken are amazing with the veggies always fresh. I love eating here, sadly I am not always working in the city.
Hands down, Pepe's massive chorizo breakfast burrito is the hidden gem of downtown of San Francisco.
Ordered their Platos Especials with rice, beans, lettuce, tomato, cilantro, onion, salsa & warm corn tortillas - Carne Asada (Grilled Steak) for $7.25

I've been to this place twice & both times ordered the breakfast burrito. It's definitely the top three breakfast burritos I've ever had. They fill it with scrambled eggs, potatoes, cheese, hot salsa, and your choice of meat.  I always get the chorizo because each burrito is made to order so they burn it a little giving it that smoky flavor. Because the portions are so huge, I usually eat half of it for breakfast & save the other half for lunch.  Breakfast & lunch for under $5...Now that's a SUPER DEAL!!
I love the way you get to customize your food at final stage of assembly (kind of like subway).

Not bad, but nothing special.  Pretty much if you are desperate for Mexican, this place will serve well.  The 3 taco deal on tuesday was not nearly enough food and the taste was ok, but didn't wow me, though the condiments were good quality.  $6.50 and I needed a yogurt after to fill me up, but I might return again to try another selection.  The normal 3 taco price would he a total rip off ($10) and would earn a 2 star rating were I to purchase that, but I never would, so really this rating is for Tuesday only.  With all the 4 and 5 star choices near my work, not really a reason to go here, though.

Didn't have high expectations, but the chile colorado burrito was actually pretty tasty.  The wrap was a little bit too flimsy for my taste, but all the produce tasted fresh and the meat had tons of flavor.  To top it all off, i was $6.30 for a hearty burrito!
Service makes this place great.
Taco Tuesday is now 3 for $6 - How dare they?!

The breakfast burrito's are sinfully delicious. You get a choice of bacon or chorizo and it's big enough to split with someone else and still be satisfied. Their burrito bowl has quickly become a favorite at my workplace with the low carb crew since it's basically the insides without the tortilla. I like going for the fish burrito with the green tortilla or the chicken burrito. Best burrito in a 3 block radius.
The burritos are good. I'm a big fan of the lengua which is very tasty. I was sad that they raised the price though so now it is the most expensive of the burritos!

Been coming here for years and can't get enough of their Carne Asada burrito! Trying their "regular nachos" for the first time and it's nothing to write home about.  But hey..It's fairly reasonable in price (for the Financial District, that is) and they serve fairly generous portions. Service is quick and friendly.
$7.68 for a chicken burrito (black beans, tomato, lettuce, hot salsa, onions) with a teaspoon of guac added.
- Rice and Beans Plato or Burrito

I generally go to lunch about one time per week because the Financial District is not cheap for mid-day eats.  My friend's and I usually hit the Rincon Center, and I head straight to Pepe's as a rule.
I am quite a fan of Pepe's veggie tofu burrito. Yum. They're pretty generous when it comes to packing the burrito with yummy goodness. I usually cut the burrito in half for 2 small meals.

My coworker and I would always go here as a plan B for Mexican food for lunch if we didn't feel like spending a lot at Orale Orale.  Their burritos were big and filling, but still very pricey but that's understandable considering that they're in the Financial District.  Being that there aren't too many choices for a Burrito in that area, I'd say their stuff it pretty decent.  Give it a shot for lunch if you're in the mood for some decent Mexican food.
Wow. I know it's the financial district and all, but comeon.......$2.75 for guac, sour cream and cheese?  And another $2.00 for a side of chips?  A side of chips?

Love their Taco Tuesdays! Three tacos for $5. Their burritos are pretty delicious too. My only gripe is that they charge extra for stuff that should be standard with a SUPER burrito, like sour cream and guacamole. Aside from that, the burritos are really good and the meat doesn't have that burnt gristle that some other burrito places leave behind. Two thumbs up!

I'm not sure if I'd send an out-of-towner who's asking me for a "real San Francisco experience" to the Tenderloin - unless he wants to do shady business, probably not. I could, instead, recommend visiting this McDonald's in SOMA, located on 3rd and Townsend. The clientele using this store as their regular hangout/begging/toilet getaway can be best described as eerie, so my recommendation is - IF you must use this McDonald's - use the drive-through.
Asked for 2 cookies off their dollar menu; about 9 minutes later I got them after the cashier and manager argued over whose fault it was they didn't have cookies ready. Unprofessional.

Oh dear, this place is tiny and so filthy.  Absolutely disgusting. People are slobs when they eat - so someone needs to wipe down the tables and sweep the floor every now and then.   I get that it's difficult to keep a restroom clean when people can come in and use it any time they need to - I mean - it's good that they are letting them, I guess, but it really needs to be cleaned.  My four year old little boy wouldn't even use the bathroom because it was "too icky".  He waited until we got on the train to come home.  And that bathroom, on Caltrain, wasn't that spiffy, either.

Yea, I'll admit to eating here occasionally.  They have good breakfast (who doesn't like egg mcmuffin and hash browns?) and their fries are good too.  I always have to go on a mini jog after eating their fatty food but it does taste good.
The last time I went here recently, something bit my ankle (flea, I guess?).  This is probably due to it being San Francisco and cheap eats, which attracts less hygienic people.

Only downside to this restaurant is that it is suitable for 10 - 20 customers. The staff here are patient and efficient. I couldn't stand the heat and was in need of an ice cream to cool off. At the same time, I was very tempted to munch on fast food. A great spot to get something to munch and sip on before heading to AT&T Park for a Giants' baseball game.

This location has the absolute service. They place a 70 year old woman behind the POS system and expect her to deal with rush hour service. The staff member refused to take my order simply because I was substitution a few items.
Good food for the type it is. Better than most McDonald's. Very convenient to Caltrain, Muni, and Giants baseball. They have dollar menu at this location.
It could be cleaner consider it's location..
-----------THIS BRANCH ONLY--------

This McDonald's is always busy when there's a Giants game in town and it's a major cheap alternative to eat at, compared to the prices of the food at the ballpark.  Since this place is ultra crowded during a Giants game.., their service can be terrible.  I've had many terrible "customer service" experiences at this McDonald's, but I will write about one specific incident that still annoys me.

Convenient McDonald's a block from AT&T Park, which makes it easy to pick up some food for a ballgame when not in the mood for the ballpark fare.  For people driving, there's a parking lot with a decent number of spaces.  There are not a lot of tables for dining in here.  As far as using the restrooms here, even though it's for customers only and they keep it locked under ordinary circumstances, you still have to compete with homeless nearby who come to use it in situations where they wait for a user to open the door and come out (but then, true customers do that too instead of asking for staff to let them in during those circumstances).

Guys, really important news - I'm revising my review of this McDonald's! The other day I was super broke and feeling low, so I visited McDonald's for the first time in over a year. The fries were crispy! Plus the service was fast, if inaccurate - they tried to give me back $8 in change instead of $11 (I corrected them) and gave me a coke instead of a sprite (I let that go, gotta choose your battles). But still, +1 star! Of course it's still McDonald's, so it's still total crap. Enjoy!

This McDonalds is nearby the Caltrain station and nearby the ballpark.  These are the only reasons I have visited this location more than once.  There are many interesting characters that come in and out of this McDonalds, but overall, it's pretty alright.
I love fast food but hate going in the city because of the associated riff-raff.
This is the place to go if you want to fill your stomach before the Giants game.  This place has been an epic film star of famous YouTube videos online of people fighting.
First off, the posted hours here aren't quite correct. The dining area closes at 10pm; drive-through closes at 11.

After clawing our way through the crowds coming out of the Giants-Rockies game on 9/20, we were in need of sustenance (the ballpark food being too rich for our blood, and our small lunch that we brought in long ago digested).  I also was in dire need of a place to "rest", if you catch my drift, before hopping on a long, crowded bus ride across town in rush hour traffic.

How can you not love mcnuggets?  I just wish this location would pay attention to small details - like not forgetting to include the bbq sauce in my to to order.  They always seem to forget something - I should know better and check every time I order.
McDonald's are more or less the same.  Why give this one five stars?
worst. mcdonalds. ever. food was way over salted from the norm, well the mcdonalds norm, and the ice tea too sweet. i bet whoever prepared the food is a heavy chain smoker.
One-dollar menu!
The good - location is very close to AT&T park

Last time I had a meal of mcnuggets and fries from here half my body painfully went to sleep for half an afternoon.  Was it worth it?  Hell yes!  Can't get away from the Mickey D's, even if it shortens my life span a year per meal.

Hmmmn.... I don't mind it, I know if I eat here regularly I will die soon but it's on my way home so sometimes I sin. Let thee in glass houses cast the first stone or something like this. It is not In and Out but you can satisfy the hungry bunny's for a few bucks.... and a future stroke  or heart attack. I'll keep visiting every so often.

Always busy. This is the only fast food place around At&t park. So if one is trying to save a few bucks this is the place. They still have the Dollar Menu at a dollar unlike other stores making it $1.39.

I found myself writing a lot of 4 and 5 star reviews. I thought of McD's to write my first 1 star beat down. I've had enough good ground-beef burgers in my lifetime to consider a McD patty nothing more than a coaster. If I was 6 years old, I would probably whip out my gold crayons and draw 5 shiny stars on the paper place mat. But now I know better.

Why do you put your drive through intercom in front of the menu?  I can't decide what to eat if i can't read the freakin menu.  I guess i am the only fat ass that hasn't memorized the McDonald's menu.  dumb.
it's mcdonalds.  Went online to find out about store hours and saw reviews on Yelp for Mcdonalds....Mcdonalds.  Mcdonalds people.
The slowest McDonalds I have ever been. The food is consistent but come on! On top of which they got my order wrong too! It can't be that difficult to get an order of sausage and egg mcgriddle right.
My review is for all McDonald's EVERYWHERE.
2.1 Stars.
Its ok, on my way to work. Combo meals aren't really a good deal. Kind of expensive.
Visiting the sister we stopped by McDonald's for a McRib and some Chicken McNuggets at 10pm at night. Cheapest meal we had for our entire trip to SF.

This is a very small McDonald's restaurant and the free WiFi was not operating when I went there this afternoon for lunch. (I have the dreaded iPhone 4.)
Is it just my imagination, or does San Francisco really suck at having: a) drive-thrus, b) late-night spots, c) any sort of combination of the above?
Dont pass by here when their is a baseball game!!
